story:
UPDATE:  If we meet our goal by Friday, we'll raffle off one brand new 16GB WiFi iPad2 to those who donate $25 or more!

By 2014, it is estimated that there will be a latent market demand for wine of $86.71 million in Ethiopia alone. 

While Ethiopia is one of the world's fastest growing economies, nearly 30% of the population lives below the national poverty level.

What if a wine industry could be developed that helps meet the growing demand and helps alleviate poverty?

Enter SPARC Development...

SPARC Development is a new organization that is working to do just that.

 

Based on a feasibility study conducted by Emory University’s Goizueta Business School, our plan entails helping establish 2 cooperatives comprised of local Ethiopian farmers that will grow grapes and make wine of a high quality yet to be achieved in Ethiopia.

 

In September, Sandhya Deshetty, founder of SPARC, and Tom Shapland, SPARC's viticulture consultant, plan to travel to Ethiopia to begin interviewing farmers and conducting the site selection for the vineyards.  This trip is the just the beginning and your support will help us kick-start this ambitious endeavor!

 

The Impact

Our current priority is conducting the follow-up assessment trip to visit potential sites and further evaluate the growing conditions.  After selecting a site, we will then be able to identify what additional resources need to be secured to begin land preparation, begin planting vines and start instituting training programs for the farmers.

 

This trip is a critical next step that will allow us to design a comprehensive and detailed long-term plan, which we will use to target major funders and potential investors.

 

Who We Are

Sandhya Deshetty is a recent MBA graduate of Emory University's Goizueta Business School.  Terrified of being confined to a cubicle and frustrated by too many feasible solutions to poverty going overlooked, she founded SPARC Development to make sure that this particular idea is not wasted.  Sandhya is currently leading the overall logistics, planning, and fundraising for the Ethiopian wine project.

 

Tom Shapland is currently a PhD student in the Horticulture and Agronomy Graduate Group at University of California, Davis where he specializes in viticulture and biometeorology.  Tom will advise SPARC on the viticulture aspects of the project.  He is excited to be travelling to Ethiopia to learn more about the work that our potential partners have already done and will be integral in helping design the long-term plan.

 

Tom has worked in vineyard development and winemaking in California, Spain, and New Zealand and has taught classes in the UC Davis Department of Viticulture and Enology and the UC Cooperative Extension Program. He received his undergraduate degree at UC Davis in Viticulture & Enology and Classical Civilization.

What We Need

Our total goal for this phase of fundraising is $10,000.

 

While Sandhya and Tom are happy to be conducting this work on a volunteer basis, SPARC needs assistance to cover their travel expenses.


The estimated costs for this month-long trip are:
  • Flights:  $4,000
  • Food & Lodging:  $1,500
  • Visas:  $140
  • Ground Transportation & Translator (if necessary):  $1,000
  • Emergency Fund:  $500

 

Additional funds will cover other on the ground expenses for trip participants from Ethiopia, South Africa, and Kenya that will be helping guide us through site visits and any surveying materials that we may need.  When we return, the remaining funds will be used to design the marketing and fundraising materials needed to secure long-term funding.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the Word:  If you know of anyone who may be interested in learning more, send them our way.

 

And follow us, using the links below!

story:
NOLABRC is one step away from applying for 501(c)(3) status and we need your help! 

NOLABRC is a Louisiana not for profit participant-led charitable association promoting arts, education, and community enrichment. NOLABRC seeks to achieve its goals by applying the ten principles of Burning Man:  radical inclusion; decommodification; radical self-reliance; radical self-expression; communal effort; civic responsibility; leaving no trace; participation; and immediacy. 

We have been drafting our 501(c)(3) application to further our charitable causes and to achieve the most we can with our good deeds. The By-Laws, the Articles of Incorporation amendments, and the application are done and the last step is sending off the application to the IRS. We are asking for $500 dollars to cover the costs of the application, the costs of the filings in Orleans parish, and the cost of mailing it all out. The application is $400, the Orleans Parish filings $75, and that leaves $25 to get both sent by certified mail.

Once we achieve 501(c)(3) status your donations to us will be tax deductible! 

Thank you so much for your continual support. 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

We would love your input so if you would like to read the By Laws or the application please contact the team members.


Note: if there is an overage or any donations are unused, they will be added to the general fund and go toward future operating and fundraising expenses.

story:
Busy-Being is seeking a small monetary contribution to help grow and create new, great things with our vibrant community. Your contribution will help us launch a new series of community workshops aimed at being accessible to all. Members of the community are invited to jump in and use Busy-Being as a platform for sharing and creating on top of being an outlet and forum for creativity and collaboration. We are entering our busiest part of the year for the retail component of Busy-Being and your donations will help us to gear up and take the bull by the horns this season, directly impacting our ability to facilitate these workshops and utilize the shop as resource for the entire community. With your contribution and help in spreading the word you are supporting our continued dedication to cross pollinating these talented artisans on a local and national level and gain a stronger foothold in the retail market. 

About Busy-Being:

Tucked away behind the stacks of good things that populate Domy Books (a popular Austin bookstore), there is a hidden 10x10 treasure trove full of artwork, handmade goods, jewelry and crafts. Busy-Being is the brainchild of Amber Abramson, a California transplant who arrived to Austin in the summer of 2011. Abramson brings with her a keen eye and appreciation for craftsmanship, as well as a deep knowledge of artists and work, having spent the past 10+ years working in the Los Angeles art scene.

Busy-Being is a brick-and-mortar reincarnation of an online shop Abramson began in 2004 and has a charming history. After moving to Central Texas for a job, within three months, Abramson found herself without. Taking the opportunity to build something new, she pooled her resources and created a physical space around the concept of her online shop. Carrying the work of friends and artists she admires, Abramson has utilized her deep relationships within the art world to fill her retail space with items that have likely never been seen before in Austin. Additionally, her eclectic personal style populates the space and showcases unexpected works, like graphite drawings of pin-up gangster queens or showcasing intricate jewelry on the interiors of stylish terrariums.

(text by Kaci Borowski for Tribeza Magazine)

 

How you can help:

While your financial donations will get this project to full fruition, your help in spreading the word to friends and family is equally as valuable and appreciated just as much!

 

Thank you for taking the time to read this and for your consideration.

story:
HIS STORY:

My name is Cody Greenstein. I am a sophomore at the University of Delaware. On Monday October 29th, Hurricane Sandy hit my community of Breezy Point, Queens, New York with the full force of its destruction and devastation.  Breezy Point is a peninsula, just outside New York City; an extremely small but tight-knit and family-oriented community.

The storm caused catastrophic flooding, which in turn brought down power lines. The power lines sparked, creating a six-alarm fire that burned 111 homes to the ground on the ocean side of the peninsula. Homes in Breezy Point that remained standing, were damaged by flood waters, that either swept them fully off their foundations, or damaged them beyond repair. My home was one of those destroyed in the flooding.

My family is now trying to salvage my home, with no heat, electricity, and fresh water since Sandy hit. They expect to be without basic utilities for months. My family, relatives, friends, and neighbors have lost everything they love, faster than anyone can comprehend. However, I can’t help but feel this powerful sensation of hope for the future because of the outpouring of support.

Any little step that is taken to help my hometown, or any other coastal community affected by Sandy, is appreciated in every way possible by those of us who have been victims of this horrendous storm. The donations of money, canned food, clothing and other forms of aid have meant more than we can say.  Please continue to think of those who have been effected by the ravages of Hurricane Sandy after the memory of the horror fades and you go back to your daily lives.  

We will need your thoughts and prayers for weeks and months to come.

 

IMPACT

Your monetary contribution will go directly towards Cody, his family, and neighbors in Breezy Point, one of the communities hardest hit by Hurricane Sandy. Your donations will help them rebuild their homes and their lives.

Cody's parents are now living with his uncle, and are unable to determine the full extent of damage to their home, which is currently uninhabitable.  Breezy Point residents are still without heat, electricity, gasoline; and cell phone towers are down.  PLEASE HELP!

 

HOW YOU CAN HELP

Please make whatever monetary donation you can afford.  No amount is too small.

Click 'CONTRIBUTE NOW' on this page to make a donation.

Please pass this appeal along through Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, or by Email.

 

Cody and his family greatly appreciate any help you can give.  THANK YOU!

story:
THANK YOU, AND KEEP GIVING! 

REMEMBER: our online goal is $10,000 but our overall goal is $20,000. Let's keep going to give Ayah and her daughters a chance at life.  This site will keep accepting your donations until Jan. 9. 

Short Summary

My name is Maryam and I am a Syrian American with the majority of my family still in Syria. I started this campaign because a dear friend of mine, Ayah,* has been widowed and left alone with four orphaned girls and pregnant. She needs a roof over her head and I believe we can help her and her orphaned daughters.

A young family in Daraa, Syria was devastated on September 27th, 2012 when soldiers from the dictator Bashar Al-Assad's regime hunted and gunned down a young father whose only crime was attending protests against the regime. He left behind a pregnant widow, Ayah, and four young orphaned girls. The widow and orphan girls have nowhere to live. All their savings were diminished during the past year. The family had not been able to work because of the civil unrest in the country. Many times it was too dangerous to leave the house.

The total human toll has been heavy in Syria. This is a real Syrian family that is in immediate and desperate need. And we can help. So, let's help get this orphaned family a roof over their head!

Impact

Your donation helps save the lives of six people.  If we are able to achieve our goal, we will be able to get a shelter and food for four young orphaned girls in Syria and their pregnant widowed mother. You will have saved the lives of this family and give them a safe place to live while the country rages in civil unrest.  

What We Need

Our goal is to raise $20,000 for the family to find safe housing in Syria. We will start our campaign at $10,000 and hope we can reach $20,000.

We will keep campaigning until we reach our goal and find a safe place to live for Ayah and her family!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot make a contribution please help us get the word out!
  • Share the link to this campaign on your social media pages
  • Tell your friends and family members

*The names have been changed to protect the identity of the family from the regime.

story:
Hello! My name is Megan Malnar and I am a missionary living in Lusaka, Zambia.  In November of 2011, the Lord called me to be a mom to a Zambian boy.  Over the course of the next 6 months, I met my son, Elijah.  In August of 2012, he was placed into my home and since then, we have grown to be a mother and son. Every day I learn more and more about him.  I am without a doubt confident that Elijah and I were made for each other.   

Adoption is a beautiful display of the gospel. Adoption brings extreme glory to our King.  There are 143 MILLION reasons for a person to adopt.

Elijah was chosen by the Lord to live a life his current situation did not allow.  He was chosen to be my son. I am chosen to raise him in a culture of captivation for our Savior Jesus.

I first was called to Zambia to be a missionary, but now I'm also called to be a mom.  I raise support to sustain our every day, and the Lord is so very faithful bringing what we need financially each month.  However, being on a missionary salary leaves little to no room for saving for adoption costs.

I ask for you to financially partner with us to help Elijah have a forever home!  There is no amount to small to give. Your contribution will DIRECTLY change our family!!

 

Costs

The costs of adoption can vary from country to country.  Intercountry adoption (adopting outside of the U.S.) tends to cost anywhere from $3,000-$30,000, due to requirements from both countries, airfare for multiple visits to the country, accommodation while staying in country, and miscellaneous items that come up along the way.

In our case, Elijah's adoption will cost $7,500.

Expenses for the U.S. side of the adoption total to $3,500. Expenses for the Zambian side of the adoption total to the amount of $4,000. These costs include the following: home study, filing paperwork, fingerprints, immigrant visa, new passport and birth certificate, lawyer, court fees, airfare, readoption in the U.S. $2,000 of this amount is needed by October 27th!!

My goal is to raise the money by December 1st in order to eliminate any possible delays!  My hope is to finalize the adoption before we plan to come back to America in May 2013. However, many of the fees will need to be paid several months before we come home!

Every amount donated will go directly to the above needs!  If more money is donated than my goal, I plan to use it towards Elijah's schooling in Zambia, which is $3,000 a year!  He's in school now and flourishing!!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't give financially, but want to contribute to helping Elijah have a forever home, here are some ways you can help!

1. Get the word out!!  Tell friends and family our story! They may be able to give or they may know someone who can give!

2. PRAY!  Adoption is a long long process in Zambia.  Nothing is concrete and there are many delays in the process.  Please pray for a smooth process!

story:
Alternative relationships deserve a better dating app.

Don't get us wrong. We think there are some beautiful dating sites out there, but they're not ideal for those of us who don't fit the standard. We're kinksters, fetishists, polyamorists, sex-positive and open-minded, and we want our own app to help us meeting like-minded people for dating and snuggling and tying up (consensually).

  • Fetlife is a great hub for the kink community, but it's not a dating site.
  • OkCupid is beautifully designed with users in mind, but it's not exactly queer, trans+ or poly-oriented.
  • Apps like Grindr, Blendr and the rest target specific communities of people, and have limited features.

There's someone out there for everyone; even the swingers, kinksters, and asexuals of the world. We want to make it easier for you to find people you want to get with.

What We Need

The app has already been designed, and now we want to hire some great developers to make it happen on your smartphones. We're not satisfied with any of the other options on the market and believe that our product should be built with strict accessibility and usability requirements. That's why we need $20k to get started. Here's why.

  • We need $2k to conduct user experience research to make sure we're making a product people want.
  • $10k will cover the cost of developing a high-quality low-priced iPhone application. We believe in paying great developers to build a great product.
  • $8k will cover the cost of developing the Android application. Optimized for mobile, we promise the experience will stun you!

App Features

Cuffed has the following features:

  • Elegant and Simple. Beautiful, easy to use interface focused on keeping the important details clear, optimized for your mobile device.
  • Find someone close to you. Local results ranked by interest and match level.
  • Get the right match. The ability to extensively filter match lists based on age, kinks, interests, sexual orientations, and levels of experience.
  • Be yourself. A progressive database that lets you self-identify in the way you see fit.
  • Share the love. Add multiple relationships on your profile
  • Be Seen. Personal settings that let you easily filter who you want to see, and who you want to be seen by.
  • Stay Safe. Rock solid security. Your privacy is important to us.
  • Get in Touch. Private messaging that takes full advantage of your smartphone's native messaging capabilities.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Tell your friends! This is a kinky dating app that actually works. We need your support to make it happen.
  • Send us feedback. Ideas for a feature you'd love to use? Let us know.

Our Timeline

We're dedicated to making sure the product is everything you'd expect it to be.

  • September 2014: Acquire funding and support for the project, complete UI designs based on feedback and reviews.
  • October 2014 to December 2014: Develop App for iPhone and Android, reiterate based on early testing.
  • January 2015: Beta release 1 month prior to launch.
  • February 2015: Apps launch in the App Store (Permission pending) and on Google Play
story_txt:
Alternative relationships deserve a better dating app.Don't get us wrong. We think there are some beautiful dating sites out there, but they're not ideal for those of us who don't fit the standard. We're kinksters, fetishists, polyamorists, sex-positive and open-minded, and we want our own app to help us meeting like-minded people for dating and snuggling and tying up (consensually).
Fetlife is a great hub for the kink community, but it's not a dating site.
OkCupid is beautifully designed with users in mind, but it's not exactly queer, trans+ or poly-oriented.
Apps like Grindr, Blendr and the rest target specific communities of people, and have limited features.
There's someone out there for everyone; even the swingers, kinksters, and asexuals of the world. We want to make it easier for you to find people you want to get with. What We Need
The app has already been designed, and now we want to hire some great developers to make it happen on your smartphones. We're not satisfied with any of the other options on the market and believe that our product should be built with strict accessibility and usability requirements. That's why we need $20k to get started. Here's why.
We need $2k to conduct user experience research to make sure we're making a product people want.
$10k will cover the cost of developing a high-quality low-priced iPhone application. We believe in paying great developers to build a great product.

$8k will cover the cost of developing the Android application. Optimized for mobile, we promise the experience will stun you!

App Features
Cuffed has the following features:

Elegant and Simple. Beautiful, easy to use interface focused on keeping the important details clear, optimized for your mobile device.

Find someone close to you. Local results ranked by interest and match level.


Get the right match. The ability to extensively filter match lists based on age, kinks, interests, sexual orientations, and levels of experience.

Be yourself. A progressive database that lets you self-identify in the way you see fit.


Share the love. Add multiple relationships on your profile


Be Seen. Personal settings that let you easily filter who you want to see, and who you want to be seen by.

Stay Safe. Rock solid security. Your privacy is important to us.

Get in Touch. Private messaging that takes full advantage of your smartphone's native messaging capabilities.
Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:
Tell your friends! This is a kinky dating app that actually works. We need your support to make it happen.
Send us feedback. Ideas for a feature you'd love to use? Let us know.
Our Timeline
We're dedicated to making sure the product is everything you'd expect it to be.

September 2014: Acquire funding and support for the project, complete UI designs based on feedback and reviews.

October 2014 to December 2014: Develop App for iPhone and Android, reiterate based on early testing.

January 2015: Beta release 1 month prior to launch.

February 2015: Apps launch in the App Store (Permission pending) and on Google Play

story:
Coco Bans is a local catering company specializing in a variety of cuisines. We are now offering Spice Classes and going mobile to the streets of Richmond, VA, with our NEW Food Truck!

We urgently need your help to open the Coco Bans Bistro & Cigar Lounge in the Summer of 2014.


THE SPECIAL DEAL FOR THIS CAMPAIGN...

$100 gets you a free appetizer at our bistro, every single month, FOR LIFE!!! 

Here are some items from our menu:

  • Olive and Artichoke Tapenade
  • French Onion and Cheese Bruschetta
  • Fresh Oyster Stew with French Baguette
  • Grown Up Lobster Mac & Cheese
  • Chicken Curry with Steamed Cabbage and Rice
  • Crawfish and Arugula Salad Sandwich
  • Lobster Gazpacho with Crackers
  • Italian Lasagna with Bechamel Sauce
  • Sauteed Scallops on a bed of Creamy Risotto
  • Chickpea Salad with Cucumber and Cilantro
  • Shrimp and Strawberry Salad with Balsamic Vinaigrette


Have you ever wanted to reignite the spark in your relationship?  Wish you could turn Pork Chop Night into something your significant other will never forget?  Keep reading...

The Coco Bans Spice* classes include: 

  • Cooking with Aphrodisiacs - we will show you how to serve it up in a sensual way
  • Libido Boosting with Herbs - the key to gourmet love
  • Mixology Classes - learn to pour The Elixir and other cocktails to set the mood

*Adults 21 and over

The Coco Cigar Lounge will offer the finest cigars and liquors in a luxurious setting.  Light, up drink up and sit back and enjoy a game on the big screen TVs.  Our staff will be easy on the eye and have a good understanding do the cigar industry to assist you with your choices, if needed.

We will also offer a featured cigar of the month so you can try out new flavors.


We have found the perfect venue near VCU and hope to sign the lease on the bistro and open its doors in summer 2014.



Please follow us to see our progress.  We can show photographs of the new location once we are able to secure the lease.  Stay tuned for FAQ's and UPDATES.   Email us with questions and/or suggestions.

What is Coco Bans anyway?

Somewhere during the journey that Coco Bans' Owner, Dionne Bazile, took from Europe to North America, a favorite and delicious French meal got lost in translation.  Thus, Coq au Vin became Coco Bans.  Now, after almost 2 years of catering, Coco Bans needs its own kitchen, and your help! Why should you invest and become a part of this unique opportunity? 

Wouldn't it be fun to learn about food in a completely different way?  Do you want to add a touch of romance to your life?  Or do you need a new date night idea for you and your significant other?  What about a creative bridal shower party for the Bride-to-Be?

Join us at our classes and learn how to serve it up in a tantalizing way that won't be forgotten.

We can’t wait to see you there!

story:
We've extended our campaign to August 15…!

WorshipMob Vision:

The heart of WorshipMob is to raise up the children of God - to become the warriors we are - in Christ  … by His unfailing, unconditional, extravagant love, and His unfailing, unconditional, extravagant grace... To proclaim His truth to every person who will listen. To set the captives free and pour out living water to His precious people, with whom He is passionately in LOVE...

WorshipMob Need:

We have outgrown our current space and really need a larger location for our meetings and live recordings.  This is for both the good of the ministry and the health of the many servants here in Colorado Springs who have been faithful and obedient to what God has called them to carry.

WorshipMob Local and Global Impact

Locally, WorshipMob has:
   - 200 worshipers from over 30 local churches
   - 60+ join every Thursday night, from 7PM-midnight
   - over 20 HOURS of live worship audio & video (10 DVDs worth!)
   - shared all of this worship music for FREE
   - established a 501c3 non-profit, last year (tax deductible donations)

Globally, WorshipMob is impacting the world, through:
YouTube: www.youtube.com/braveworldcom/
   - Over 100 WorshipMob YouTube Videos
   - 6.9 Million YouTube Views
   - 39,000 subscribers, with 100+ new subscribers per day
   - 15,000 views per day, average
   - 100,000 minutes of WM worship are watched per day (3.7 million/month)

Facebook: www.facebook.com/groups/worshipmob/
   - 27,000 WorshipMob Facebook Group Fans
   - 50 new Facebook Group joins per day (average)
   - International community - US, Europe, Asia, Africa, Australia, S. America...
   - reaching the unchurched 15-35 age group with the power of Jesus
   - amazing daily reports of Holy Spirit empowered life change through WM

WorshipMob Mission

   - To locally unite worshipers from MANY diverse churches & denominations
   - To pray together, encourage each other, & worship Jesus, in spirit and truth
   - To record and produce worship for the world, and provide free access
   - To create a worship movement that unifies the global body of believers
   - To give God all of the glory!

John 4:24 "God is spirit, and those who worship Him do so in spirit and truth"


WorshipMob Testimonies

"I have been SO extremely blessed by your videos...I believe that there is a new style of worship that is beginning to break out all over the world.  Thank you so much!" - Dara R.

"The new music from WM is off the chain!  It continuously resonates with me and so many others I share it with..." - Guy W.

"...Ever since I stumbled upon your website info on Youtube, my worship experiences have not been the same. Your music puts me in tune with God and now I am even more intimate with Him. I have also shared your information with my room-mates, and since then, they became hooked. We call ourselves "The Mobbers"- for Jesus that is. God bless all your endeavors and may He continue using you to bless others. Your sister in Christ," - Racquel

"...I played "Arrested By Grace" at our House Church last night, and the presence of the Lord came in the room so heavy that folks were on their faces weeping, some were dancing and singing, others were in a Holy place... thanks for being obedient to the call that God has on your lives, you are transforming people's hearts through your worship!" - A.B.

"...I was soooo incredibly blessed after last Thursday night at WorshipMob.  All I can say is WOW.  I have been a worship leader for majority of my life and I was so encouraged to be surrounded by people who genuinely seek to lift high the name of Jesus." - Jacque K. (visiting worship leader)


A Word From WorshipMob's Founder - Sean:

In 2011, my family invested our life savings to start WorshipMob.  We took a dangerous risk - invested our savings & leveraged the equity in our home to create a professional recording studio, for this vision.  We felt God's leading to create a unifying worship setting that transcends denominational limitations - and to unite the global Body of Christ to collectively experience the deep, intimate, and life-giving relationship that only Jesus provides.  

Since that time, God's presence has completely enveloped our original space.  We're now bursting at the seams!  Since the inception of Worship Mob, our mission has always been to bring Holy Spirit saturated worship to the world.  We've done just that with the few unsolicited monthly donations that we've received, but our actual monthly expenses are not covered. ... yet we still continue to reach over 65,000 people (YouTube & Facebook) worldwide.  

It's our vision that our worship to God, Jesus, and the Holy Spirit, remain available for FREE - to everyone.  So I've maintained my full time engineering position to support my young family, and have spent thousands of after-hours - editing, producing and distributing our free worship.  We're now at a time of financial critical mass - where we need financial support.  So if God leads you to be a cheerful giver - then please do so.  God's Army is advancing!

You Are Part of WorshipMob!

Your help is the key to providing a dedicated building that will take this ministry to the next level.  Currently, only one third of our local body can gather to worship and magnify the presence of the Lord together.  With this new facility, all of our current members and many future members can attend and contribute together.

If you're unfamiliar with our work, then please review a few favorite YouTube tracks (links below).  There's only one person that can create such amazing worship - and his name is Jesus.  This ministry is part of God's Army, marching forward; unstoppable!  It's not about us - it's about Him.  But the great thing is that He uses each of us - you and me - to spread His love to those that need it so desperately.  You are WorshipMob, as much as we are!

Check out a few popular WorshipMob videos:
   - Oceans - http://youtu.be/POK2yIO914c - 380,000 views
   - Sinking Deep - http://youtu.be/5O1tlJ5D8VY - 148,000 views
   - Climb This Mountain - http://youtu.be/BuzZX2VWD-I - 158,000 views
   - Say Something - http://youtu.be/MgSmQdTJFIM - 148,000 views
   - many more like these on YouTube... a full 20 hours of worship!

About The Proposed New Building

Here's a video of the building we're pursuing - take a look!

Incredibly, this 6200 sq. foot facility is available for WM for just $350K.

Visions for new facets of ministry in this building:
  - More amazing worship experiences & recordings than ever
  - WM Community Center
  - Living space for up to 8 Interns
  - New creative WM projects
  - Home base for local street ministries and outreach
  - Home base for the global WorshipMob movement

Visions for new levels of worship experiences & audio/video capture:
  - 26x42 foot main worship room - holds up to 150 people
  - More unity in worship times vs. the current multiple isolated chambers
  - Over 100 singers & instrumentalists in the main worship room
  - More details below…

Next Level of Worship...

Don't limit your imagination to what you see in the photos or campaign video - envision what you've been watching of WorshipMob on YouTube, but bigger, more unified, and more empowered. 

Picture over 100 people worshiping together in a room, all with in-ear packs, so they're free to move, dance, sing, shout, or fall to their knees in adoration - lost in amazing connection to the Father, through the Holy Spirit.  

It's going to be, in one word - powerful. But only if YOU get involved!


The Goal

We're targeting $50K:  $35K as a 10% downpayment, and ~$15K to modify the building into a worship recording center, and to move our equipment there.

The Rewards

We believe our Father blesses us when we bless others.  We know you don't ask for rewards, but we want to thank you for partnering with us, with some perks!

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't give, please do a quick share, so we can get the word out.  To learn more about WorshipMob, visit www.worshipmob.com.

A movement is being born… to flood peoples' hearts with Father's love. Help us take this building and re-purpose it for amazing worship!

If you can't afford a $25 contribution, consider $5 or $10 - every dollar helps! It blesses us to give you free worship!  Join us, in the joy of giving.

story:
Greetings from Callie's Cuties Bake Shop!

It's been nearly 10 years since we first learned of our daughter Callie's life threatening nut allergy...nearly 4 years since the creation of Callie's Cuties Bake Shop...a few short months ago we took on our first commercial space and now, finally, we're adding a small retail space in front of our kitchen to better serve our nut-FREE families.

Our journey has been and continues to be an exciting, scary ride!  We've been working tirelessly to get our name out there in order to grow our new business and sustain our family.  We've gotten this far with the resources we had available to us but now, in order for our shop to continue our growth we need your help.  You see, our reserves have quickly dwindled as the development of the retail environment to our shop comes to it's completion.  But just as the retail storefront starts to come alive, we are in need of additional equipment, marketing dollars and cash reserves to sustain the business through the remainder of it's first year in a retail environment.  In the challenging economic climate we live in, only 1/2 of all small businesses will survive the 5 year anniversary mark.  We intend to be here for all our nut-FREE families and our community at 5 years and well beyond.

That's where all of you can step in and make a difference a BIG difference by supporting our fundraising campaign to help us raise the funds needed for growth. Every little bit will help.  You can also help by spreading the word about our campaign by sharing us on your Facebook page, Tweeting about us and forwarding the campaign link via email.


If you aren't familiar with our little shop in the outskirts of Chicago - let me share more about us.   We started this journey back in November, 2004 when we found out that our daughter Callie had a life threatening nut allergy.  After Callie's diagnosis, our world became terribly scary and the simple things in our lives disappeared like..."Where are we going to find a safe birthday cake for Callie's birthday's now?"  There wasn't a bakery in Illinois at the time that could make a safe cake for Callie.  That's when we decided that we would become a resource for families like ours.

What we can also tell you about us and this business is it has become our family's purpose in the world...we ARE this business everyday and we run it with the intention of making a joyful difference in the lives of other nut-FREE families around us as well as our local community, Plainfield, IL and the surrounding Chicago Western suburbs.  This is our first time around the block running a small bake shop business in a retail environment.  Yes, there are risks related to every new business in the crazy, unpredictable world we live in and our business is not exempt from the risk.  Every week, week in and out we are constantly striving to find more cost effective ways to run the business without risking safety and quality.  So, if our packaging changes now and again, you'll know that we are trying to be frugal!  

Our goal is to raise $10,000 to fund the following:

#1 - Additional used commercial convection oven 
#2 - Monthly marketing dollars 
#3- Lighting (and installation) over our new bake shop sign 
#4 - New/additional logo labels with ingredient listings  
#5 - Additional working capital for added storefront  
#6- Acrylic display cases to segregate our egg-FREE/dairy-FREE treats 
AND if we meet our goal 
#7 - Another used 20/30 Qt mixer 

We are consistently reminded how vital our goodies are to the community when terrified parents of nut allergic children step into our bakery for the first time.  We are reassured when they share with us their stories about how our little shop has helped them reclaim a measure of normalcy, simply by being able to buy a cake or cookie for their children's  birthday parties.  Our own family has walked that lonely road for some time now.  That we are able to serve others in this way is a privilege.

Thank you for taking time to hear a little bit of our story.  We hope that you can help us write the next chapter in what has already been an amazing journey.  We'll be baking up a storm to thank all of you for your contributions.  So get those taste buds primed and help us get the word out!!  We are counting on all of you to make this campaign successful, we can't do it without you! Feel free to use the handy IndieGoGo share tools to share our campaign with all your friends and family.

- READY, SET, FUND!  A big nut-FREE Thank you, Thank you, THANK YOU!

Yours,
The Meehan Family
(Laura, Tom, and Callie!)

That's where all of you can step in and make a difference a BIG difference by supporting our fundraising campaign to help us raise the funds needed for growth. Every little bit will help.  You can also help by spreading the word about our campaign by sharing us on your Facebook page, Tweeting about us and forwarding the campaign link via email.

If you aren't familiar with our little shop in the outskirts of Chicago - let me share more about us.   We started this journey back in November, 2004 when we found out that our daughter Callie had a life threatening nut allergy.  After Callie's diagnosis, our world became terribly scary and the simple things in our lives disappeared like..."Where are we going to find a safe birthday cake for Callie's birthday's now?"  There wasn't a bakery in Illinois at the time that could make a safe cake for Callie.  That's when we decided that we would become a resource for families like ours.
What we can also tell you about us and this business is it has become our family's purpose in the world...we ARE this business everyday and we run it with the intention of making a joyful difference in the lives of other nut-FREE families around us as well as our local community, Plainfield, IL and the surrounding Chicago Western suburbs.  This is our first time around the block running a small bake shop business in a retail environment.  Yes, there are risks related to every new business in the crazy, unpredictable world we live in and our business is not exempt from the risk.  Every week, week in and out we are constantly striving to find more cost effective ways to run the business without risking safety and quality.  So, if our packaging changes now and again, you'll know that we are trying to be frugal!  
Our goal is to raise $10,000 to fund the following:
#1 - Additional used commercial convection oven 
#2 - Monthly marketing dollars #3- Lighting (and installation) over our new bake shop sign #4 - New/additional logo labels with ingredient listings  #5 - Additional working capital for added storefront  #6- Acrylic display cases to segregate our egg-FREE/dairy-FREE treats AND if we meet our goal #7 - Another used 20/30 Qt mixer We are consistently reminded how vital our goodies are to the community when terrified parents of nut allergic children step into our bakery for the first time.  We are reassured when they share with us their stories about how our little shop has helped them reclaim a measure of normalcy, simply by being able to buy a cake or cookie for their children's  birthday parties.  Our own family has walked that lonely road for some time now.  That we are able to serve others in this way is a privilege.Thank you for taking time to hear a little bit of our story.  We hope that you can help us write the next chapter in what has already been an amazing journey.  We'll be baking up a storm to thank all of you for your contributions.  So get those taste buds primed and help us get the word out!!  We are counting on all of you to make this campaign successful, we can't do it without you! Feel free to use the handy IndieGoGo share tools to share our campaign with all your friends and family.- READY, SET, FUND!  A big nut-FREE Thank you, Thank you, THANK YOU!Yours,The Meehan Family(Laura, Tom, and Callie!)

story:
"Be the change you wish to see in the world"


I'm Lisa Marchesini and I opened Shala Yoga Center in 2010 to provide a space for a yoga community that was sorely needed in east county San Diego.  My big dream was to create a center where wellness practitioners would work co-operativly in an effort to provide quality affordable supportive health measures to all of you! After almost 5 years, the opportunity to provide such a space is in sight.  

As a mother, I know how hard it is to take time for myself, even to work, the guilt of it vs the very real threat of burn out. 

I'm teaming up with some amazing mamas. Judy Huang-Chetti , an amazingly talented acupuncturist and Adriana Walczewski, our own child enrichment guru. Our vision is to expand our schedule and open a treatment room for acupuncture and massage, that can transform into a childcare space for select classes. This will provide more options for all of you that need a break and are ready to reconnect  and heal physically and spiritually. We highly value our community and believe we offer a unique studio atmosphere to all of our members. 


What We Need & What You Get
The question we keep hearing – “Why a crowdfunding campaign?”  As a community studio, Shala Yoga Center wants to get you involved, and of course, offer you some amazing perks for your support. In addition to pursuing traditional forms of raising money, we want ensure that our community continues to play an active role in our growth. Our community is our single greatest asset and our single greatest source of strength, and we want our community and our partners to feel included in the Shala every step of the way. Not only are you getting some great perks for your donations, including t-shirts and tanks, water bottles, acupuncture, and more, but your donations are going directly to continue Shala's mission: to encourage you to  reach your mind-body goals… and grow with us. 






Challenges and Obstacles

Your good vibes and active promoting will help us, but we could still find bumps along the road. 

- First and foremost, we need funds to renovate and pay for the space. Paint,     furniture, toys and more. It all takes moola!

- Secondly, we need income for our staff. Teachers aren't guaranteed students in the first few months of new classes, but we believe they should be paid to come and teach a class, whether or not anyone shows up. They're dedicating more then the hour or so it takes to teach. They're: planning class sequences, commuting to and from and arranging childcare.We want to make sure our teachers stay dedicated to teaching you, so we need to promise them money.

 - Lastly, we need to make sure that not only are you contributing to our campaign, but that you are coming to class and taking advantage of our services. Bring your friends. Heck, Bring your enemies! Tell everyone you know!

In order to guarantee a successful launch and first few months, we need to raise at least $4000. If we don't reach our goal, we will still do our best to provide the community with affordable classes, treatments and childcare, but a wise man once said "There is no sense in getting stressed out trying to teach people how to be stress-free!"

We will co-operativly provide wellness services such as yoga, workshops, acupuncture, massage, birthing classes, personal training and scholarships. Child care will be available during select classes. 


The Impact

With your help we can build something meaningful for our community. We try to offer the best prices in San Diego for everyone including students, seniors, and parents!  We keep our rates affordable so that health and yoga can be accessed by many different people. Running this studio is a true labor of love.


Other Ways You Can Help

We know times are tight and sometimes funds are limited. You can still help by sharing our campaign with your friends and family and help us through social media to spread the word!

story:
Ring in 2015 Westfield Style!

Want something fun and local to do this New Year's Eve? Why not celebrate 2015 here in downtown Westfield with all your friends and neighbors?

This event is organized and run by volunteer Westfield residents just like you.

Get Ready for a Great Party

Our volunteer committee is laying plans to deliver a great New Year's Eve party to downtown Westfield. Food, live music, a road race and, of course, eagerly waiting for Westfield's iconic clock tower to strike midnight are just a few of the fun things we're considering.

The more support we get, the bigger and better the party will be. We're counting on you to pull together with us to make this happen.

Show Your Pride in Westfield

Not only is this a chance for you to have a good time, it's a great opportunity to help show support for our city and help build Westfield's reputation as a wonderful place to live.

What If We Fall Short of Our Fundraising Goal?

Hundreds of people across the city have shown great interest in this event so we don't expect to fall short of our goal. However, you should know that if we don't hit our goal this year, we will roll the money over for a celebration next year or scale down the size of the celebration this year. That will be up to our volunteer committee to decide.

Other Ways You Can Help

Along with donations, we're looking for people to join our committee and run the event on New Year's Eve. If you are interested, please visit go to http://newyearswestfield.com/volunteer and fill out the form.

story:
DOMINICAN REPUBLIC TOURISM    

      


 

              WHY AN INBOUND AGENCY FOR AND BY AMERICANS?


German, Italian, French, and many other tourists in DR have access to professional travel companies in DR that are owned and operated by their fellow country women and men, ensuring that they plan travel with professionals who understand them culturally--professionals they can trust.  These tourist do and see more for less—safely.

Americans, who travel in larger numbers to DR and spend more money in the economy than the next 3 groups combined, do not have access to such a travel agency in DR and are often “herded” on compound style resorts, so we started Discplora Trek Tours.



     HOW TO CLAIM COMPLEMENTARY USE (5 NIGHTS)  DOMINICAN                                                        REPUBLIC VACATION RENTALS

1) Claim our "Vacation Rental" perk for a $1 donation (perk listed on right).

2) Like us on Facebook and share this campaign on your timeline.

3) Read our special booking terms and conditions for the rental.

4) Contact us using the information below to reserve your slot for the rental.


                                                   ALL WE REQUIRE IS:


All travel services associated with your trip (flights, transfers, tours, etc.) MUST be either self-booked through our travel service page or by calling us directly at 818-748-8389 or call us locally at 1-829-459-2441 (International call, must dial 1).  You can also request service, including your vacation rental dates by email at info@dttoursdr.com 

The complementary 5 night vacation rental  must be used for travel between 6/29/15 and 7/2/17.  Booking period begins 1/5/15.   No blackout dates.  Reservations are first come, first served.


                                                        THE RENTALS

Below you’ll find photos of some of the vacation rental properties we’re making available by way of perks.  Additionally, we are currently working to renovate our first property due to open just ahead of mid-2015.  Though we have access to vacation rentals throughout the country we will only make rentals in the capital city of Santo Domingo available for this campaign.  All rentals will be located in the heart of the tourist zone—Zona Colonial.  These rentals will be equipped with modern and colonial style furnishing as well as amenities like Wi-Fi, cable, and Air-Conditioning.  We are accepting reservations for the Vacation Rental perk immediately.  Travel dates are 6/29/15 thru 7/2/17 and will be delivered on a first come first serve basis.  In order to administrate the delivery of this Vacation Rental perk efficiently and fairly, we have developed special booking terms and conditions.  Please read these conditions carefully before making your reservation to ensure that your request can be accommodated.  See more photos of rentals in the campaign gallery.


                             

                            


                           


                            


                            


     WHAT EVER YOU DECIDE TO DO TODAY PLEASE DO NOT LEAVE THIS              CAMPAIGN WITHOUT CONTRIBUTING AT LEAST A DOLLAR TO HELP US            BUILD A BETTER TRAVEL RESOURCE FOR AMERICANS IN THE DOM. REP.


PLEASE READ ON TO DISCOVER MORE ABOUT DISCPLORA TREK TOURS AND    WHAT WE ARE BRINGING TO THE DOMINICAN TRAVEL MARKET AND WHY



     

                         

During the first five months of 2014 approximately 1.9 million tourists visited the Dominican Republic through the country’s six international airports.

The country’s most important tourism market is by far the U.S., with a total number of 753,000 tourists visiting the country (37.7% of all arrivals, during that period). Other markets: Canada, 21.9% (436 thousand); France, 5.9% (116,000); Germany, 5.3% (104,000); Russia, 4.7% (94,000), and Argentina, 2.8% (55,000).

FACT CHECK:  

Number of U.S. Tourists Grows by 37% (stats)


  • The Dominican Republic receives more vacationers than any other country in the region, making it the #1 tourist destination in the Caribbean.  
  • Americans, by far, are the largest group of travelers to vacation the country every year.  

                               





                                  

                                              
BRIDGING CULTURAL GAPS AND LANGUAGE BARRIERS TO DELIVER A TRULY             AUTHENTIC AND MORE ENGAGING DOMINICAN EXPERIENCE 





 

U.S. TRAVELERS AND THE DOMINICAN RESORT


      MOST AMERICANS VACATION TO DOMINICAN REPUBLIC IN A HERD. 

Often overpaying for an inauthentic "Dominican Experience", while being trapped on some resort compound that looks and feels no different than a Florida beach destination.  Americans are sold on the idea that an all-inclusive resort package affords us value and variety when the truth is, that with the right guidance we can do and see more for less while experiencing true Dominican culture in natural environments.   Check out video below to get a glimpse of a cheap and inferior "Dominican Experience" in a salsa class that is offered by one of the most popular all-inclusive resort in the country:


      




    EUROPEANS AND OTHER TRAVELERS HAVE ACCESS TO LOCAL TRAVEL        PROFESSIONALS (AND COMPANIES) IN THE DOMINICAN REPUBLIC, WHO                         HAIL FROM THEIR OWN RESPECTIVE COUNTRIES.

Professionals who understand them culturally, professionals who speak their native language, professionals who they can trust to show them how to truly experience authentic local culture while spending less and doing more.  These type of travelers have the freedom and flexibility to choose their own dining and entertainment options with the likelihood that all options outside of a resort, will allow one to truly share in real Dominican culture.  Now check out this video for a glimpse of what it's like learning salsa outside of the herd, in a more intimate setting where you can actually go one-on-one with the instructor or even a willing local:

      


                               

OUR MISSION AND VISION

To build a resource and produce travel-related products, that will afford Americans the opportunity to more fully engage Dominican culture with the guidance of Dominican Republic based, American-travel professionals, who will embrace innovation, technology, and a philosophy of providing authentic experiences, to ensure American and English-Speaking travelers do and see more when vacationing Dominican Republic.  

         

          

 

Helping Us To Build, For Americans By Americans in                             the Dominican Republic


Campaign Objective:  Raise funds for our Santo Domingo start-up cost and to expand our travel services for American and English-Speaking travelers in the Dominican Republic.


Discplora Trek Tours is establishing a Santo Domingo-based operation.  Beginning February 2015, we will move beyond our usual business of solely advising, guiding, and booking travel to providing the following services in the Dominican Republic:

  1. Ground Transportation
  2. Vacation Rentals
  3. Personal Tour Guide Service 
We are raising funds for some general start-up expenses including:
  • Purchasing of multi-passenger vehicles for client transport services.
  • The renovation of our Santo Domingo office.
  • The renovation of our first vacation rental property.
  • Equipment, furniture, and reservation systems for our office.

       

    Our Efforts And The Work We've Done So Far

The base of our operation has been out of Los Angeles, CA for the past year, but we are now working to make our location in the capital city of Dominican Republic--Santo Domingo fully functional.  We have legally incorporated a business under Dominican Law (Check out our listing in the business section of the Dominican Republic Yellow Pages:  http://bit.ly/1vkXrKm )  and we have already developed extensive technology platforms and travel services to assist clients in planning more engaging Dominican Republic vacations.  Take a look at some snap shots of our company website and some of our social media sites.  Pay a visit to these sites to get a better sense of what we're trying to build for American and English-Speaking travelers in the Dominican Republic:


                                                   TECH SNAP SHOTS




                                     THE PERKS

 

                Experience The Dominican Republic                                           Outside of the Resort
SAMPLE OUR SERVICES FOR FREE:  For helping us to make our operation in Santo Domingo successful, we invite you to experience the Discplora Trek difference for yourself.  For your contribution, we have designed perks that will allow you to become one of the first clients to experience our new services, by giving you complementary access to our travel products in the Dominican Republic--including free room nights, airport transfers, driver/guide service and more.  For your convience we've included FAQs below to help answer some of the common questions concerning the perks.  Additionally, you can contact us directly with any questions or concerns by dialing (818)-748-8389 or e-mail us at info@dttoursdr.com  We'll be more than happy to speak with you about travel in the Dominican Republic and our campaign perks.



                              Risks & Challenges

The idea of a strictly inbound travel agency is not as common as we at Discplora Trek Tours feel it should be.  Our work will be difficult and challenging, but we are already seeing positive responses to our business concept and plans from both local travel suppliers in the Dominican Republic, as well as current and prospective clients.  Here's a look at a few of challenges we will face along the way:

  • Local labor laws and corresponding matters of human resources.
  • Bureaucratic legal processes for company registration.
  • Cultural barriers in business matters, including managing product delivery strategy with local suppliers.
  • Training of local employees.
  • Educating clients who are accustomed to utilizing out-bound travel agencies for the planning of international travel, on the benefits of using an inbound agency.  
Again, we have already organized our corporation under Dominican law and we are moving forward with some of the best tourism lawyers in the DR.  It will definitely be a challenge to train local employees to deliver the type of customer service expected by American travelers, but we have outlined a plan to identify the potential employees more suitable for our business model.  These employees will have a fluent command of the English language and significant knowledge of and experience with U.S. culture.  We are also planning major marketing campaigns to inform the current market of American travelers to the Dominican Republic (over 2 million vacationers) that there is now a professional travel company for and by Americans in DR.


                       Other Ways You Can Help

So you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:  Let's make sure other Americans know that there is now a travel company for and by American in the Dominican Republic.

  • You can also help us to grow this business by booking any type of travel through our company website with over 30+ of the most respected online travel booking companies in the U.S.--companies like Expedia, Orbitz, Travelocity, Hertz, Avis, and more.  The commissions that we receive from these suppliers will go directly towards start-up expenses for our office here in Santo Domingo.  Just visit our Travel Services Page at www.dttoursdr.com and click the links of the service providers you know and trust.
  • Visit and Like our Facebook page www.facebook.com/DTTOURS In fact visit us and follow us on all of our social media pages:    Twitter       YouTube       
  • Remember, SHARE, SHARE, SHARE:  After you donate share your personalized link wherever you can and as often as you can until November 11th, 2014.
  • Above all we encourage you to write us at info@dttoursdr.com and tell us what you think about the idea of an inbound-travelagency based in Dominican Republic designed for and by Americans as well as English speaking travelers.  Please share ANY ideas about what you would like to see from such a service.

    EUROPEANS AND OTHER TRAVELERS HAVE ACCESS TO LOCAL TRAVEL        PROFESSIONALS (AND COMPANIES) IN THE DOMINICAN REPUBLIC, WHO                         HAIL FROM THEIR OWN RESPECTIVE COUNTRIES.Professionals who understand them culturally, professionals who speak their native language, professionals who they can trust to show them how to truly experience authentic local culture while spending less and doing more.  These type of travelers have the freedom and flexibility to choose their own dining and entertainment options with the likelihood that all options outside of a resort, will allow one to truly share in real Dominican culture.  Now check out this video for a glimpse of what it's like learning salsa outside of the herd, in a more intimate setting where you can actually go one-on-one with the instructor or even a willing local:
      

                               


OUR MISSION AND VISION
To build a resource and produce travel-related products, that will afford Americans the opportunity to more fully engage Dominican culture with the guidance of Dominican Republic based, American-travel professionals, who will embrace innovation, technology, and a philosophy of providing authentic experiences, to ensure American and English-Speaking travelers do and see more when vacationing Dominican Republic.  

         
           

Helping Us To Build, For Americans By Americans in                             the Dominican Republic



Campaign Objective:  Raise funds for our Santo Domingo start-up cost and to expand our travel services for American and English-Speaking travelers in the Dominican Republic.

Discplora Trek Tours is establishing a Santo Domingo-based operation.  Beginning February 2015, we will move beyond our usual business of solely advising, guiding, and booking travel to providing the following services in the Dominican Republic:


Ground Transportation
Vacation Rentals
Personal Tour Guide Service 

We are raising funds for some general start-up expenses including:


Purchasing of multi-passenger vehicles for client transport services.
The renovation of our Santo Domingo office.
The renovation of our first vacation rental property.
Equipment, furniture, and reservation systems for our office.






       

    Our Efforts And The Work We've Done So Far
 
The base of our operation has been out of Los Angeles, CA for the past year, but we are now working to make our location in the capital city of Dominican Republic--Santo Domingo fully functional.  We have legally incorporated a business under Dominican Law (Check out our listing in the business section of the Dominican Republic Yellow Pages:  http://bit.ly/1vkXrKm )  and we have already developed extensive technology platforms and travel services to assist clients in planning more engaging Dominican Republic vacations.  Take a look at some snap shots of our company website and some of our social media sites.  Pay a visit to these sites to get a better sense of what we're trying to build for American and English-Speaking travelers in the Dominican Republic:


                                                   TECH SNAP SHOTS










                                     THE PERKS
 
                Experience The Dominican Republic                                           Outside of the Resort


SAMPLE OUR SERVICES FOR FREE:  For helping us to make our operation in Santo Domingo successful, we invite you to experience the Discplora Trek difference for yourself.  For your contribution, we have designed perks that will allow you to become one of the first clients to experience our new services, by giving you complementary access to our travel products in the Dominican Republic--including free room nights, airport transfers, driver/guide service and more.  For your convience we've included FAQs below to help answer some of the common questions concerning the perks.  Additionally, you can contact us directly with any questions or concerns by dialing (818)-748-8389 or e-mail us at info@dttoursdr.com  We'll be more than happy to speak with you about travel in the Dominican Republic and our campaign perks.







                              Risks & Challenges
  The idea of a strictly inbound travel agency is not as common as we at Discplora Trek Tours feel it should be.  Our work will be difficult and challenging, but we are already seeing positive responses to our business concept and plans from both local travel suppliers in the Dominican Republic, as well as current and prospective clients.  Here's a look at a few of challenges we will face along the way: 
Local labor laws and corresponding matters of human resources. Bureaucratic legal processes for company registration.
Cultural barriers in business matters, including managing product delivery strategy with local suppliers.
Training of local employees.
Educating clients who are accustomed to utilizing out-bound travel agencies for the planning of international travel, on the benefits of using an inbound agency.  


Again, we have already organized our corporation under Dominican law and we are moving forward with some of the best tourism lawyers in the DR.  It will definitely be a challenge to train local employees to deliver the type of customer service expected by American travelers, but we have outlined a plan to identify the potential employees more suitable for our business model.  These employees will have a fluent command of the English language and significant knowledge of and experience with U.S. culture.  We are also planning major marketing campaigns to inform the current market of American travelers to the Dominican Republic (over 2 million vacationers) that there is now a professional travel company for and by Americans in DR.


                       Other Ways You Can Help So you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:  Let's make sure other Americans know that there is now a travel company for and by American in the Dominican Republic. 
You can also help us to grow this business by booking any type of travel through our company website with over 30+ of the most respected online travel booking companies in the U.S.--companies like Expedia, Orbitz, Travelocity, Hertz, Avis, and more.  The commissions that we receive from these suppliers will go directly towards start-up expenses for our office here in Santo Domingo.  Just visit our Travel Services Page at www.dttoursdr.com and click the links of the service providers you know and trust.
Visit and Like our Facebook page www.facebook.com/DTTOURS In fact visit us and follow us on all of our social media pages:    Twitter       YouTube        Remember, SHARE, SHARE, SHARE:  After you donate share your personalized link wherever you can and as often as you can until November 11th, 2014.
Above all we encourage you to write us at info@dttoursdr.com and tell us what you think about the idea of an inbound-travelagency based in Dominican Republic designed for and by Americans as well as English speaking travelers.  Please share ANY ideas about what you would like to see from such a service.

story:
Welcome to the Inner Sunset Sundays 2012 fundraising page!

Inner Sunset Sundays’s mission is to create a temporary public gathering space – in the style of a traditional plaza – in which people live and community flourishes.

We imagine a place of play, music, song, dance, people-watching, local merchants, skill-sharing, art and culture, history, theater, discussion and debate, and community-building; somewhere people can become whole and live life to the fullest.

In 2011, the second annual Inner Sunset Street Fair (Inner Sunset Sundays's previous name) was attended by over 5,000 and declared a fantastic success by all. Join us this year!

But we're not resting on our laurels - this year things will be different. In 2012, there'll be FOUR events (tentatively September 9th, October 14th, November 11th, December 9th) on one block (Irving St between 9th and 10th Avenues). This will allow us to bring people together more often and to try many more ideas than before.

To do this is going to take the whole community’s support

Although we depend as much as possible on people supporting the event out of kindness rather than profit, there are still a lot of costs. Even without City fees we estimate our costs to be at least $13,000.

Your contribution will be critical to making this event possible. Please give whatever you can afford! We had tremendous success at the 2010 and 2011 events - this year it could be even better. But only with your help.

It's easy to donate. Just click the Donate button on the right and you'll be done in a minute or two. If you can't donate, please forward the the link to this page to friends and neighbors and encourage them to donate.

Thank you!

Thank you!

story:
Keeping A Promise

My name is Jennifer Nelson, my brother-in-law Mark Parker passed away on April 5, 2012 after a motorcycle accident that caused severe brainstem damage.  While he was in a coma in the hospital, I made a promise to him that no matter what happened I would make sure Julie and the boys were taken care of.  So, I am starting the Parker Family Fund in honor of that promise to Mark Anthony Parker.  He not only left behind my 24 year old sister, Julie, but their two boys ages 2 and 4 years.  Those boys will slowly with time come to realize more and more the reality of the fact that they will never see daddy come home and that's a burden this family will have to bear for the rest of their lives.  The least any of us can do is help Julie get her family back on their feet, and that's what this fund is all about.

What We Need & What Your Donations Will Aid In

I know we have a goal of $8,000 and honestly that would be great, but any amount we are able to raise will be a tremendous help to this wounded, healing family.  Below is a basic list of what their needs are, and what the donations will be helping cover:

  • Pay Rent and Bills
  • Remaining balance of funeral and burial of Mark
  • Buy Food, Diapers, Necessities
  • Help in Fixing or Replacing Julie's Car
  • Childcare
  • Any other needs or one(s) that may arise

The Impact

Every cent will go straight to the Parker Family.    No one can truly take the burden of being a young widow with two sweet boys that will grow up without their loving daddy, eventhough that's my greatest desire.  Julie already has so much on her mind, and soul, and definitley with her strength to keep going for her boys I want to ask for help to take the financial worries out of that long list for her.  Even if only for a short while.  Everyone who donates is helping make that possible for her.  

Money Isn't the Only Way To Help

Trust me, I understand when you don't even have a $1.00 to give, but the power of word of mouth can be extremely powerful.  Please be sure to pass this along in anyway you can.  Prayer is also an amazing power that even with my belief I will never understand, but I know it makes a difference as well.  So I ask that you keep the Parker family in your thoughts and prayers as well.  Start a prayer chain if that's something you felt led to do as well.

story:
+ + + + + + + + + +        ENGLISH        + + + + + + + + + +

 

OUR STORY

The everyday wine drinker buys its booze in the grocery store and often makes really profound decisions: Red? White? Rosé? Okay, maybe I am exaggerating here and our interested customer knows about the region and the grape too.

But in the supermarket alone are hundreds of bottles and the sales clerk is not really helpful, since he drinks only beer or his qualifications are probably specialized on cleaning agents. Choosing a bottle of wine can be something for gamblers! Rien ne va plus - let the games begin!

Too exhausting! So let’s pay a visit to our local wine dealer. Ups, … travelling there the can be a real vacation, since not everybody has really a local dealer. Anyway, finally there, we get a lot of information about terroir, tannic acids, varietal and many other things to know from the well informed sales person (aka. “wine nerd”).  

“But hey, can I have a little booklet about all the things you just mentioned? No? Okay … very sad, since tomorrow I won’t remember a thing of what you just said! Actually, I just want a simple bottle of wine. You choose for me and I am outa here!”

Does this experience sound familiar to you? Great, so listen up: 3grapes.com takes you on an unforgettable guided journey to the world of wine - without leaving you house.

In our comfortable subscription package we will deliver you once a month two bottles of wine and a booklet with many interesting, some funny background information about what you get, where it is from and who produces it. Come with us to a journey you will never regret!

We bring color to your life: red, white and rosé!                                                                      

WHO WE ARE

On uncountable trips through Italy, France and Spain, we discovered many small and even smaller vineyards producing extraordinary wines where you feel the glowing afternoon sun on your tongue! But the sad thing is, you won’t get those great wines here - not in the store, (and oh wonder!) not even in the internet.

Those family owned wineries don’t have access to the established whole sales channels since the production quantities are just too small and the trading structures are just too rigid. As a result in our supermarkets we only get the high margin, mainstream mediocrity.  

With our project, we want to support those great small companies, keeping the diversity alive and introduce you to tastes from rural landscapes without big names.

WE NEED YOUR HELP

Since our professional roots are in the online business, we have an established network of marketers and agencies and have furthermore many ideas how to promote our story. And since there is a life after work, we have travelled the world, tasted a lot of wines and have built up relations with many wine markers across Europe.

But doing the marketing means spending money! We have put our bucks together and counted. But it is just not enough for the initial investments in logistics infrastructure, inventory and marketing.

So we need your help! But we do not want your money as a gift. That’s why all our perks are laid out that you buy one of our wine subscription packages and pay in advance. The more money you spend, the more wine you will get!

But we would also be thankful when you support us without spending money on our wine boxes! Just tell everybody about our startup - the more people hear from us, the more likely we get our funds together!

WE SAY THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU

With buying a wine subscription now via our indiegogo perks, you will conquer our hearts and support our startup dream and all the great but small winemakers behind us. Thank you!

 

           + + + + + + + + + +        DEUTSCH        + + + + + + + + + +

 

UNSERE STORY

Der "Alltagsweintrinker" kauft seinen Wein im Supermarkt und entscheidet nach rot, weiß oder rosé, nach Trockenheitsgrad und nicht zuletzt nach Etikett und Flaschenform - vielleicht noch nach Region, Traube und "Terroir".

Bereits im Supermarkt reihen sich jedoch oftmals viele Flaschen aneinander und das Personal hat leider wenig Ahnung in Sachen Wein (ist aber vielleicht bei Putzmitteln besser informiert). Rien ne va plus: Das Glücksspiel beim Griff ins Weinregal beginnt!

Also gehen wir lieber gleich in den beratungsorientierten Weinfachhandel. Ups, in ländlichen Gebieten ist allein das schon eine kleine Urlaubsreise. Sind wir endlich da, sehen wir den Wein vor lauter Flaschen nicht! Zum Glück gibt es einen informierten Verkäufer (aka. „Wein-Nerd“), der uns nicht vollends als önologischen Dummkopf dastehen lässt.

Nach anregenden Vorträgen über Ausbau, Tanningehalt und Abgang sind wir verwirrter als zuvor! War zwar irgendwie interessant, aber merken konnte ich mir das alles nicht – gibt’s das nochmal zum Nachlesen? Nein? Schade! Eigentlich wünsche ich mir einfach eine Flasche guten Wein. Einen der mir schmeckt ...

Oh je, wenn’s Dir auch so geht, dann pass jetzt auf: 3grapes nimmt Dich mit auf eine Erlebnis- und Entdeckungsreise in die geheime Welt des Weins.

Im praktischen Wein-Abo erhältst Du jeden Monat zwei ausgesuchte Flaschen Spitzenwein von einem Geheimtipp-Weingut aus der alten Welt. Dazu gibt’s im beigefügten Booklet teils spannende, teils witzige Hintergründe über den Wein, den Winzer und das Weingut.

Dein Alltag ist eintönig genug! Wir bringen Farbe in Dein Leben: rot, weiß oder rosé!

WER WIR SIND

Auf unzähligen Reisen durch Italien und Frankreich haben wir viele kleine und superkleine Weingüter entdeckt, die tollen Wein herstellen und lokal vermarkten. Daher gibt’s diese Weine leider weder im Supermarkt, noch beim lokalen Weinhändler und -echtes Wunder- nicht einmal im Internet!

Diesen familiär geführten Weingütern sind die etablierten Großhandelsstrukturen leider verschlossen. Weil Abnahmebedingungen zu starr, Produktionsmengen zu klein und damit internationaler Vertrieb einfach zu teuer wird.

Wir wollen diese lokale Vielfalt erhalten und diesen Weinproduzenten den Weg nach Deutschland öffnen, in dem wir sie in der Direktvermarktung über Wein-Abos promoten. Denn dieser exklusive Vertriebsweg direkt zur interessierten Zielgruppe (z.B. Dich) bringt für alle Vorteile: Du bekommst regelmäßig echte Wein-Geheimtipps und der Winzer erschließt sich einen neuen Kundenkreis. Wir kümmern uns um Vermarktung und Logistik, die im Abo planbarer und kostengünstiger wird.

DAMIT DAS KLAPPT, BRAUCHEN WIR DEINE HILFE         

Wir haben die ersten guten Kontakte zu den Winzern vor Ort, und weil wir selber aus der Online-Vermarktungsecke kommen, auch die Erfahrung, Kontakte und Ideen zur Vermarktung.

Doch diese Vermarktung und der erste Einkauf der Ware beim Winzer kosten Geld. Leider sind die Winzer finanziell selber nicht so ausgestattet, dass sie uns die Ware in Kommission geben, also müssen wir sie kaufen. Dazu werfen wir selbst unser Erspartes in einen Topf, doch dadurch ist er noch nicht ganz gefüllt!

Wir brauchen also Dein Investment für die Finanzierung des ersten Warenbestandes und Geld für Adwords und andere performanceorientiere Vermarktungswege.

Aber wir wollen Dein Geld nicht einfach so! Unsere Perks (das sind die indiegogo Beteiligungspakete) sind alle so gestrickt, dass Du eigentlich ein Wien-Abo bei uns bestellst und im voraus bezahlst. Das verschafft uns die nötige Liquidität für den Start und Du bekommst im Gegenwert tollen Wein direkt zu Dir nachhause geschickt.

Aber Du kannst auch anders helfen: Erzähle allen von unserem Projekt, poste es auf Facebook und schreibe über uns in Deinem Blog, Deinem Newsletter oder Twitter.

WIR SAGEN: DANKE, DANKE, DANKE!

Mit einem kleinen Investment kannst Du Teil einer von Euphorie und Erfolgslust getriebenen Story werden. Und wenn wir unser Ziel erreichen, laden wir Dich als Supporter zu unserer „1.000ster Kunde Party“ ein und Du bist hautnah dabei, wenn wir Danke sagen!
