Dazu werfen wir selbst unser Erspartes in einen Topf, doch dadurch ist er noch nicht ganz gefüllt!
Wir brauchen also Dein Investment für die Finanzierung des ersten Warenbestandes und Geld für Adwords und andere performanceorientiere Vermarktungswege.
Aber wir wollen Dein Geld nicht einfach so! Unsere Perks (das sind die indiegogo Beteiligungspakete) sind alle so gestrickt, dass Du eigentlich ein Wien-Abo bei uns bestellst und im voraus bezahlst. Das verschafft uns die nötige Liquidität für den Start und Du bekommst im Gegenwert tollen Wein direkt zu Dir nachhause geschickt.
Aber Du kannst auch anders helfen: Erzähle allen von unserem Projekt, poste es auf Facebook und schreibe über uns in Deinem Blog, Deinem Newsletter oder Twitter.
WIR SAGEN: DANKE, DANKE, DANKE!
Mit einem kleinen Investment kannst Du Teil einer von Euphorie und Erfolgslust getriebenen Story werden. Und wenn wir unser Ziel erreichen, laden wir Dich als Supporter zu unserer „1.000ster Kunde Party“ ein und Du bist hautnah dabei, wenn wir Danke sagen!

story:
About the Mullen Family

The Mullen Family has been very active in the River Oaks, Westworth Village, and Castleberry Communities. Bob has served on the Castleberry school board for 10 years, served as a police chaplain for Westworth Village, and was the minister at Westworth Church of Christ for 15 years. Terri has worked for Castleberry schools for 15 years. She currently teaches at Castleberry High School where she heads the yearbook staff and Future Business Leaders of America club. In the past she has volunteered her time for Castleberry Band Boosters, Castleberry Theatre Department, Castleberry Athletic Boosters, and served as class sponsor for the class of 2011 and 2009. Bob and Terri have 4 daughters who attended Castleberry schools and volunteered at school and in the community.     

 Our Goal

On March 26, 2013 their home was broken into by thieves. Thankfully no one was at home or hurt but they did steal several small electronics, sentimental jewelry, and caused damage to the home. Although the sentimental things can't be replaced, we can help repair the damage to the home and try to replace a few of the items stolen. The loss is estimated at $3,000 - $4,000 so any ammount you can give will help. 

 The Impact

We also want to send a clear message to the community that theft will not be tolerated. This is a family of hardworking people who have given so much to this community, you can take their belongings but you can never take away their giving spirit.   

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this with your friends on facebook and above all talk to people in the community about the issue. We hope to keep other homes free from theft.

story:
IMAGINE A GLOBAL TALENT SHOW!!

Hi my name is Donovan, an entrepreneur with a passion for technology and people.
Have you ever wished you could be the star in a talent show?

Six months ago i set out to create an application for all the talented people of the world to showcase their talents.
It is my goal and the vision of viraltalent to be the chosen place where artists and entertainers can post their talents and abilities for
the rest of the world to vote and choose their favourites.

 

When i hear of a success story of someone that made an impact on this world due to their talent it instantly sparks my interest.
I am creating a place where dreams have a chance at reality, and where the audience gets to vote who is popular and who goes viral.

 

I have worked with developers in my team to create an application for the IOS app store at phase 1. With your help i can launch phase 2 of the application and start the android version of the app so that more people in the world can showcase their amazing talents.

I have a woking prototype of viraltalent coded for the iPhone and i need your help to put the finishing touches on it so i can release it to the world.

Simply put viraltalent is an application for users to post videos of their amazing talents. 
People then can vote for the video to go viral and the user gains score.
A Global talent show.

 

 I have formulated a few perks as a show of my appreciation. Even the smallest pledge will make a difference and just by spreading the campaign details you can make a difference. 

 

Thank you so much for your support.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Fully patented all rights reserved viraltalent 2013

story:
About Us

Hi! We're Chris and Kristin, Virginia natives that have been living in Panama for the past four years. We originally came to Bocas del Toro, Panama for SCUBA diving and have since fallen in love with this wild and beautiful Caribbean archipelago. Over the past two years, we have dedicated ourselves to creating a place for people to stay on the beach that coexists with the incredible nature that is found on the jungle island of Bastimentos.  The result of our efforts is an eco-friendly luxury camping resort called Palmar Tent Lodge. Palmar is a place where you can really experience the natural side of Bocas as you spend your days lounging on beautiful Red Frog Beach and your nights falling asleep to the peaceful sounds of the jungle and the rhythm of breaking waves.  Activities abound, from hiking the trails of Bastimentos Island, exploring the surrounding beaches and reefs, flying the sky on a canopy tour or just relaxing in a hammock with a cocktail.  There is something here for everyone.

Accommodations at the lodge range from cozy and comfortable private safari style tents to spacious 6 person shared dorm tents or for those who want an authentic camping experience, we have campsites where you can pitch your own tent. The tent lodge opened in October 2012 and has been so successful in it's first year that we have already added more tents for 2013 so that we can accommodate more guests, including groups of up to 30.  In our second year, we want to focus on promoting the lodge for group events, especially retreats. We already have one yoga retreat scheduled and have spoken with numerous other coordinators that are interested in hosting wellness retreats in the beautiful, tranquil setting that we have right on the edge of the jungle on Red Frog Beach. We also have been fielding inquiries from those who want to plan their dream Caribbean beach wedding at the lodge.

Our biggest issue for actually securing more of these events is that we are still lacking a structure that we can offer our clients to use during their retreat for the practice of yoga, meditation, or any other activity requiring a large, open space.  We are ready to start marketing ourselves as a retreat destination but need YOUR help to fund the last piece of the puzzle.  In return, we would love to share our beautiful lodge with you!

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise at least $10,000 for permits, materials and labor to complete the basic structure. We would like to build a 24’x24’ wooden platform with a roof to protect from the tropical rains in the area. We plan to use Nispero, a locally sourced lumber that is extremely durable and holds up well in the humid climate and also resists other threats such as termites. Building on the islands is no easy task and there are many added costs when you are constructing “off the grid”.  For example, due to our remote location, the costs just to transport the wood to the lodge will be at least  $650. After the lumber is hand cut by chainsaw, it is loaded into a massive dugout canoe (called a cayuko) to bring it by water to our dock. From there, we will need to pay at least 20 of the local men to help haul the heavy wood a half a mile across the island to the building site. When building begins, all power tools need to be run off of a generator because solar power (our main power source at the lodge) cannot support the amount of electricity needed to run power saws and drills.

Other items that we would like to include if we are able to raise enough money beyond the initial $10,000 for the structure are:

-Custom rain curtains so that even in the windiest rainstorms, you could still be dry and comfortable inside.

-a custom yoga-art sculpture by a local artist carved out of an old tree trunk by chainsaw, similar to those we have in the great house of the tent lodge

-a small storage closet area for yoga mats and other supplies

-solar powered lighting for nighttime use

-a solar powered stereo system

-A massage table and curtains to utilize the space for massages on a daily basis.

What's in it for you? We have an amazing place to offer you for your next vacation, destination wedding or retreat! Panama was named the #1 place to go in 2012 according to the New York Times and is only getting better in 2013 so what are you waiting for? Your donation pays for your tropical vacation! For smaller donations, we are happy to share some of our Palmar gear with you from stickers to drink coozies to hats!

All funds raised will go towards the construction of the yoga structure and the landscaping of the surrounding area whether or not we meet the $10,000 goal.

What this means for us...

The completion of this structure will allow us to share our incredible island lodge with many like-minded people who are seeking a relaxing retreat away from the craziness of the everyday world. You can unplug from your fast paced life and instead get in tune with the natural rhythms of the waves, bugs, bird and wind.  We are excited about the possibilities that await us for hosting retreats and other events in our new event structure. We also often host volunteer yoga instructors and this will enable us to offer classes at any time, rain or shine, to our guests!

We have experience in island construction, as witnessed by the existing lodge, and have proven to be successful with our marketing and customer service as well. The lodge stays over 80% full for the majority of the year and is usually completely booked during high season. We are one of the top-ranked accommodations in our area on TripAdvisor and genuinely care about our guests and their experience with us.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Do you know a yoga instructor that would like to plan a tropical retreat? Have a friend that is dreaming of a destination wedding on a Caribbean beach? How about someone who just needs a vacation? Send them the info for our campaign and their donation can go towards their trip, wedding or retreat at Palmar Tent Lodge!

You can also help out by sharing our campaign with your friends on facebook & twitter! Check out the links above!

story:
Short Summary

What happens when you combine the connective power of the internet with the passionate community of soccer players and fans that numbers in the billions worldwide? At Cleats for Bare Feet (C4BF), we believe it is the opportunity to re-imagine what it means to give and receive a donation in the 21st century!

The funds from this campaign will allow the creation of a platform that will leverage the collaborative capabilities of the web in order to connect the following three groups anywhere in the world:

1. People who have second-hand sporting equipment or cleats to donate.

2. Players, organizations or schools who need cleats and sporting equipment.

3. People who can take cleats abroad while on their travels around the world.

The web platform will solve the distributive difficulties associated with sending equipment to those in need (it's super expensive), and it will also re-imagine the typical donation process as a more interactive and enriching experience. Users will be able to track their cleats as they travel the world, discover the impact they are making and connect with others through the love of the game.

What We Need and What You Get

We need $50,000. While that may sound like a lot, developing a web platform that will be able to function as a charitable social network won't be easy. The website will have to coordinate the efforts of people all over the world who want to connect through the most universal games.

Since we are not crazy smart computer programmers, we will be hiring a third party company to make this dream a reality. The perks in this campaign will allow you to become one of the first members of a unique online community.

But Wait... These Are Just Soccer Cleats. What's the Big Picture?

Sure, giving a pair of cleats to a child in need won't feed him or change his financial situation at home. However, you've never seen anything quite like the smile of a young player as he laces up his first pair of cleats. Your cleats are of means of unlocking the potential within every child who dreams of handling the ball like a pro.

However, more importantly, #socialgiving through C4BF is a means of communicating with the world through a sport that defies all barriers of interaction. The amazing thing about soccer is that you can travel anywhere in the world and regardless of the language or cultural barriers, as soon as a soccer ball comes out everyone has a way of interacting with one another through that common bond. If we mean to make the world a more equal and better place, we have to start by communicating with one another. What better way to start than through a passion so many of us share and a bond we all understand?

Whether you're a player, die hard soccer fan or simply a traveler who likes to meet and connect with new people, #socialgiving through C4BF is something you have to experience.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute financially? That's okay! Visit our website www.c4bf.com and you'll learn about plenty of other opportunites to help. You can organize a collection in your community and if you're traveling anywhere this summer, we would love to send you with a suitcase of soccer equipment bound for a school, team or organization near your accommodations abroad.

Also, any facebook post, tweet or email on our behalf would be a HUGE help. Copy and paste our campaign link and help spread the world about #socialgiving and our goal to re-imagine the donation process in the 21st century!

Cleats for Bare Feet History

C4BF was formed in 2009 after Social Entrepreneur Keith Meyers (owner of HRB Movement) visited Kenya and noticed that although soccer was the favorite sport, none of the children had cleats to wear. Realizing how many cleats he and his friends had stuffed at the bottom of their closets, he created C4BF with the goal of passing on equipment to other players around the world who shared his love of the game but who did not have the means to afford the proper equipment. Cleats for Bare Feet has collected more than 6,000 pairs of soccer cleats for distribution among various organizations in Haiti, Kenya, Jamaica, South Africa, Zimbabwe, Senegal, China and the US.



greeNEWit, a Maryland sustainability company located in Columbia, Maryland, incorporated C4BF as a part of it's Agent of Change Internship Program in the summer of 2012. The Agent of Change Internship Program is designed to provide college and high school students with the support and mentorship needed to grow as entrepreneurs and social change agents in their communities. Under student leadership, C4BF has evolved into an organization that is determined to rethink how we help and connect with others that are less fortunate.

story:
Short Summary

Mini Olympics for children under special care is a one day sporting event for intellectually and physically disabled children studying in schools in and around Mumbai, India. 

For 28 years Lions club of Bombay Airport has been organizing this annual all-day event which has giving children with intellectual disability opportunities to experience joy, develop physical fitness, demonstrate courage, and participate in the sharing of gifts and friendship with their families, teachers, and everyone involved. Last year over 700 children (aged 5-18) participated from 26 schools. We expect to have a similar or better involvement this time around! We as organizers of this event are proud to provide this platform for these wonderful children to show case their talent, instill self confidence, and make them an integral part of the local community. 

I and my fellow members invite you to be a part of this memorable event. With your donations we will be helping over 700 children under special care become winners in life!

Don't forget to check out pictures from past events in the gallery section!

Who are we

We are over 20 members of the executive committee (2014-2015) of the Lions Club of Bombay Airport (total 85 members), which is a part of the Lions Club International organization. Our club works within the communities of Vile Parle, Santacruz and Andheri (suburbs of Mumbai, India) to develop social consciousness, increase social engagement, and conduct community improvement projects. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need  ₹ 200,000 ($3,000) to fill the funding gap between the amount required to successfully host this event and donations by our sponsors. 

Mini Olympics this year is expected to cost approximately ₹ 600,000 ($10,000). We expect to raise about ₹ 400,000 ($7,000) through our regular fund raising drive, which includes corporate and individual sponsors. We are hoping to fill the remaining gap through this campaign. 

Breakdown of costs:

  • Ground, facilities, and equipment: ₹ 150,000 ($2,500)
  • Food for 700 children and their parents and teachers ₹ 250,000 ($4,000)
  • Tents for 26 schools:  ₹ 100,000 ($1,600)
  • Trophy, gifts, medals, and medical supplies: ₹ 100,000 ($1,600)
Check out the perks on the right you will receive for your donation!

The Impact

Your contribution will help us reach our goals and make this event even more safe, fun, interactive, and satisfying for the children involved. 

  • The priority for us to provide proper facilities so that it is safe for the children to freely enjoy the various fun and competitive events. 
  • The event will last from 8 am to 4 pm, during that time the children will be provided with breakfast, lunch and snacks to keep them nourished. 
  • The top 3 winners in every contest will be presented with gold, silver and bronze medals to celebrate their victory. Every participant will get a gift bag and certificate.  The winning and the runner-up schools will be awarded with trophies. 

Event day

A total of 27 (age appropriate) events are organized.
  • National Anthem
  • School parade / march past 
  • Community song
  • Track and field events
  • 50 m hurdles 
  • 100 m hurdles
  • Long jump
  • Shot put
  • Basket ball
  • And other fun games relevant to age group
  • Winner felicitation

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. 

Please help us get the word out!  Share this campaign with as many people as you can. Talk about us on Twitter, Facebook, Whatsapp, email… you get the gist…

If you happen to be in Mumbai, India and want to become a part of our team of volunteers contact us and we will let you know what you can do to help!

And that's all there is to it.

Food for 700 children and their parents and teachers ₹ 250,000 ($4,000)
Tents for 26 schools:  ₹ 100,000 ($1,600)
Trophy, gifts, medals, and medical supplies: ₹ 100,000 ($1,600)


Check out the perks on the right you will receive for your donation!
The Impact
 Your contribution will help us reach our goals and make this event even more safe, fun, interactive, and satisfying for the children involved. 


The priority for us to provide proper facilities so that it is safe for the children to freely enjoy the various fun and competitive events. 
The event will last from 8 am to 4 pm, during that time the children will be provided with breakfast, lunch and snacks to keep them nourished. 
The top 3 winners in every contest will be presented with gold, silver and bronze medals to celebrate their victory. Every participant will get a gift bag and certificate.  The winning and the runner-up schools will be awarded with trophies. 

    Event day

A total of 27 (age appropriate) events are organized.


National Anthem
School parade / march past 
Community song
Track and field events
50 m hurdles 
100 m hurdles
Long jump
Shot put
Basket ball
And other fun games relevant to age group
Winner felicitation

Other Ways You Can Help
 Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. 
Please help us get the word out!  Share this campaign with as many people as you can. Talk about us on Twitter, Facebook, Whatsapp, email… you get the gist…  If you happen to be in Mumbai, India and want to become a part of our team of volunteers contact us and we will let you know what you can do to help!And that's all there is to it.

story:
You Can Bring Joy to Armenian Village Children

Women for Development NGO has a proven trackrecord (17 years) of helping address the needs of rural communities in the Shirak region, Armenia. Our main goal is to raise local people’s involvement in their decision-making process. In order to meet this goal, we work closely with local municipalities and communities.

Armenia village children are unable to participate in many leisure activities. Few of their parents can afford to take them to the nearest town, or city, to see a puppet show, a park, or a children’s café. Activities like these are an unattainable dream for the majority of village children.

In Armenia, it's a common practice for children’s heroes to attend celebrations. By purchasing costumes for Santa Claus and the Snow Maiden (Santa’s helper), the Torosgiugh and Lanjik Community Centers (another WFD project) can organize festive Christmas and New Year’s parties for more than 350 local children and teenagers. To extend the joy these heroes bring, we also want to  buy costumes for a clown and two favorite cartoon heroes (a total of 5 costumes) to be used on holidays and for cultural events.

Previously the volunteers of the Community Center organized small events, home visits and congratulated the kids. But the costume of Santa Claus was replaced by a “woman’s gown”, and the cartoon heroes only greeted them from TV screens.

   

Won’t you be one of Santa’s Helpers this year and donate to this project? New Year’s and Christmas are just around the corner. You can help make this year’s celebrations memorable for the children of Torosgiugh and Lanjik villages and know that they, and their families, will enjoy your gift for many years to come.

We do believe in Christmas miracles and are sure that together we will manage to raise the required 1600 USD and make the upcoming Christmas holidays of  these kids a fairy tale.


What We Need & What You Get

$800 will pay for 5 complete adult size costumes (for each village). These will be the property of the Torosgiugh and Lanjik Community Centers and available for use by the village residents.

If we are unable to raise the full $1600 in the allotted time, we will purchase the clown and/or cartoon hero costumes first so they will be available for use in 2015.

Amount necessary for the project

250$ - costumes for Santa Claus and  Snow Maiden 

70$ - costume and accessories for 1 clown

480$ - full costumes for 2 cartoon heroes

Total – 800$

The Impact

Armenia is a small, landlocked country in the South Caucasus. As a former Soviet Republic, it gained independence in 1991. The Shirak region experienced a devastating earthquake several years before, from which it has not fully recovered.

Armenian village life is based on subsistence farming. People raise or grow most of what they need to live. Imagine no local bakery, hair salon, or grocer. Cultural events take place in the village culture house, an unheated space in a building with no kitchen or bathrooms.

By supporting this simple project, children of abovementioned villages will have something to look forward to. Having these costumed characters at a party, helps them forget the difficulties of life and focus on a happy event for a short while.

These costumes will be shared by Torosgiugh and Lanjik with neighboring villages for a small fee. The money collected will be put in a fund for future use by the village for projects supporting the village children. One such project is a playground.

Women for Development, NGO has been working 8 villages for years providing training to the residents. One success story is that after being taught about fundraising, the women of one village, went door-to-door collecting money from each family to buy furniture for their culture house. They collected enough for tables and 1/2 the number of benches they need to hold events for up to 200 people. Please read more about our successes on our website.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are reading this, you are interested in our project, and we thank you for that. But whether or not you are able to support us financially, we ask one favor of you - 
please share this project with your friends and family via email or facebook.

                                             -  The WFD staff is grateful for your help and support.

story:
My name is Roman Moise. I am a Boy scout of the life rank at troop 159, based in Matthews. I am also a senior at Union Academy, in Monroe. I was invited by a member of to help in the beautification of the church while fulfilling my requirements for my Eagle Scout rank.

The purpose of this project is to bring improvements to the curb appeal of the church. It will consist of three major stages. First I will begin with the cross. It will be thoroughly cleaned, then new LED light strip will be installed behind the cross, to provide a soft glow visual effect. Electrical work will be performed by a licensed electrician, to ensure that all installations are done safely, according to codes. The next stage will consist of landscaping improvements; I will remove the overgrown bushes. New fresh young shrubs will be planted, and new layers of mulch will be put down. An underground extension will be placed on the gutter to alleviate erosion around the area. Finally I will be adding two handicap parking spaces in front of the entrance by putting up the handicap signs and re-painting the parking lot lines blue.

 I expect to demonstrate leadership in planning and conducting and delivering this project for the religious institution, with professionalism. I am kindly requesting your support by considering making any donation you feel comfortable with. Thanks!

story:
Resumen

 


     
  • My name is Sebastian and I´m from Chile. I live in a small city called Rancagua
    •  
  • My father wants to start a business, and i want to help him. That´s why I came out with the idea of becoming a blacksmith
    •  
  • I really respect the art of Smithing and I´m really interested in learning it, If I manage to make enough money to buy the tools and the machines I´ll be able to create decoration weapons, something I´m a really fan of
    •  
 


 
 
 

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

 


 
     I only need arround $200 so I can buy the equipment, such as the wielding machine, safety stuff, tools and build a forge
     
  • The only thing I can offer you is the option to purchase weapons from me
    •  
  • If I dont make it to the goal, I´ll just use the money I received for the wielding machine, which is the most expensive thing in my list
    •  
 
 
 

El impacto

 


 
     
  • It won´t do that much for the world...But, It´ll certainly satisfy a small group of people that like this kind of things 
 
 

That´s all

story:
Short Summary

This project is for an installation in Artweek Auckland, taking place from October 10-18. We have been given the opportunity to partake in this but we need financial assistance in order to complete the building of our design. We are a group of second year Bachelor of Architectural Studies students at Unitec Institute of Technology, hoping to have it built.

The design is a tunnel formed from a series of triangular structures, with ropes strung along them which are lit up with LED lights to create an interior experience through the space. This installation will be seen in Wynyard Quarter in Auckland City, New Zealand.

More details on Artweek Auckland can be found on their website.
http://artweekauckland.co.nz/

Also visit our Facebook page which will be updated as the project moves forward.
https://www.facebook.com/ifinspirationalfuture?fref=ts

What We Need & What You Get

We need money to help pay for materials and installation costs, these include:

  • Timber
  • Polyethene Rope
  • Lights
  • Transportation Costs (Trailer Hire)
Unfortunately, we are unable to offer any perks for funders at this point. But if you live in the Auckland area, you can visit the installation along with all the other projects of Artweek.
Every dollar really will count towards what we can achieve with developing our project, so even if we do not reach the proposed goal, any money made will go towards helping build the design.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are interested in helping, and are able to help supply any of the materials we need as sponsorship, that would be readily appreciated.

story:
NEW PERKS ADDED!

 

Who are we?

3 years ago, the people of Pictou were disappointed when learning of the closing of the Ship Hector site. Fortunately, a group of concerned citizens took it upon themselves to preserve and acquire the venue. The Hector Heritage Quay is operated by a Not For Profit Society maintained entirely by VOLUNTEERS (more than 70 of them who donated more than 5513 hours of their time last season) and 5 summer students; we consistently meet and educate visitors (including Tim Horton’s Camps) from all around the world about Scottish history and how one long, arduous voyage from Scotland sculpted Nova Scotia into what it is today. The Ship Hector replica was built and is cared for by the local community. It does NOT receive subsidies or annual funding from government or agencies; therefore, we could use YOUR help!

What Needs to be Done?

During the 1 year in which the site was not in operation (2010) The Hector maintenance was unfortunately neglected. Therefore, this year the Ship Hector is in need of numerous repairs. For this campaign we have decided to focus on raising funds for the bowsprit (the long piece of wood jutting out from the front [see photos]). The volunteer team has been working very hard to keep up with the overall maintenance of the Ship but cannot do it alone. This fall, the rigging (meaning the ropes and such holding the bowsprit, masts, and sails together) must be fixed or totally replaced, in addition, the foremast will be removed for issues below deck! This takes professionals and is NOT a simple job (nor a cheap one). This work will potentially cost upwards of a staggering $100 000!


The money will mostly be going towards hiring the professionals needed for such a job, removing the existing bowsprit, completing the new one, painting and installation. This fall the ship will be turned so it will face the town and avenue on which the site is located so we need it to look in tip-top condition!

So why not raise $100 000?

Fair question. $100 000 is a huge number and we at the Quay are new to indiegogo and simply want to get our feet wet and see what we (YOU) can accomplish. There is no question that if we succeed at this that we will go even further for our quest for Ship excellence. Sails anyone?

Importance/Impact of the Project.

This work is NECESSARY for the Ship Hector to keep it in the essential conditions for visitation and if not done could spell disaster for the ship as the bowsprit is one of the main structures holding the masts in place.

Open from mid-May to Mid-October the ship is one of the most visited sites in Nova Scotia (over 14500 visitors last season) and a pinnacle of the tourism industry in the Town of Pictou; without it, the town would suffer a great loss not only to its tourism revenue, but its cultural pride as well. After suffering a deficit of $35 000 last year, your contributions will lighten the financial load this work has on the volunteer board and allow it to direct other funds to the everyday operations and maintenance of the site.

What YOU Get.

Not only will you feel great about helping keep alive a piece of history but check out our great Perks on the right of the screen that you may claim!

Don’t Reach the Goal? Exceed it?

Even if we do not reach our goal of $10 000, ALL of the funds raised will still go towards the repairing of the bowsprit rigging! If we exceed it, the extra funds will be used for the other rigging work needed on the ship.


Any amount helps; $1, $5, $10. Even if you can't afford that..........

Other Ways You Can Help

“Like” us on Facebook ( www.facebook.com/shiphector ). Follow us on twitter @ship_hector, and visit our website @ www.shiphector.com and spread the word about this project!

DONATIONS ARE ALSO ACCEPTED AT THE HECTOR HERITAGE QUAY in Pictou, Nova Scotia and will be desposited thru this website as to add to the campaign total.

THANKS VERY MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
Feed Families

___

Hepworth Farms and Primrose Hill School are joining forces to feed 1,000 families in the Hudson Valley through Community Supported Agriculture (CSA). CSA programs allow residents to have direct access to high quality, fresh produce grown locally by regional farmers. Through this initiative, we are offering a free weekly box, overflowing with organic vegetables, to low-income families during the 2018 farm season.

We invite you to join us in this campaign to empower families to eat healthy food and connect to their regional farms. Let’s get 1,000 families the veggies they need to thrive!

 

 

How It Works

___

  • Each Hepworth Farms CSA Share provides a family of 4-6 with 22 weeks of freshly picked vegetables, herbs and fruits, delivered from June to November 2018 – a value of $650.
  • Contribute toward a whole CSA share or a partial share to be given to a low-income family. All donations are tax-deductible. (See perks list for options and more details).
  • Purchase your own CSA share for pick-up in either Rhinebeck, NY or Milton, NY.
  • Families in Ulster and Dutchess Counties will receive the boxes of produce through community partner organizations.
  • A portion of the donations for each full CSA Share goes to Primrose Hill School which directly supports our farm and agriculture programs, including this Feeding Ulster Dutchess initiative.
  • We are raising $650,000 to feed 1,000 families. With every contribution – and each time you share this campaign – we get closer to that goal!

 

 

Win-Win-Win

___

Buying or contributing to a share as part of our CSA Program:

  1. Assures a steady supply of beautiful local produce throughout the growing season
  2. Provides much-needed healthy food to a family who would not otherwise have access
  3. Supports and sustains Hepworth Farms by providing funds up front for the seeds, soil prep, farm overhead and ongoing labor that results in bounty in spring, summer and fall
  4. Supports the farm education programs at Primrose Hill School, inspiring the next generation of land stewards
  5. Most importantly, gives you the satisfaction of making a significant difference for a family in our community!

It’s a win!!

 

 

The Impact

___

Too many families in the Hudson Valley struggle to access fresh local produce, despite our region having over 5,500 farms covering 898,000 acres.

Families in economically disadvantaged communities lack affordable healthy food options and - in line with broader national trends - the impact of this is compounded by increasingly sedentary lifestyles. We are seeing an ongoing rise in obesity across every age range and demographic, along with a rise in the debilitating health problems that come with obesity. It is an issue that must be addressed.
 

Hepworth Farms and Primrose Hill School believe that every family in the Hudson Valley should have access to the bounty that is produced by our local farms.

 

Our solution to this problem is to bring fresh, nutrient-dense produce directly to low-income families from the farm to their homes, combining the healthful benefits of eating the highest quality vegetables with ease of access.

 

 

The Veggies

___

For 22 weeks from June to November, our weekly CSA box contains truly the best produce - we’re not exaggerating! Overflowing with a wide variety of vegetables and a selection of fruit throughout the season, the CSA share will nurture a family of 4-6 with an evolving and colorful display every week.

 

“The box arrives and there’s always this anticipation - it strikes just the right balance between the staples that we all love (carrots, tomatoes, green beans, lettuces, apples) and the delicious surprises we don’t expect (seasoning peppers and hot chilis, herbs, delicata squash, purple potatoes, concord grapes). I also love the letter too, with tips and recipes for the veggies they have that week.”

- Happy 2017 CSA Member

 

 

Risks & Challenges

___

The risk of any agricultural endeavor is that farms are impacted by weather and pests. The partnership between Hepworth Farms and Primrose Hill School reduces the risks associated with this program by leveraging the quality, know-how and support of an exceptional farm. Primrose Hill School also has the community-building and administrative capacity to bring this program to fruition.

 

 

 

Who We Are

___

Hepworth Farms, established 1818, is a seventh-generation family farm in Milton, NY, on the Hudson River, approximately 75 miles north of New York City. In 1982, farmer Amy Hepworth assumed leadership of the farm and began the process of “de-chemicalization,” transitioning from standard farming practices to a "whole systems” approach. Today, Hepworth Farms has 400 acres of NOFA-certified production land yielding more than 400 varieties of organic vegetables. The farm is operated by Amy, her twin sister Gail Hepworth, and Gerry Greco.

Primrose Hill School is a growing school in Rhinebeck, NY that follows the Waldorf curriculum, nurturing independent thinkers through nature-based education. We are a community of people who strongly believe an education that includes an agricultural component is essential for our children to understand their larger role in the world. Located on 7.5 acres in the Village of Rhinebeck with a small campus farm, Primrose Hill School educates the whole child – the head, the heart and the hands – in order to cultivate each child’s unique capacities, create a deep connection to the natural world, and ultimately provide a strong foundation for contributing creatively, cooperatively and compassionately to a rapidly changing world.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute now, please share this campaign with your friends!
Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign
Please use the Indiegogo share tools. It makes a huge difference!

Supports the farm education programs at Primrose Hill School, inspiring the next generation of land stewards
Most importantly, gives you the satisfaction of making a significant difference for a family in our community!

It’s a win!!
 


 

The Impact
___
Too many families in the Hudson Valley struggle to access fresh local produce, despite our region having over 5,500 farms covering 898,000 acres.
Families in economically disadvantaged communities lack affordable healthy food options and - in line with broader national trends - the impact of this is compounded by increasingly sedentary lifestyles. We are seeing an ongoing rise in obesity across every age range and demographic, along with a rise in the debilitating health problems that come with obesity. It is an issue that must be addressed. 
Hepworth Farms and Primrose Hill School believe that every family in the Hudson Valley should have access to the bounty that is produced by our local farms.
 
Our solution to this problem is to bring fresh, nutrient-dense produce directly to low-income families from the farm to their homes, combining the healthful benefits of eating the highest quality vegetables with ease of access.
 

 

The Veggies
___
For 22 weeks from June to November, our weekly CSA box contains truly the best produce - we’re not exaggerating! Overflowing with a wide variety of vegetables and a selection of fruit throughout the season, the CSA share will nurture a family of 4-6 with an evolving and colorful display every week.
 
“The box arrives and there’s always this anticipation - it strikes just the right balance between the staples that we all love (carrots, tomatoes, green beans, lettuces, apples) and the delicious surprises we don’t expect (seasoning peppers and hot chilis, herbs, delicata squash, purple potatoes, concord grapes). I also love the letter too, with tips and recipes for the veggies they have that week.”
- Happy 2017 CSA Member
 
 

Risks & Challenges
___
The risk of any agricultural endeavor is that farms are impacted by weather and pests. The partnership between Hepworth Farms and Primrose Hill School reduces the risks associated with this program by leveraging the quality, know-how and support of an exceptional farm. Primrose Hill School also has the community-building and administrative capacity to bring this program to fruition.
 

 
 


Who We Are
___
Hepworth Farms, established 1818, is a seventh-generation family farm in Milton, NY, on the Hudson River, approximately 75 miles north of New York City. In 1982, farmer Amy Hepworth assumed leadership of the farm and began the process of “de-chemicalization,” transitioning from standard farming practices to a "whole systems” approach. Today, Hepworth Farms has 400 acres of NOFA-certified production land yielding more than 400 varieties of organic vegetables. The farm is operated by Amy, her twin sister Gail Hepworth, and Gerry Greco.
Primrose Hill School is a growing school in Rhinebeck, NY that follows the Waldorf curriculum, nurturing independent thinkers through nature-based education. We are a community of people who strongly believe an education that includes an agricultural component is essential for our children to understand their larger role in the world. Located on 7.5 acres in the Village of Rhinebeck with a small campus farm, Primrose Hill School educates the whole child – the head, the heart and the hands – in order to cultivate each child’s unique capacities, create a deep connection to the natural world, and ultimately provide a strong foundation for contributing creatively, cooperatively and compassionately to a rapidly changing world.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to contribute now, please share this campaign with your friends!Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaignPlease use the Indiegogo share tools. It makes a huge difference!

story: ...

Summary

Markets cannot survive elevated levels of fraud. They simply break down, and fail to perform.

Developments in the financial marketplace have been an area of interest for more than twenty years. I am somewhat disappointed, to say the least, with how things have gone. (See: http://www.creativeinvest.com/sri/corpeth.html)

Now, there is a case before the Supreme Court that will allow every person responsible for the recent financial crisis to escape punishment. The case is Gabelli v. Securities and Exchange Commission and "a decision is expected in the court's upcoming term, which ends in June."

I have decided to file a research paper (called an Amicus Brief) with the Supreme Court explaining why letting these guys go might be a bad idea for the rest of us, but I need your help.

What We Need & What You Get

According to one source, "any interested party with the $1,500 to $2,000 fee it costs to submit the brief in the proper bound format, can send (an Amicus Brief) in."

I am not a lawyer or pretending to be one. I might need an actual lawyer to file the thing, but I think I can get this done for $1,500. This is quite the bargain. One article stated that "Appellate lawyers who specialize in drafting such arguments estimate that the average (Supreme Court Friend of the Court) brief can cost between $25,000 to $50,000." The Supreme Court rules are clear:

"Every document filed with the Court shall be prepared using using a standard typesetting process (e. g., hot metal, photocomposition, or computer typesetting) to produce text printed in typographic (as opposed to typewriter) characters. The process used must produce a clear, black image on white paper. The text must be reproduced with a clarity that equals or exceeds the output of a laser printer."

The Supreme Court does not accept electronic or laser prints. Lower Courts do. I filed a brief in United States Securities & Exchange Commission vs. Citigroup Global Markets Inc. (Second Circuit Court of Appeals Case Number 11-5227). See:http://www.prlog.org/11948760-william-michael-cunningham-files-revised-brief-in-sec-vs-citigroup-2nd-cir-ct-of-ap.html?hosted

This means that, to file in the Supreme Court, you have to get the printing done by a professional printer. This is what the money is for.

Your perk:

  • A thank you email.
  • An electronic copy of the brief.
  • A signed hard copy of the brief.
  • An opportunity to edit the brief.
  • A chance to make history (this will be the first crowdfunded Amicus Brief in history...)

Why it’s important to you.

The case hinges on this: Did the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission wait "too long to bring a civil case accusing (the fund manager) of letting a client engage in..market timing?"

Market Timing

" 'Market timing' refers to buying and selling mutual fund shares in a manner designed to exploit short-term pricing inefficiencies. A mutual fund sells and redeems its shares based on the fund’s net asset value ('NAV') for that day, which is usually calculated at the close of the U.S. markets at 4:00 P.M. Eastern Time. Prior to 4:00 P.M., market timers either buy or sell a fund’s shares if they believe that the fund’s last NAV is 'stale,' i.e., that it lags behind the current value of a fund’s portfolio of securities as priced earlier in the day. The market timers can then reverse the transaction at the start of the next day and make a quick profit with relatively little risk. Mutual funds like GGGF that invest in overseas securities are especially vulnerable to a kind of market timing known as 'time zone arbitrage,' whereby market timers take advantage of the fact that the foreign markets on which such funds’ portfolios of securities trade have already closed (thereby setting the closing prices for the underlying securities) before the close of U.S. markets."

The bottom line: this, according to the former Attorney General of New York, “is like allowing betting on a horse race after the horses have crossed the finish line.”

And, it results in a real advantage: the favored client made "185 percent, 160 percent, and 73 percent, respectively..the rate of return for all other (fund) shareholders over the same period was, at best, negative 24.1 percent."

Wow.

The manager claims that "the statute of limitations clock began to tick in 1999. The SEC did not bring charges until 2008, and "the SEC's statute of limitations is five years in cases where the agency is seeking a financial penalty.." Too late. Too bad. So long.

Why did the SEC wait so long? Well, they first had to take their head out of their..I mean, there's the matter of not actually knowing about this behaviour. The manager did not publicize that they were doing this...

What you will help achieve.

If the case is decided for the Fund manager, it means that no one even remotely responsible for the financial crisis will have to worry about anything. They will all claim that the statute of limitations has run out.

But

You might say, "I don't want the SEC coming after me ten years after I have done something." 

I get that. That's why my brief suggests that the extended time limits be applied only to the SEC and only for this type of case. (If they can do it in Bush v. Gore, why not here?). Unless you are planning to engage in marjor market fraud, I don't think you have anything to worry about.

How does this whole thing work?

Technically, anyone can file a Friend of the Court brief. You are just giving the Court your opinion on a case. It works as follows:

  1. You ask the lawyers in the case if you can file. In this case, it's the Solicitor General of the United States (who said yes) and some private lawyer guy (who also said yes.)
  2. You file the thing, asking the Court (as in Supreme Court) for permission.
  3. The document you submit must have a green cover. You have to supply forty copies. They have to be printed and bound in a certain way. The money is for the printing....
  4. I do not have to provide a list of all who gave money in support of this effort to the Supreme Court. I simply have to say that I got outside support. I won't list you in the thing unless you want me to...and I will check with you before doing so.

The Impact

I've done this before, but not in the Supreme Court....see: http://prlog.org/11782028

Yes, the arguments in my brief were mentioned by the Court, but the chances that this thing will actually have an impact on the ruling in the Supreme Court are not high. As one person put it, "No court is obligated to follow or even to consider the advice of an amicus curiae, even one it has invited."

According to another article, "In the Supreme Court's last term, only eight percent of the total 628 briefs filed by non-government amici were cited by the justices, according to a report by R. Reeves Anderson and Anthony Franze of the law firm Arnold & Porter. Of those that got a nod, nearly half were written by prominent appellate lawyers from Washington, D.C.-based firms with Supreme Court practices.

Not even the justices necessarily pay much attention to them. Antonin Scalia, in October told students at Chicago-Kent College of Law that he doesn't read amicus briefs. He instead passes them on to his clerks. Last year, former Justice John Paul Stevens complained of amici fatigue to an audience at Northwestern University Law School, saying 'we could get along with fewer amicus briefs.' "

They don't really want to hear from me (or you) but, so what? You have the right to have your voice heard. If it doesn't work, well, at least you tried...

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

A Final Word

You can make an anonymous contribution, too. Just go to the checkout and select the anonymous option!

story:
We are going to change the world from burning fossil fuels to using the power of the sun! Join us in this mission!!

----------------------------

WHAT IS THIS PROJECT ABOUT? 

     We believe that progress begins by thinking beyond the status quo. Our mission is to completely eliminate the worlds dependency on fossil fuels and to provide the most advanced solutions to facilitate that transition.

 

     So we did...after almost a year we created the smartest steam turbine ever conceived. This is not only just the “next generation” turbine, we went beyond by totally redesigning the mechanical principles of the standard conventional turbines to produce the most powerful, efficient and functionally beautiful turbine design ever known.....and we brought it to Indiegogo! 

 

 

     If you believe there needs to be something done about climate change before there are sever irreversible consequences, and you have the passion to do something about it but not sure how you can make an impact....THIS IS THE PROJECT FOR YOU!    

     The hardest part is already done, I created the design of this truly highly-efficient steam turbine. All we need is your help to build it, and you’ll be able to see every step of the progress of my staff of engineers and I make! This will be a monumental journey and with your help we can turn this into a reality, to finally change the world for the better...for ourselves and for our future!

 

 How are we going to spend the money!?

    First of all we passionately understand that every cent we receive was hard earned by YOU and is precious therefor as stewards to this fund we will allocate every cent to go towards building this Turbine! We do not only have a responsibility to you but to the world, and that is how we truly feel!

    We have a team of two full time mechanical engineers and myself whom are ready to get this build started! 

     We will need two prototypes. The first prototype we will be conducting tests to see where we can optimize. The second, we will bring to the 2012 "Renewable Energy World Conference and Expo" here in Orlando, Florida where we will present as the fully functional prototype!

     Each prototype will cost about $13,000 to build = $26,000.00

     We wil need additional testing equipment, compressors, thermocouples, pressure sensors, etc...and a larger facility to accomodate the equipment and staff=$15,000.00

    Around $4,000.00 of misc. goods like hoses, benches, fittings, replacement parts, etc...

    So estimated total to a fully functional prototype =$45,000.00

 

------------------------

 

Question.... What is a Steam Turbine Engine?

   Answer...A Steam Turbine Engine is a device that has been used for over 150 years to convert steam power to turn a generator. These same conventional steam turbines are being used on our power plants today.

Question... How will this actually change anything?

   Answer.... Let me give you a simple example. Say you put a revolutionary engine in your car that will give you the ability to drive twice as far as you had normally done in the past using the same amount of fuel! This is exactly what this will do in terms of helping power facilities maximize their ability to produce electricity by more efficiently converting steam into mechanical energy!

Question... Can't this also be utilized in coal and nuclear power plants?

   Answer... Yes it can, but our main focus is helping the Green Renewable Energy Industry to move beyond fossil fuels.

Question... How will this help me directly?

   Answer...The dynamics of this will be felt world wide. For one it will help us achieve Energy independence. Two, all components of the Turbine Engine will be made here in the USA creating jobs to support the economy. Three, this is the big one, saving our environment...without doing this THERE WILL BE NO FUTURE! The long term benefits include reducing energy cost by eliminating the need to mine and refine fossil fuels. 

    This is another big one....the reason why there has not been an explosion of electric cars on the road is that our current power generating infrastructure does not have the capacity to handle 50 million new electric hungry cars. This will almost double the stain on our current electrical power plants! This turbine though, can not only retrofit the coal and nuclear power plants to produce almost double production, but will open the gate for CSP and Parabolic Trough solar companies to open more facilities because it is now economically prudent.


Question...is this scalable?

   Answer...A matter of fact yes it is! One of our main goals after we have successfully manufactured, optimized and tested the turbine is to create Mini-power generating systems small enough to fit on commercial rooftops and residential property. We should be able to not only satisfy the owners electricity needs but also have surplus pumped back into the grid to where the owners, instead of getting a bill from their electric company, get a check! This is called net metering. The ability for you to have complete control of your energy produced entirely by the sun, will be our ultimate goal. 

 

Please visit us on Turbinergy.com

 

Turbinergy Bumper Sticker!! :)

story:
At a glance

How much does one dollar mean to you? Probably not much. But what happens when you have thousands or hundreds of thousands of one dollars? How life changing could be that experience? We're here to find out. Over the next 30 days, we'll raise one dollar from as many people as we can and see the possibilities.

At the end of the project, we'll divide all the money we raised and hand it out to 10 contributors of this project - randomly selected.

What We Need

We need just one dollar from you, your friends and anyone you know!

What You Might Get

At the end of this project, we will simply divide the total money raised into 10 equal parts and hand it out to randomly selected contributors to this project. You could end up with as much as $100, $1000 or even $10000!

Other Ways You Can Help

We'd love it if you could spread word about our project to your friends and family. This project could be an inspiration to a lot of charities and non profits in helping them know how to effectively raise funds online for their causes.
 
PS: I don't keep any money with me. I'm just curious to see how far this can go.

story:
OUR STORY

Edward Tomas managing director

“Everyone has a dream and I had a dream about unlimited flying. As an experienced pilot on ultralight planes I was annoyed about using runways for take-off and landing. The only alternative was personal ultralight helicopter. After researching all possible availabilities on market I reached that ultralight helicopters are too expensive, technically outdated, not very safe, heavy controllable, etc.”


Josef Mladý - head aircraft designer

“I am interested in flying all my life as pilot and aircraft designer. After my successful construction of Autogyro project in 2002 I started to search for solution how not to use runways for landing and take-off, which lead me to dream about construction my own personal ultralight helicopter. ” 


CzechCopter Co.

was established on one beautiful sunny day in 2011 after mutual agreement by these two dreamers and that it is how their dreams about personal ultralight helicopter FLY CC came true. After one year detailed research on world market we had our concept ready.  Calculations, drawings, cabin, engine, rotor, electronics etc. is ready and test flight can start!

After first test flight by professional and experienced test pilot who declared:

“Guys, you have managed to built ultra light helicopter which is stable, safe, easy to operate and appropriate for wide use”

This opinion become inspiration for our new dream: offer FLY CC personal ultralight helicopter worldwide.

Please help us with start of serial production.


FLY CC

Our FLY CC is new ultralight helicopter using latest technologies including many inovations. We would like to start serial production and offer our latest product worldwide. Our helicopter is unlimited in its use. 

First flying aproved prototype is prepared and we want to start serial production. This prototype will be used for promotion and will carry names of our supporters . First 10 helicopters Fly CC is offered for special price $100.000,-

More information is available on www.czechcopter.cz

Characteristic:
Helicopter is for 2 passengers, fully automatic in category – ultralight, 2-seat, side-by-side. It can be used for hobby, sport or transportation. Maximum travel speed is from 140 km/per hour up to 170 km/per hour. Fuel consumption is around 15–20 l/per an hour of flight. We use normal car petrol.

Safety:
Piloting of our helicopters could be fun but it also needs concentration and responsibility. According the law it pilot license could hold person older then 16 years, it is obvious that you can fly before you can drive. In our offer is also parachute safety system.

Technical information:
Category: Ultralight
Speed: max. 170 km/h
Travel speed: 140 km/h
Flying range: 450–600 km
Empty weight: 325 kg
MAUW: max. 560 kg
Engine: Rotax 912RST Turbo 122 HP
Tank capacity: 60 l
Consumption and fuel type: 15–20 l per one flight hour, petrol used for cars
Rate of climb: 7 m/s
Hover OGE: 3 000 m
Two blade main rotor diameter: 5 m
Undercarriage skid: 1,87 m
Length of helicopter: 6,7 m
Height of helicopter: 2,45 m
Space needed for take-off and landing: 30 x 30 m
Cabin: laminate frameless, upholstered
Frame and engine area: welded
Beam of countervailing blade: tubular
Countervailing blade: Fenestron 4x blade
Control equipment: full for VFR
story_txt:
OUR STORY 
Edward Tomas managing director“Everyone has a dream and I had a dream about
unlimited flying. As an experienced pilot on ultralight planes I was annoyed
about using runways for take-off and landing. The only alternative was personal
ultralight helicopter. After researching all possible availabilities on market
I reached that ultralight helicopters are too expensive,
technically outdated, not very safe, heavy controllable, etc.”Josef Mladý - head aircraft designer“I am interested in flying all my life as pilot
and aircraft designer. After my successful construction of Autogyro project in
2002 I started to search for solution how not to use runways for landing and
take-off, which lead me to dream about construction my own personal ultralight
helicopter. ” CzechCopter Co.
was
established on one beautiful sunny day in 2011 after mutual agreement by these
two dreamers and that it is how their dreams about personal ultralight
helicopter FLY CC came true. After one year detailed research on world market
we had our concept ready.  Calculations,
drawings, cabin, engine, rotor, electronics etc. is ready and test flight can
start!After
first test flight by professional and experienced test pilot who declared:“Guys,
you have managed to built ultra light helicopter which is stable, safe, easy to
operate and appropriate for wide use”

This
opinion become inspiration for our new dream: offer FLY CC personal ultralight
helicopter worldwide. Please help

story: This campaign is for Talon Corvo Hagaman. He was born on January 20, 2014 to his loving parents Brandon Hagaman and Samantha Royster. Talon is their first born, and is Brandon and Sammie's pride and joy.  On March 6, 2014 he displayed consistent discomfort and was rushed to Henry Ford Wyandotte Hospital in Wyandotte,MI then taken to Children's Hospital Detroit in Detroit, MI where he has been receiving treatment, and under a close observation of the hospital's staff. He first received a surgery which removed his appendix, and put his bowels in the correct area (after being entangled); but then after a week he needed another surgery and while doing so the doctor found gangrene in his small intestine (the technical term being a "malrotation of his midgut volvulus"). After the operation the surgeon stated the it was a miracle that Talon was still alive, and that the issues at hand have caused Talon to have "total parenteral nutrition" which will affect him the rest of his life. Brandon (Talon's father), is my first cousin and one of my best friends, and his fiance Samantha (Talon's mother) is like a sister to me, and I know that if I had children with an ailment they would do the same for me in a heartbeat. The goal is modest one, but any little bit will help these young parents make sure that this awesome little man is taken care of. If you would like please contribute to Mr. Talon Corvo Hagaman's fundraising campaign, all of your love and support is appreciated!

story:
Short Summary

The Bandit Queen:
Ramen Bar, Public House, Purveyor of Fine Teas, and Respite for the Modern-Day Adventurer
The Bandit Queen will serve Grand Rapids' downtown late night and lunchtime populace as a fun, welcoming, turn-of-the-century bar, serving not whiskey, but Ramen noodles and other East-Asian street-food specialties not currently represented in West Michigan.
We'll be focusing on quick, healthy, cheap meals, based on local and seasonal ingredients and traditional techniques. A perfect last-stop after a night at the bar, a great escape from work on your lunch break, and a much-needed service for those people who work late downtown and often are at a loss for a decent meal late at night.

Our style is based on old Trade Route culture, sharing the mysteries of our travels and the bounty of our spice trade with our favorite Port of Call, downtown Grand Rapids.

Most of all, we want a place that you love to go; not because it's "fancy" or "trendy", but rather because you can get a good meal, tell some good stories, and feel well-cared for. 

What We Need & What You Get

We've done the preliminary work, building out the space for our other business, Propaganda Doughnuts, with the intention of expanding into the Bandit Queen when the time was right. Therefore, the large-scale build-out and construction is already finished. 

Now that we've "built the house", we need your help to "fill it with furniture". Our shopping list that you're helping us complete consists of:

  • bowls & serviceware (as eating soup out of one's hand is ill-advised)

  • teacups & teapots

  • commercial steam kettle

  • bar top

  • bar stools

  • shelving/storage behind bar

  • minor kitchen buildout (extra plumbing/sinks, additional electrical)

  • bar coolers

  • refrigerator

  • new sink in guest restroom (current sink is garage-quality)

  • new tile in entryway (current tiles horribly damaged)

  • signage for the storefront (so you can find us!)


As we've never been comfortable asking for money with nothing in return, we've worked very hard at coming up with the most exciting and fun perks as we can manage, to best show our gratitude for your support of our project.

We're most excited about our "Bowl Club", the ramen-shop version of a brewery's Mug Club, where we're having a skilled local ceramics artist make customized ramen bowls available only to our Bowl Club members, that will be on display for the members' use, and earn them discounts and passage to members' events. 

We've got all sorts of other "thank you"s, from our great t-shirts, to Chef dinners, to a full-scale backyard barbeque for 30 of your friends, cooked by our bandit troupe. We hope to show you just how much your support means to us. 


The Impact

With the early success of our first project, Propaganda Doughnuts, we're really demonstrating the value in interesting, small-scale, quality food, and its contribution to a vibrant downtown life. We're working hard to support and develop an area of downtown that used to be a powerful commercial strip, but has over the years fallen into disenfranchisement. With your support of our projects, you're not only securing yourself a good place to eat, but you're securing another facet of culture to our downtown life, and you're helping to improve an area of your city that is long-overdue for some hard work and love.


Other Ways You Can Help

Our projects rely on you and the value you place in your community.

We recognize that not everyone can donate huge amounts of money to a project, but we want to remind you that every donation is sincerely valuable, and even if you can't make a monetary contribution, you can help immensely by sharing, posting, tagging, talking about, and spreading the word with as much vim and vigor as you can muster, and that's worth gold to us.

Show your support to The Bandit Queen, and she'll have your back for always.

story:
Baobab-LaBuonaVita

“A good nourishment..for a good life”

To read an italian version of this brochure please click here:

Indiegogo Italian Brochure

According to ISTAT, in 2011, 11,1% of Italian families is relatively poor and the 5,2% is definitely poor. Poverty soil is 1.011,03€. In 2011 the risk of poverty is about 28.4%. It is higher than the European medium level corresponding to 24.2%.

Considering those aspects, how can we defeat poverty? In the past we thought countries such like Africa, South-America and south east Asia were the poorest in the world but now this is getting real even four us. 

Man created progress and civilization by market economy and relative competition and this was positive. Unfortunately this force points have taken too much control on man themselves.

Have men still control? 

We need to fight for something different, practicing ethic principals in our economy. Poorest people are those who need and desire more and more and more. 

We are inspired and look for realizing our will to fight for a new culture and this is our project: Baobab-Labuonavita. To achieve a new living style, a proper behavior style must be reviewed sinergically and this brings to correct capability to ménage our owns nourishment. 

This is baobab-labuonavita’s philosophy: man is the focus point and choosing his proper nourishment style and consequently lifestyle. By promoting this new culture we create a connection between consumer and food, so Baobab-labuonavita becomes  agent for promoting, changing and value development. 

When you act as to reach a big changing, the big and real core spirit of our actions is reaching happiness, the most precious and important treasure we have got.


How can we reach this objective?

Everything is based on creating a new selling channel for little producers in agricultural and food industry by increasing their production capability through lowest supply chains. 

Connected to this project we can include farm holiday industry where the customers can get in touch with the area where products purchased come from, for example little “smart boxes”.  

Everything must be managed following “Labuonavita” philosophy including as follows: art, well-being, amusement culture as well as social relationship discovering areas where you meet nature architecture and culture. 

This is very important considering next expo event in Milan and it’s topic: planet nourishment, energy for life.

(Expo 2015) Our Strategy & Objective

Expo 2015 will be an extraordinary universal event which allows tradition creativity and innovation to be consider in food industry.  One core topic is human write to a healthy safe nourishment and enough for the whole planet. 

Here are some points of work and discussion: 

  • Increasing quality and food safety;
  • Ensuring healthy and quality food to all human beings to eliminate hunger and thirst as well as death in childhood and bad nourishment;
  • To prevent from social illness of our times from fatness to heart pathologies and cancer;
  • Innovation of the hole food supply chain by research, technology and enterprise;
  • Teaching correct nourishment to advantage new life styles in particular for children young people disabled and old people;
  • To give value to acknowledgement of food traditions as culture and ethnic elements;

Food is Planets life energy. It is based on a correct and constant body nourishment respecting basic life rules and health of every single human being.

Diffusion and quality of agriculture and food products is a social need beyond representing an important economy value. The core rule is represented by territory, as food quality and authenticity are connected with tradition coming from thousands of years of experience where we bring big innovation at present.

Expo shows science and technology frontier:

  • To protect bio-diversity, to respect environment, to defend food quality and safety, to teach nourishment for health and well-being of people;
  • To detect better control and innovation system starting from bio-technology to ensure healthy and nourishing food availability as well as drinking water and for irrigation;
  • New food sources by those planet areas where agriculture is not developed or is seriously threatened.

Expo offers many opportunities for marketing and communications to manufactures farmers, food industry, logistics and distribution, catering, research centers and to companies who want: 

  • To give a value to innovation and production technology in order to create a healthy food product;
  • To work in preparing and conservation of food increasing professional competences of addicted people and improving communications to the consumer;
  • To guarantee food quality by proper checking and protecting system

We also intend to involve national and international research institute to offer a scientific support to our project’s development. We will get space among certified analysis of food, implying their database, composing proper diet programs including cooking methods. 

This will be the passage which allows us to be different from classic e-commerce offered by present market.

A real innovation!!

The business is made of by interactive synergic fields, for each of them we chose people having specific competent, above all young people! 

"Closing the circle"

  • Agriculture production acknowledged of quality
  • Correct conservation with deterioration time prolonging
  • Offer of health sized proper and certified food 
  • Food waste cutting on the hole supply chain
  • Purchase offer for products to be mixed by the kitchen or proposed ready for consumption, in daily or weekly menus with nourishing values and sure calorie value. All this respecting environment through packaging biodegradable and 100% in maize fibers ecozema.
  • New selling channel in self store H24
  • Self service baobab la nuova vita: selling of products of IV range and transformed products ready for using
  • E-Commerce Site and Home Delivering

This planning is very difficult and there is much work to do but every day we add a little brick and we are very happy…but always keeping connection with reality. 

“Successes is not final and lack of successes is not fatal. The only thing very important is our courage for going ahead.” Winston Churchill

Can we change things? 

We think so, you only need to have dreams and believe till the end.

What We'll Spend the Money On

We need your help to start our project, step by step:

  • First Step: 5000 €

E-Commerce Server covered by 1 year

Creating a subscription system with magnetic Debit Cards (Paypal-like) nominative and unique for each person.

  • Second Step: 10000 €

Development of a dedicated mobile application that let you order anywhere anytime our products and check your orders status (Android - IOS)

Using an innovative biotecnology that can certify a product, it's origin and that it comes from an agriculture production acknowledged of quality.

  • Third Step (Our Goal): 20000 €

Development of a Self Service Baobab-labuonavita Innovative Vending Machine

  • Fourth Step (Secondary Goal): 50000 €

Using an innovative method of conservation that let our products to be conserved for a very long time without losing their healthy qualities and withouth preservatives.

Renting a dedicated space to sell directly to consumers our products and promote our philosophy. This could give us also the possibility to ship all of our products worldwide.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help us not only with donation, we need also to spread the word so let your friends, parents and anyone else you want know our mission. We will be very grateful!

For more information, please visit us on the following sites:

  • Baobab-Labuonavita Official Site
  • Twitter
  • Facebook
  • Youtube
