story:
What if you could use a small amount of your travel loyalty points to give an amazing gift of compassion to someone, not an organization but to a specific person who needed to see their loved one who was terminally or critically ill? Would you do that?

We have an idea and we believe it can help thousands of people; but, we need your help to make this idea a reality. 

That idea is to "microgive” small amounts of your travel loyalty points via a web application to a specific person in need of seeing a terminally or critically ill loved one. 



So I would give 100 points, you would give 100 points, our friends would give 100 points to Joe who needs to fly to see his terminally ill father.  We think this is an amazing gift of compassion. 

There are 3 key elements to the idea we are trying to make happen:

1) A tangible outcome - your points are not going to an organization they are going to a specific person’s story that you choose to connect with. This is how we believe the new social media giving model works.  Donate to a specific person and a tangible outcome.

 2) Via the Web – the transaction has to be easy and simple for those donating and those receiving points.

3) 100% donation model – all points given go to that specific person’s story to help them not to an organization in the middle.

What will the funds be used for?

100% of the Indiegogo funds raised will go towards making the website application a reality.  Give A Mile is a federally registered Canadian Not For Profit and 100% volunteer organization.  All monies collected will go directly into building this application and making this vision happen. 

What loyalty point programs are you building this application for? 

The answer is TBD, we are in talks with several loyalty programs that operate in Canada but as with all new ideas there is a chicken and egg effect happening.  The loyalty programs have told us this is a great idea but we need to show them it’s more than just an idea. We need to show these loyalty programs that the larger community supports and loves this idea. They are also very busy running their businesses so by building the application platform we believe we can accelerate adopting this idea.  If you have contacts in any of the loyalty programs please send them to us so we can further our discussion.  If you are a representative of a loyalty program looking to partner on this idea, please contact us. 

When will I be able to donate points? 

It will take some time to do this via the application.  There are many steps on this journey.  First we need to raise the money, and then we need to build an application. Building an app has many steps such as proof of concepts, design, development and testing. We also need to establish our partnership with the loyalty programs.  Application software development takes time, but we are 100% committed to making this happen.  We want to help people travel to see loved ones as soon as we can make it possible. 

In the meantime, we have given our very first flight via a manual donation and plan on doing several more via this method. Follow our social media feeds as we will be sharing more about this in the coming weeks -  @giveamile and http://www.giveamile.org 

How will you ensure that people are not defrauding the system?

We believe 99.9% of people are good and would never dream of something like that, but we understand the concerns about misuse.  We would require people’s stories to be shared via social media so that the community can monitor itself and report any wrongdoings.  We also have talked to several organizations that work with people in these types of situations who have vetting processes and have an identified community already in place that could use this service.

What happens if for some reason you cannot make this idea work?

We are a tenacious bunch and we have a 100% belief that we can make this happen.  If for some reason this cannot be implemented we will donate all the remaining funds to Make A Wish Foundation Canada http://www.makeawish.ca/

Find out more by visiting www.giveamile.org or email us at info@giveamile.net
story_txt:
What if you could use a small amount of your travel loyalty points to give an amazing gift of compassion to someone, not an organization but to a specific person who needed to see their loved one who was terminally or critically ill? Would you do that?
We have an idea and we believe it can help thousands of people; but, we need your help to make this idea a reality. 
That idea is to "microgive” small amounts of your travel loyalty points via a web application to a specific person in need of seeing a terminally or critically ill loved one. 






So
I would give 100 points, you would give 100 points, our friends would give 100
points to Joe who needs to fly to see his terminally ill father.  We think
this is an amazing gift of compassion. 
There
are 3 key elements to the idea we are trying to make happen:
1) A
tangible outcome - your points are not going to an organization they
are going to a specific person’s story that you choose to connect with.
This is how we believe the new social media giving model works.  Donate to
a specific person and a tangible outcome.
 2) Via
the Web – the transaction has to be easy and simple for those donating
and those receiving points.
3) 100% donation model – all points given go to that specific person’s story to help
them not to an organization in the middle.
What will the funds be used for?
100%
of the Indiegogo funds raised will go towards making the website application a reality.  Give A Mile is a
federally registered Canadian Not For Profit and 100% volunteer
organization.  All monies collected will go directly into building this application and making this vision happen. 
What loyalty point programs are you building this application
for? 
The
answer is TBD, we are in talks with several loyalty programs that operate in
Canada but as with all new ideas there is a chicken and egg effect
happening.  The loyalty programs have told us this is a great idea but we
need to show them it’s more than just an idea. We need to show these loyalty
programs that the larger community supports and loves this idea. They are also very busy running their businesses so by building the application platform we
believe we can accelerate adopting this idea.  If you have contacts in any of the loyalty programs please
send them to us so we can further our discussion.  If you are a representative of a loyalty
program looking to partner on this idea, please contact us. 
When will I be able to donate points? 
It
will take some time to do this via the application.  There are many steps on this journey.  First we
need to raise the money, and then we need to build an application. Building an
app has many steps such as proof of concepts, design, development and testing. We also need to
establish our partnership with the loyalty programs.  Application software development takes time, but we are 100% committed to making this happen.  We want to help people travel to see loved ones as soon as we can make it possible. 
In the meantime, we have given our very first flight via a manual donation and plan on doing several more via this method. Follow our social media feeds as we will be sharing more about this in the coming weeks -  @giveamile and http://www.giveamile.org 
How will you ensure that people are not defrauding the system?
We
believe 99.9% of people are good and would never dream of something like that, but we understand the concerns
about misuse.  We would require people’s stories to be shared via social
media so that the community can monitor itself and report any wrongdoings.
 We also have talked to several organizations that work with people in these types of situations who have vetting processes and have an identified
community already in place that could use this service.
What happens if for some reason you cannot make this idea
work?
We
are a tenacious bunch and we have a 100% belief that we can make this happen.  If for some
reason this cannot be implemented we will donate all the remaining funds to
Make A Wish Foundation Canada http://www.makeawish.ca/

Find out more by
visiting www.giveamile.org or email us at info@giveamile.net

story:
Summary

Historic Manheim Park is a diverse urban, community located in central Kansas City. The community has experienced decline over the past four decades but within the past few years, has begun to experience a notable renewal. To continue this momentum, our community was awarded a $20,000 grant by a Kansas City-based organization, the Community Capital Fund to help us organize our community into block teams, sponsor community clean-up and other events such as community gardens. With the grant we also want to capture the talents present in our community so that we can begin to leverage them to further develop our community.

                 

A condition of the community getting the full $20,000 grant requires that we raise a modest 10% or $2000. Your donation of any size helps us take one step closer toward realizing this goal. No donation is too small because every gift helps our community to become more connected, engaged and empowered to take the next steps to accelerate the regeneration. 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:
Our community is sincerely asking for your help to raise $2,000. Our organization is a Missouri nonprofit neighborhood association that relies on the contributions of individuals and organizations to help us promote community involvement and engagement.

                     

The Impact

Organizing our community into block teams will require us to map the 36 six blocks of our community into four teams, identifying block representatives, train the block team leaders on effective ways for engaging members of our community, and sponsor block events that engages members of the entire block team (e.g., community clean-up, meet your neighbor events, block beautification projects). To complete the asset mapping portion of the project, we will be working with Dr. Jake Wagner from our local University of Missouri at Kansas City, Department of Architecture and Planning. Dr. Wagner will develop the asset mapping instrument, train volunteers, walk the entire neighborhood to collect data, analyze data and work with neighborhood leaders to create a comprehensive “asset catalog.”  Our asset catalog will contain information about members of the community who have special skills such as home repair, computer repair, landscaping, etc.

                        

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to give, we still believe you can help. Our community is always looking for volunteers to help us achieve our mission of improving the lives of members of our community. You can reach us at manheimpark@gmail.com to learn how you can volunteer.

story:
Short Summary

The Make a Difference Foundation grew out of the after math of Hurricane Sandy.

On October 29, 2012, Hurricane Sandy blew into the state of NJ and devastated many areas. Families lost homes and cars in massive flood waters. Even where homes were still standing, residents were forced to throw away entire contents of basements and first floor dwellings that were touched by contaminated water.

Immediately following the storm, there was no shortage of people willing to donate food, clothing and money. However, one year later, there are still many people trying to recover and rebuild their lives. 

Help is still needed. 

Whether affected by a natural disaster, economic down turn or personal tragedies, people are in need of help, healing and hope,which has become the mission of the Make A Difference Foundation.

 What We Need & What You Get

To raise funds to help those still in need from the effects of Hurricane Sandy, the Make A Difference Foundation is hosting a benefit concert on October 27, 2013 featuring Steve Angrisano, John Angotti, Curtis Stephan and Jenn Jinks. The evening is sure to be exciting, fun and filled with hope. If coming to the concert is not possible, you can still participate by making a donation today!  

There are many exciting perks offered such as shout outs, Make A Difference silicone bracelets, your name on our sponsorship banner at the concert and advertisements in our concert ad journal.  Make sure you take a look at the perks listed on the site.

Other Ways You Can Help

Your support is so greatly appreciated! Even the smallest amount will help make a difference in someone's life. Please help spread the word and share this page with everyone you know. Thank you for sharing in this effort with us - together we will be able to bring hope and healing to those in need.

story:
KB Computers, the short story.

KB Computers LLC was started to assist those who have a hard time with understanding computers, or those who just want to learn more about what they (computers) can do. In the area we started there are quite a few people who think computers are nothing more than a paper weight. As our company went around the area and the U.S., we realized that those kinds of people are all over the U.S. We are going to do our best to keep our advice general but up to date.


The funds raised here at Indiegogo will allow us to get a head start on going beyond our own boarders and do what we love to do, helping people. Our staff is friendly and more than willing to help anyone from your little kid to your grandmother. With the money we will be able to out fit our staff with better and newer computers, depending on how much is raised, we may even be able to buy a vehicle to get our staff around the area.

Company Value

 At KB Computers, we value the customer. If you don't understand something, ask us, our staff can help find solutions to problems that you might not be able to get on your own. 

Treat others how you want to be treated. We strongly believe that if we want kind and courteous customers, we need to be kind and courteous to you. 

Open source. We think that everything should be open source to some extent. Whether it be computer related or not, EVERYONE should get the chance to be able to learn what they want. Once a product is released.


Mission Statement

Here at KB Computers LLC, we strive to make our clients happy. Started in 2013 by Austin Kregel, KB Computers was organized to be a revolution. It is here to assist in the understanding of our modern technology. From young to old, and nerdy to dorky. Our desire is to help anyone with a disire to learn about computers.

What We Need & What You Get

If we reach our goal we WILL be able to get:

  • New computers/ computer parts
  • Our work patented, trademarked, and copy written.
  • With enough money we will be able to get a vehicle for the business.
  • Pay for all of the legal fees and lawyers (we are a new business afterall)
  • Pay for the services of the company Google.

Possible perks:

  For a $5 donator

  • You will get your name on our company website as our 'thank you for donating.'

  For a $25 donator

  • You will be sent a wrist band stating that you are a proud supporter of the company and the previous 'perk'

  For a $100 donator

  • You will get everything from the previous 'perk' and a complementary 'KB Computers LLC' tee shirt please include your shirt size!

  For a $500 donator

  • You will recive everything previously mentioned plus a signed thank you letter from the President of the company.

  For a $15,000 donator

  •  You will get everything previously mentioned. and a great warm fuzzy feeling that you helped a little business come to life.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help but can't, please share the campaign. The more people that know of our campaign here, the better our business can be. You can follow us on facebook or Twitter.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Rob Moraal, I have been a lifelong hobby gamer and wanted to share my passion with the people around me too. I opened my store to do just that, in the town I went to high school.

What We Need & What You Get

I need about $3,000 to cover initial start-up costs like:

  • Commercial Lease
  • Legal & Real Estate fees
  • Shelving, fixtures, and storage
  • Signage and store beautification
  • Tables and chairs (because a place to play is the first step in starting a long and glorious career in gaming)

The Impact

This project does more than just open a small business. It gives opportunity and hope to all the gamers that feel left behind by their peer groups. It creates a safe haven to be yourself in an environment that encourages it. It lets you and your best friends storm the castle, slay the dragon and save the princess together. Especially for those who may feel they have interests no one shares, every community has a core of gamers. They just need to find each other. That is why I need to open, and why I need your help.

Other Ways You Can Help

Anyone who can donate any amount is amazing and I will be in your debt. For those who cannot or do not want to, but do know some hobby gamers or who are hobby gamers themselves, let everyone know. We are a collective, a united group of brothers and sisters with vision and spirit. Show that by making this a success! Let people know, spread the word, the next generation of gaming stores is here!

And, if we do manage to reach the $10 000 mark, I will shave my beard, even if no individual becomes a TITAN.

I realize that $3 000 as a goal seems like a low number to open a store of any kind. However I only need a small space to get started, and have $6 000 in funds saved and nearly $10 000 in inventory. This money is to get those last few things that have been left over. Things like chairs and tables, shelving and displays, and to finalize a lease.

story:
My name is Stacy and I am the proud mother of a beautiful six year old girl who was born with a severe bilateral cleft lip and palate.  Her name is Autumn and she has underwent extensive surgeries.  This little girl has been through a lot and still not done.  As she has more surgeries ahead of her. 

She absolutely loves Disney, the princesses and desperately wants to go to Disney World.  All we can do is dream, as we are not in a position to pay for a trip and with all the bills we have coming in and can not see anything changing.

She is an amazing girl with a beautiful heart.  I hope you will help me to make her dream a reality.  She has such a passion for helping others and I want desperately for her to be able to meet and feel like a princess.  

We are asking for $2,500 to cover the cost of a trip of a lifetime 

Including airfare, hotel, food and tickets for for one week.

 

Thank you.

story:
Thank you for visiting my e-store: ECOBAGS.com.ng Store, this is what I hope to be saying to every visitors soon.

The ECOBAGS NIGERIA Store is going to be a one stop shop for all Eco-friendly products, that is Handmade, Organic and Recycled products, gifts and Sustainable items.

Selling everything from Eco Bags for shopping, Organic Body Butters to Power Banks Chargers for Phone and Laptop as well as Solar Mobile Phone Chargers, to scented candles, Eco friendly camping equipment to handcrafted soaps and many more as we will continue in search for sustainable products.

I have test this concept by producing and selling of Eco Canvas Bags and proved popular. What I want now is to expand to an internet based store with a view to opening up a small village shop in the future. I have sourced good suppliers of eco products, and still looking for more in other to get items when ever there is order for it.

Another feature of this website will be to advertise eco-friendly manufacturer across the world which I will received sponsorship payments on an annual basis or commission on bookings made via the links on my website.

I Michael Tosin Adesanwo have always been interested in Environmental Issues and Tourism. I usually organize and create event and campaigning for cleanup projects, eWaste Empowerment Program for children in the community school. Continued with my interest in environmental issues by becoming a conservation volunteer.

  • I need more than 25,000 I request but to start something this amount will go along way in this small business and which I will able to tell a good story.
  • What ever little funds I get, I will make sure the website is up and running, and make sure of buying Sawing Machine's for the production of eco bags locally and get all the materials needed for the continuity production.

If  anyone who says that start up a small business is very easy, that person is very very wrong and I am sure he/she has never made a step!

Because their would be an ups and downs in coming up with ideas and financial status, there will be 12 hour days and 7 day working weeks, blood, sweat, tears and many more challenges.

But the outcome is going to be worth it. My father has been self employed in his life time same as my mother for over 30 years before they both pass-on (died). If anyone knows how to deal with potential obstacles, they are the one!

I aim to have a strong list of eco suppliers so that if one is unable to provide stock, it can be sourced elsewhere and alternatives can be offered. I will continue to work flexible hours on my environmental role and will not draw a wage until the business is fully functional and sufficient stock levels have been reached.

I am a very hard working and determined person. I am a type of believer that believes that if you want something, you don't wait for it to come to you, you should go for it.

Please do your best to helps me get this word out and make some noise about the campaign to friends and family, even to co-workers. :) Thanks

And do use the Indiegogo share tools to help share this!

story:
Over the Christmas and New Year break, thieves broke into the Calgary Women in Need Society and stole $10,000.

This campaign is simple. If 1000 people seeing this simply donate $10, we can replace what was stolen.

Perks? You get to help someone in need who was unfairly targeted by rather callous criminals and show the world the better side of humanity.

I would have preferred to stay anonymous when setting up this account, as this is not about me but about helping an organization that helps others in need. However Indiegogo does not allow that, so perhaps at least now there is some accountability. I pledge to donate all the money offered here to the Calgary Women in Need Society (WINS). Feel free to donate directly to them if you prefer. I simply started this campaign because I was tired of people sharing this stuff on social media, generating angst and outrage, when in reality we can do so much more.

Donate here (funds will go directly to WINS at the end of this campaign) or directly to them, either way, lets help this organization to recover what was so callously stolen at such a critical time for them.

http://womeninneed.net/donate

Thanks,

P

story:
Our Story

Throughout human history, there has lived and endured a belief in the unity of all humanity - an understanding that there is, at our foundation, a common and essential soil of being human. But it has not been until today, in this moment of history, that the true coming together of humankind has become realizable. 


Emerging Face of a Nationless World is a campaign to connect the voices and stories of distinct communities, worldwide, to show the inter-connected nature of our global experiences and struggles; and to create a platform to facilitate increased communication and collaboration between these communities, ultimately towards building a greater sense of "oneness".  


Already with participation from groups across the United States, in China, France, Nigeria, Chile, and the Philippines, the Nationless World campaign has also received the commitment of support from such organizations as National Geographic.


The campaign is being produced by Stone Forest New York, a registered 501(c)3 not-for-profit, based in New York.


(see more about the campaign: www.nationlessworld.com)



The Impact

As one of our supporting organizations stated: "I write this letter to express my support for Jie-Song Zhang and the Emerging Face of a Nationless World campaign... in recognition of the campaign's artistic and cultural value, and the campaign's potential to significantly encourage mutual awareness and understanding between global cultures and communities" - National Geographic


The impact is that of allowing communities across the world to better see and hear one another, to better relate, to better plan, understand, and work *together*. Our impact is that of walking humanity forward, in taking this inevitable and necessary step in our great collective movement.


What We Need & What You Get

This fundraising is to generate resources by which to produce our next two videos (one being shot around the world), to do continued outreach across the globe, and to further develop our online and offline tools that will create a rich platform for global discussion and engagement. These amount to film production expenses, and web development expenses.


What you get as a funder, is ultimately to become a member of this movement, being brought in to our contingent of individuals across the globe working to build this new, shared world. But there will also be tangible rewards, such as artists' merchandise, that will be given to donors as a gesture of appreciation in standing with us.


Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to donations, you can help by helping to spread our campaign video, as well as by sharing information about this fundraiser and campaign (www.nationlessworld.com) with those in your face-to-face and online communities.


* - All donations will be made to Stone Forest New York – a registered 501c3 – and therefore, tax deductible

story:
My name is JR Valrey and I am a locally based journalist.  I am the Associate Editor of
the SF Bay View Newspaper and have been in that position for over 11 years.  Along with the owners and graphic designer Terone Ward, we have created a successful plan which has allowed us to become the most dominant Black newspaper in the state and arguable in the country, with hard-hitting news and editorial stories.

In 2002, I founded Block Report Radio, which is an investigative news, politics and
cultural public affairs show.  It has been aired in some of the biggest U.S. media markets including New York, Washington D.C., Los Angeles, Houston, Atlanta, Kansas City and of course - the Bay Area. 

We have interviewed world leaders, internationally known artists, giants in the field
of human rights and others including:

The sitting president of Ghana, John Mahama and Chief of Staff of Rwanda during the '94 genocide, Theophile Rudasingwa.

Internationally known artists from various genres of art including:

Film-maker Robert Townsend, Comedian Paul Mooney, Neo-soul queen Erykah Badu

World Music Musicians:

Seun Kuti, Zap Mama, Les Nubian

Jazz legends:

Gil Scott-Heron, Archie Shepp, Roy Ayers

Some of the defenders of human rights including:

Imam Jamil, Al-Amin aka H. Rap Brown

Political prisoners:

Mumia Abu Jamal, Marshall Eddie, Lawyer Lynne Stewart, Puerto Rican Independista Dylcia Pagan

As wells as the late Hajj Malcolm Shabazz,the grandson of Malcolm X and Betty Shabazz and activists, journalists, lawyers and others that were involved in defending the human rights of incarcerated people during the California Prison Hunger Strike of 2013. 

These are just a few of the voices we have featured on our show over the years.  Our goal is to educate people about the true history of the world and vie a working class perspective on the current events that we are living through with the intention of moving our listeners into action - shaping their own destinies.

After parting ways with the Pacific Radio Foundation in September 2013, I realized the Block Report Radio Show brand of distributing news and culture needed to be expanded into a viable internet radio station.  There are currently too many voices being left out of the media, in our community.  Block Report Radio Station will begin to fill the void.  The money people will donate will go to equipment and first year start-up costs.

1. 2 Podcasting Packages: which include mixer, compressor, mics, headphones, amp, and all cables - $2,000

2. Podcast pots (phone accessibility) - $650

3. 2 Mac Mini computers - $2,000

4. Adobe Audition program - $400

5. 2 Insignia monitors - $800

6. Rent (for a year at Broadway and 14th office) - $3,600

7. Promotion material for the station - $550

Total - $10,000

I have been a journalist for almost two decades, and I have witnessed the fact that with the invention of the internet and the most recent invention of the cord that connects smart phones to car stereos creating a connection to internet radio stations, it is now possible to create an international fan base independent of finances . The financial small fish can now compete on a more equal playing ground. This will have a positive effect on everybody who feels like corporate agendas are dominating terrestrial radio. People who are interested in political, social, and cultural happenings affecting working class Black and Brown people are the main beneficiaries of this project. 

Besides donating, you can get involved by joining the national and international community outreach team or also by applying to have a show on the air.

The project will start during the month of January 2014 and will be based out of
downtown Oakland.

story:
It's Time!  

Via Gelato is opening a store in Kaimuki on 12th ave in the old Covenant Books space.  Yes, it's right next to Otto Cakes, 12th Ave Grill and Hale Vietnam!

We need your help turning this:

Into this!

Gelato Factory:

We will make all of the gelato right here so we are building a viewing window for you to see right into the kitchen to watch the process.  It's fun for your kids and it's a nice thing to bring guests over to treat them to a special experience.

And...

We can't wait to unveil our special surprise treats like:

Coffee Jelly! 

(the rest is a secret until we open!)

with vanilla gelato and salted vanilla whipped cream

Lunch...


And...Gelato Making Classes!

We are excited to start our gelato making classes where we take you behind the scenes into our professional kitchen and teach you the tricks of how to use your home ice cream machine to turn this:

Into THIS:

We have the best customers in the world and we know you can't wait for us to open, so... 
Please help us get there!

We need everyone to pitch in, every bit you give and every person you tell helps!  And with the holiday season here, you can give to Via and then use your present from us to give to someone special on your gift list!

For $5 you can get a postcard

For $10 you can get a reusable drinking glass jar

If you give Via $100 and you get:

A Vanity Flavor....Like a Vanity Plate

Only better!  And you can eat it!

We will sketch a portrait of you or whomever you'd like to gift the flavor to, with the privilege of inspiring a flavor.  We will let you know when we schedule your flavor to roll out and you can enjoy your complimentary flavor in the store with a buddy pass for a friend or you can instruct us to pack you a pint to take home.  Your imagination is the limit and you can also give this gift away to someone special!  After your flavor is consumed by all your flavor fans we will take down your portrait and mail it for you to keep!

Or A Part of the Store...

Maybe you'd rather have your name painted on our custom made chairs waiting for you at the shop 

Or a party in our party room!  

We cordon off the right side of the shop and issue a golden ticket to you and each of your guests Charlie and the Chocolate Factory style.  You can cater your own pupus if you like, but your golden tickets are a free pass to anything you want to try in the store.  Perfect for a birthday party, office party or just a fabulous get together!

We couldn't have gotten this far without your support.  Please choose a reward or just give because you want to.  But most importantly tell your family and your friends and share this LINK on your Instagram and Facebook!  You are what makes Via Gelato special we can't do this without everyone's help in spreading the news asking for help!


See you in February at the shop!

story:
Most of you know me as the owner of Poochies Pampered Pups. My name is Rhonda Norden and I have run the very successful and award winning doggy day care, grooming and overnight boarding facility in Sarasota, Florida

Yesterday, Friday December 6th, I was informed I would need to come up with the amount of $9,000.00 due to increase in taxes as well as unexpected improvements to the building by Friday, December 13th

I personally cannot come up with these funds and, therefore, I am asking for your help in keeping Poochies Pampered Pups open. I have spoken to many of you today that are completely heartbroken that Poochies is closing and that their dog won’t be able to enjoy Poochies as they always have.

As you know, those of you that use and love Poochies recognize that we are not the run of the mill operation. Every dog that enters our domain is treated with love, is played with all day long, is given hugs and kisses all day because we treat them like our own. Overnights are in our homes, sleeping in our bedrooms where your dog becomes part of our family. 

I have built an incredible business here that is of value to all my clients and their dogs. If you would like to see Poochies survive and be there for you when you need us, then we need your help. Any and all donations will help us reach our goal.

The impact of your help will also save five people from being laid off just prior to X-mas. My employees are beyond excellent and don’t deserve to lose their jobs.

Please get the word out to friends, relatives, facebook friends, whoever will listen, so that Poochie’s can continue on.

story:
Short Summary

I started this business after I had my daughter.  Looking at labels and not understanding the ingredients worried me.  I decided to research and see what natural ingredients can do compared to those chemicals I can't pronounce.  I found that there are many things in nature that work as well or better than those man made things.  I have worked to make wonderful smellng products that people will love to wash with and leave them feeling clean and fresh. Visit www.foreveryoungbath.biz to see all my available products and use the discount code INDIEGOGO to save 10% off your order.

What We Need & What You Get

I am asking for $3000 in startup funds so that I can really get my home business going.  I need funds for raw materials, website consultant fees and packing and shipping costs.  I belive that this amount will give me a fair chance to start building something that I am truly passionate about.  Your donation will earn you lots of really cool free items that you can try for yourself or share with your friends or loved ones.  Some perks even include special offer coupons for future purchases!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate funds, please spread the word about my small business.  Share my facebook page

story:
Short Summary

Please watch the short video above first.

We are taking a 60 ft by 100 vacant lot in Clinton Hill Brooklyn and rapidly transforming it into a high yield urban farming facility using Aquaponics(a symbiotic relationship between plants and food). The facility will also serve as a training place to teach attendees the natural disciplines (growing their own food, herbal healthcare, easy localized energy production, and a host of other things.

Last but not least it will also serve as a nightly venue in which Jazz musicians (both world famous and up and coming will perform.

This first prototype is the blueprint for a rapidly constructed kit that we plan to replicate throughout NYC, the USA and Europe, and beyond thus creating a global network of urban food production facilities and jazz club in which all participants are guaranteed healthy food, preventative herbal healthcare, and proper wages.

 This prototype facility requires 137K to be built. It will take 6 weeks. Facilities after that will cost a fraction of this and will be assembled extremely faster.

Full Overview Summary

Hey. My name is Malachi "Mike" Basden. I am a soprano saxophonist, audio-visual performance artist; animator and illustrator who is also passionate about sustainability, especially in the difficult times we live in. I am also a certified earthen builder and have taught workshops around the world. My background in the sustainable movement and natural disciplines includes permaculture, aquaponics and alternate natural energy. I've also invented and designed a few things along the way to aid us all to move “off the grid”. In addition, I have worked as an animator on films, TV and have a few interesting and funny interactive/video games coming out later this year.

The Jazzaponics project pretty much combines all that stuff into one important project that will benefit all of us with a lot of fun along the way.

The Jazzaponics project intends to create hybrid naturally built facilities around the world in which food is grown locally using Aquaponics with local residents learning the natural disciplines to build sustainable communities around those disciplines. The prototype for these facilities is in Brooklyn, New York.

 Jazzaponics will not only serve as an urban produce generating facility and learning place, it will also be a network of venues where Jazz music and people come together as a community to listen to music performed by some of the world's greatest musicians. For a small entrance fee you will be fed a meal made from fresh food grown on the property while networking and being entertained.

Imagine going out for the evening for only 25 dollars and getting a really good meal, beverages and amazing music. The premise is for world class musicians to be paid correctly for their performances. And you get to hang out and meet like-minded people from all demographics. 

The days of huge cover charges, 15 dollars for a glass of wine and the musicians should be grateful they have a place to play for cheap are over. When Jazzaponics events take in more money than the cost of the event, that surplus is shared among the musicians and the folks working that venue fairly and evenly. 

It is the ultimate goal of this project to bring food security to urban areas around the world and demonstrate that sustainability and the natural way can be cost-effective for all participants in a number of diverse ways, while setting an example for a new way of existing in harmony with the planet we call earth.

The fact is the planet is in a paradigm shift as I write this and even the main stream media is taking notice with the extreme weather and loss of considerable corn and soybean crops because of it.

Food prices are going up sharply in the US and around the world. The aim of this project is to put as many urban farms in as many cities as quickly as possible while having really great music and a good time. I spend a lot of time in New Orleans. It would be great to have that sort of fun loving musically rich and inclusive atmosphere in Jazzaponics facilities in Brooklyn, NY and around the world, while at the same time making sure as many people as possible have food security. That would be more than cool.

What We Need & What You Get

 We need a minimum of 137,000 dollars to get this prototype facility built. The architecture firm that is extremely good at making sure we have all permits and so on from the NYC Dept. of Buildings is charging 37K to finalize our designs and plans for approval as well as oversee the heavier construction aspects like the cranes to get the shipping containers into place as well as the frame for the roof etc. This sounds like a lot but I have worked with these people before and they are extremely good at getting it done without headaches and once we have the prototype airtight as far as zoning rules, permits, and so on, the next facility in NYC or wherever will be so much easier as we have our template in place.

The remaining money is to be used to set foundations to build all this on concrete. We need to buy the shipping containers and have them plasma cut to our specs, we need steel for the roofing and second and third floors, specialized greenhouse Plexiglas for the greenhouse roof, all the pipes for the plumbing and the growing towers, not to mention seeds, growing medium and supplies. We will have fish for the aquaponics growers and, chickens for fresh eggs daily. We plan to have three forms of alternate energy which need to be implemented correctly. They are not expensive but need some skilled tech people to create convertors, battery storage units and enclosures. We also need shovels, wheel barrels, and smaller construction tools for the earthen building insulation such as straw bales, and sand and so on….

The fact is the initial framing designed is meant to be like a kit that can be duplicated as many times as possible and shipped to wherever we build another facility at a fraction of the prototype costs.

As stated, this is the minimum budget we came up with to get this built. We are initiating another campaign for a smaller amount to develop a personalized version of our growing towers which will generate cash flow by selling small inexpensive and effective vertical grower to make sure you can grow your own fresh food within the urban environment and our musicians have salaries. You can check that out at…LINK

Your help and contribution to getting this done as soon as possible will take form in many cool perks which range from digital albums of the many musicians involved, to free admittance to events, trainings, concerts, merchandise, apps, food grown at the facility, and fun experiences starting with hanging out with the world's greatest musicians - all the way up to a 4 day stay at the upcoming sister facility in Anguilla in the Caribbean. That’s where we are planning to build next!

If we don't reach our goal then we proceed as best we can and insulate the container structures to act as a greenhouse and we will still grow and have the events and music. We most likely would have to scale up on the earthen building component as best as NYC building would let us, and concentrate on the selling of food, personalized growers, and push the entertainment aspect a bit more than the educational in the early days. Jazzaponics is a worldwide necessity so failure is not an option.

 

If we exceed our goal amount then we get the prototype up and running quicker, hire people we will need to administrate that are highly efficient and start paying salaries to musicians.

If we really exceed our goal then the excess would be used to get our next facility up and running quickly.

The Impact

You cannot have infinite growth on a planet with finite resources. The use of fossil fuels have propelled our global civilization to great height but now there are 7 billion of us on a finite planet and the resources just are not there and cannot replenish themselves fast enough.

The party is over in the infinite growth paradigm and now a new one begins with sustainability and back to nature principals even within the urban environment. This is a part of the new let the planet heal paradigm. Don’t get scared, get prepared!

This project has a low carbon footprint, generates food without soil, as well as jobs wherever these facilities will be and guarantees food security, community, fun, great music, and a lot of soulful good times for all.

It is time that as many of us as possible learn the natural ways and apply them with our current knowledge to make something that is new were we enjoy our lives and each other and the planet, and ultimately not have to kill ourselves for fiat currency so that we can eat. This project has many folks that will teach you. It is not hard. It is nature and you are from nature. We all have been taught from birth that we are not… but at the end of the day we are …and it is encoded on our DNA to live as a part of the planet, not it's overlords. Mother Nature always has the last word.

20 years ago I had the honor, privilege and great fortune of having the trumpeter Wynton Marsalis hire me as his personal assistant. I like to say it was one of the best periods of my life, but not the easiest. Wynton was an extremely harsh task master while at the same time really smart, articulate, soulful , intelligent, and funny guy.

I was privy to observe and participate in how he ran his business dealings, take a band on the road, write his music, practice music, and among a lot of other things, I got to see him formulate and execute what was the beginnings of what would later become Jazz at Lincoln Center. 

 Anyone that has been there would agree it is a monumental achievement. The 12 to 14 people that were the core of the organization are still like family to me and some of them are part of this project. 

 I like to think I learned a lot from that experience and Wynton, just as he did from working with the great jazz drummer Art Blakey who learned from  the legendary pianist Mary Lou Williams. If you are not familiar with any of these name please google them, it is part of your history as a soulful human being.

 I think one of the most valuable lessons among many was that people determined to do something together and negotiate the changes while maintaining their distinct individual personalities makes for the creation of incredible and remarkable things. Jazzaponics seeks to take that idea and create on localized levels around the world which are connected by this principle

Jazzaponics is our turn to pay it forward and let the younger generation have a chance at life on a stable planet,  and let others  know these kind of people(insightful jazz musicians, natraopaths, permaculturists) and learn from them and be part of a global community where we all negotiate collectively while maintaining our individuality. While doing something together no matter what race, nationality, age, orientation, creed, or religion.

That really is the Jazzaponics project at it's core. Everyone is welcome as long as they take the responsibility to really want to participate. 

 We hope you do in any way you can. We'll all be happy to see you

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.

Please use the Indiegogo share tools!

There are vacant lots and empty buildings all over America that could be grow food and creating jobs with the Jazzaponics project. I you know of a location that would benefit from being a facility in this project please let us know.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Please watch the short video above first.
We are taking a 60 ft by 100 vacant lot in Clinton Hill Brooklyn and rapidly transforming it into a high yield urban farming facility using Aquaponics(a symbiotic relationship between plants and food). The facility will also serve as a training place to teach attendees the natural disciplines (growing their own food, herbal healthcare, easy localized energy production, and a host of other things.
Last but not least it will also serve as a nightly venue in which Jazz musicians (both world famous and up and coming will perform.
This first prototype is the blueprint for a rapidly constructed kit that we plan to replicate throughout NYC, the USA and Europe, and beyond thus creating a global network of urban food production facilities and jazz club in which all participants are guaranteed healthy food, preventative herbal healthcare, and proper wages.
 This prototype facility requires 137K to be built. It will take 6 weeks. Facilities after that will cost a fraction of this and will be assembled extremely faster.
Full Overview Summary
Hey. My name is Malachi "Mike" Basden. I am a soprano saxophonist, audio-visual performance artist; animator and illustrator who is also passionate about sustainability, especially in the difficult times we live in. I am also a certified earthen builder and have taught workshops around the world. My background in the sustainable movement and natural disciplines includes permaculture, aquaponics and alternate natural energy. I've also invented and designed a few things along the way to aid us all to move “off the grid”. In addition, I have worked as an animator on films, TV and have a few interesting and funny interactive/video games coming out later this year.
The Jazzaponics project pretty much combines all that stuff into one important project that will benefit all of us with a lot of fun along the way.
The Jazzaponics project intends to create hybrid naturally built facilities around the world in which food is grown locally using Aquaponics with local residents learning the natural disciplines to build sustainable communities around those disciplines. The prototype for these facilities is in Brooklyn, New York.
 Jazzaponics will not only serve as an urban produce generating facility and learning place, it will also be a network of venues where Jazz music and people come together as a community to listen to music performed by some of the world's greatest musicians. For a small entrance fee you will be fed a meal made from fresh food grown on the property while networking and being entertained.
Imagine going out for the evening for only 25 dollars and getting a really good meal, beverages and amazing music. The premise is for world class musicians to be paid correctly for their performances. And you get to hang out and meet like-minded people from all demographics. 
The days of huge cover charges, 15 dollars for a glass of wine and the musicians should be grateful they have a place to play for cheap are over. When Jazzaponics events take in more money than the cost of the event, that surplus is shared among the musicians and the folks working that venue fairly and evenly. 
It is the ultimate goal of this project to bring food security to urban areas around the world and demonstrate that sustainability and the natural way can be cost-effective for all participants in a number of diverse ways, while setting an example for a new way of existing in harmony with the planet we call earth.
The fact is the planet is in a paradigm shift as I write this and even the main stream media is taking notice with the extreme weather and loss of considerable corn and soybean crops because of it.
Food prices are going up sharply in the US and around the world. The aim of this project is to put as many urban farms in as many cities as quickly as possible while having really great music and a good time. I spend a lot of time in New Orleans. It would be great to have that sort of fun loving musically rich and inclusive atmosphere in Jazzaponics facilities in Brooklyn, NY and around the world, while at the same time making sure as many people as possible have food security. That would be more than cool.
What We Need & What You Get
 We need a minimum of 137,000 dollars to get this prototype facility built. The architecture firm that is extremely good at making sure we have all permits and so on from the NYC Dept. of Buildings is charging 37K to finalize our designs and plans for approval as well as oversee the heavier construction aspects like the cranes to get the shipping containers into place as well as the frame for the roof etc. This sounds like a lot but I have worked with these people before and they are extremely good at getting it done without headaches and once we have the prototype airtight as far as zoning rules, permits, and so on, the next facility in NYC or wherever will be so much easier as we have our template in place.
The remaining money is to be used to set foundations to build all this on concrete. We need to buy the shipping containers and have them plasma cut to our specs, we need steel for the roofing and second and third floors, specialized greenhouse Plexiglas for the greenhouse roof, all the pipes for the plumbing and the growing towers, not to mention seeds, growing medium and supplies. We will have fish for the aquaponics growers and, chickens for fresh eggs daily. We plan to have three forms of alternate energy which need to be implemented correctly. They are not expensive but need some skilled tech people to create convertors, battery storage units and enclosures. We also need shovels, wheel barrels, and smaller construction tools for the earthen building insulation such as straw bales, and sand and so on….
The fact is the initial framing designed is meant to be like a kit that can be duplicated as many times as possible and shipped to wherever we build another facility at a fraction of the prototype costs.
As stated, this is the minimum budget we came up with to get this built. We are initiating another campaign for a smaller amount to develop a personalized version of our growing towers which will generate cash flow by selling small inexpensive and effective vertical grower to make sure you can grow your own fresh food within the urban environment and our musicians have salaries. You can check that out at…LINK
Your help and contribution to getting this done as soon as possible will take form in many cool perks which range from digital albums of the many musicians involved, to free admittance to events, trainings, concerts, merchandise, apps, food grown at the facility, and fun experiences starting with hanging out with the world's greatest musicians - all the way up to a 4 day stay at the upcoming sister facility in Anguilla in the Caribbean. That’s where we are planning to build next!
If we don't reach our goal then we proceed as best we can and insulate the container structures to act as a greenhouse and we will still grow and have the events and music. We most likely would have to scale up on the earthen building component as best as NYC building would let us, and concentrate on the selling of food, personalized growers, and push the entertainment aspect a bit more than the educational in the early days. Jazzaponics is a worldwide necessity so failure is not an option.
 
If we exceed our goal amount then we get the prototype up and running quicker, hire people we will need to administrate that are highly efficient and start paying salaries to musicians.
If we really exceed our goal then the excess would be used to get our next facility up and running quickly.
The Impact
You cannot have infinite growth on a planet with finite resources. The use of fossil fuels have propelled our global civilization to great height but now there are 7 billion of us on a finite planet and the resources just are not there and cannot replenish themselves fast enough.
The party is over in the infinite growth paradigm and now a new one begins with sustainability and back to nature principals even within the urban environment. This is a part of the new let the planet heal paradigm. Don’t get scared, get prepared!
This project has a low carbon footprint, generates food without soil, as well as jobs wherever these facilities will be and guarantees food security, community, fun, great music, and a lot of soulful good times for all.
It is time that as many of us as possible learn the natural ways and apply them with our current knowledge to make something that is new were we enjoy our lives and each other and the planet, and ultimately not have to kill ourselves for fiat currency so that we can eat. This project has many folks that will teach you. It is not hard. It is nature and you are from nature. We all have been taught from birth that we are not… but at the end of the day we are …and it is encoded on our DNA to live as a part of the planet, not it's overlords. Mother Nature always has the last word.
20 years ago I had the honor, privilege and great fortune of having the trumpeter Wynton Marsalis hire me as his personal assistant. I like to say it was one of the best periods of my life, but not the easiest. Wynton was an extremely harsh task master while at the same time really smart, articulate, soulful , intelligent, and funny guy.
I was privy to observe and participate in how he ran his business dealings, take a band on the road, write his music, practice music, and among a lot of other things, I got to see him formulate and execute what was the beginnings of what would later become Jazz at Lincoln Center. 
 Anyone that has been there would agree it is a monumental achievement. The 12 to 14 people that were the core of the organization are still like family to me and some of them are part of this project. 
 I like to think I learned a lot from that experience and Wynton, just as he did from working with the great jazz drummer Art Blakey who learned from  the legendary pianist Mary Lou Williams. If you are not familiar with any of these name please google them, it is part of your history as a soulful human being.
 I think one of the most valuable lessons among many was that people determined to do something together and negotiate the changes while maintaining their distinct individual personalities makes for the creation of incredible and remarkable things. Jazzaponics seeks to take that idea and create on localized levels around the world which are connected by this principle
Jazzaponics is our turn to pay it forward and let the younger generation have a chance at life on a stable planet,  and let others  know these kind of people(insightful jazz musicians, natraopaths, permaculturists) and learn from them and be part of a global community where we all negotiate collectively while maintaining our individuality. While doing something together no matter what race, nationality, age, orientation, creed, or religion.
That really is the Jazzaponics project at it's core. Everyone is welcome as long as they take the responsibility to really want to participate. 
 We hope you do in any way you can. We'll all be happy to see you
Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:
Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
Please use the Indiegogo share tools!
There are vacant lots and empty buildings all over America that could be grow food and creating jobs with the Jazzaponics project. I you know of a location that would benefit from being a facility in this project please let us know.

We are a nonprofit group of like minded individuals dedicated to improving our communities.

The ACT/ACTE community organic garden is one of the first projects we put together. This will be a place where we can come together to learn and grow organic food as a community.

We are hosting an event on May 4th to help raise money for this cause. This page is for those of you that won't be in attendance but would still like to support our project.

story:
A New Approach to Refugee Response Healing, Training, and Empowering Refugees to Repatriate and Rebuild

AMIE Refuge is a self-sustaining teaching farm that will provide respite and a temporary home for communities displaced by war, natural disaster, famine or persecution for the duration of their one-year refugee visas.     Participants receive access to healthcare, education, and skills training while at the Virginia refuge, and repatriate to rebuild their homeland with AMIE's continued support in the form of volunteers, aid, and an ongoing relationship with former residents. DURING THE YEAR AT AMIE COMMUNITY REFUGE:
HEALING – Participants have time to heal from their physical, mental and spiritual trauma while having basic needs met and access to all the resources necessary to live in dignity and with security, including access to healthcare & counseling.  
TRAINING – Public educators, community colleges, and individual lecturers will provide curriculum tailored to the needs of the group’s home region, to include nursing, education/teaching, infrastructure, agriculture/ livestock management, and engineering/construction. Participants live on a self-sustaining, teaching farm, practicing the model.  
EMPOWERMENT – Participants will educate us on their needs for rebuilding. Access to counseling and expertise in identifying and combating the community’s most pressing needs gives them the tools to prepare for reconstruction.  
 
AFTER A YEAR AT AMIE COMMUNITY REFUGE:  
 
REPATRIATION – Participants prepare for voluntary repatriation, gathering resources, supplies and the necessary skills to return to their homeland at the program’s conclusion, to aid in the achievement of their goals. (In cases where the homeland is not yet stable, or an individual decides not to Repatriate, Amie will provide Resettlement assistance.)  
REBUILDING – Amie provides continued support to the community after repatriation in the form of an accompanying, volunteer-based Repatriation Team, supplies, and ongoing training through frequent communication. Participants spread safe, sustainable peace-building practices through their recently-unstable regions.

 

We are launching this campaign to raise money to have our very first fundraiser. A benefit concert, starring THE SIERRA LEONE REFUGEE ALL-STARS BAND.

This band is phenomonal, and with a back story that would lift your heart. Their wilingness to help, and support of the project has been monumental for the Refuge.

We need the money to pay the associated costs of the event and must rely on financial support to make this happen.

Our cost are:

  • Band's booking fees                        $2000.00
  • Housing/feeding the band                $500.00
  • Food & drink at event                      $500.00
  • Rewards for fundraising campaign   $500.00

All Proceeds from Event and Fundraisng will go to the non-profit, AMIE Community Refuge LLC.

The founders of this refuge have big hearts, unfourtunately, not big bank accounts. WE NEED YOUR HELP to get off the ground.

If you make a donation of $100 you will receive a custom, autographed poster of THE SIERRA LEONE REFUGEE ALL-STARS BAND!

Also, if you can please come and support us at the event. It's sure to be amazing.

Sierra Leone's Refugee All Stars Band Jam Session / Meet & Greet Buy Your Tickets at http://www.amierefuge.org/

Sierra Leone's Refugee All Stars Band
Jam Session / Meet & Greet Barrel Oak Winery, Delaplane, Va. Friday, May 31, 6 p.m. Ticket includes glass of wine and light fare.
$
25.00  Come meet the world-famous band!
 
If you cannot donate here or make the event, please spread the word about our campaign and share us with others. 
 

We cannot make it without your help! Please, support this grass-roots effort to change the world.

"Today's mighty oak is just yesterday's nut, that held its ground." -David Icke

story:
Giuliana Grace Schafer was born on June 25 2014 and tragically and unexpectedly has passed away this morning at 1:46 September 3, 2014. She was absolutely the sweetest, most beautiful darling baby girl and her life was sadly cut too short but the memories will live on for a lifetime. "Gigi" was so loved and brought such life to everyone around her and she will not and cannot ever be forgotten. She leaves behind her mother and two older siblings. The family is currently finalizing the plans to lay sweet baby Gigi down to her final resting place. At this time we are asking for any donations, prayers, and support in this difficult time. All donations will be going directly to funeral costs, cremation, and helping the family get back on their feet in the next couple of months. Any remainder will be given to the other two young children. The family would like to thank everyone in advance for your contributions and love in this difficult time and are encouraged to contact Giuliana's mother Skye Johnson, or Skye's aunt Wendy at any time with concerns or questions about your donation.

Skye can be reached at 317-677-3236

Wendy can be reached at 317-590-0141


We realized that the goal was originally set at $500, however the more donations we receive, the better chance we have at being able to pay the funeral costs that currently are over $2,000. We are blessed for all the contributors thus far and for all of the continued support from those around us. Please continue to keep the family in mind and share the story of this precious little girl so her story can live on within us everyday.


"Teardrops are falling. We embrace this sad day.                                                                          A sweet little baby has just passed away.                                                                                     So perfect her spirit, so perfect her love,                                                                                      So perfect a gift from a Father above.                                                                                        Our child, your family is grieving this day,                                                                                     In our hearts God has told us he wished you could stay.                                                         A spirit so special, so perfect, and pure, should not have the trials of this life to endure.                                                                                                                                                  You wanted a family, that’s why you came. To be loved on earth, and given a name. Then back to our Heavenly Father you went, cutting short the mission for which you were sent.                                                                                                                                    Although our grief is heavy this day, we know you are happy, and not far away. Loved ones have gathered close to your side. Life is Eternal… you’ve really not died. Know that we love you with all of our heart.                                                                            We’ll see you our dear one when this life we part.                                                                 Save us a place where we’ll be close to you, and in joy we’ll embrace, as our love we renew." -Ron Tranmer

story:
I started knitting in the fall of 2012. Shortly after, I learned how to crochet, but it was after a head injury on Christmas Eve 2012 that I discovered that someone could dye and spin her own yarn. 

Living in Greece, without another single soul in the whole country to fall back on, , I decided to experiment and learn by doing by myself. I soon discovered my love for color and experimentation . During 2013, fibers/dyes/books flew in from all over the world, so I could more carefully understand what I was reading in blogs and on Youtube. And I succeeded: I learned how to dye fibers and textiles using acid, food coloring and natural dyes by turning my kitchen into a chemistry lab. I even had an old-fashioned spinning wheel , shipped to Greece l and master I soon mastered it. 


The name “TréLiz” has a double meaning. First, as I am half French and half Greek it speaks to my identity. “Trés Liz” means in French “very Liz-Like” and in the Greek it is a combination of the words “Treli” and “Liz” which combine the words for “crazy” and my name. Why insane? Because I am crazy for COLOR, and I love how different fibers take up the dyes differently, and every skein comes out UNIQUE. 

The Game of Thrones series:


I've focused TréLiz on specializing in very luxurious hand dyed yarn and fibers―not  only because I wanted to give something of the best quality, but also because I wanted to give to the Greek fiber community something it lacked. I am searching for very special wool blends in special hand dyed colorways.

TréLiz is currently still based in my kitchen in Athens, Greece. I have finally made an official website for it, www.treliz.eu. It has sold yarns and fibers worldwide and has started to get some small recognition in Greece.


I am trying to make small packages of yarns, clubs, offers so people can afford my yarns. I intend to even work with designers to bigger projects.

My inspiration can come from anywhere: nature, books, films. I would love to extend my work: by fulfilling wholesale requests, on wholesale inquiries, working on more design ideas,organizing more eclectic collections, writing blog posts and marketing. . 

As the family has to relocate to a Cycladic Island in Greece this would be the perfect time to go independent and gain a fresh start. It is time to break free, find more space and more equipment. 

Here is breakdown of what your contributions will provide:

SPACE: TréLiz is at maximum capacity in its current 400 sq. ft. studio and must relocate.  €2500 has been allocated for the deposit in securing a larger space and to help with moving costs.

SHOWS: Trade shows are a wonderful way of bringing TréLiz to a larger audience as well as connecting with customers new and old. Shows, however, are also very expensive. In addition to registration which must be paid up front, all show stock must be purchased months in advance (€2500)

EQUIPMENT: Time-saving tools are needed to help with production: 

2 automated swifts (€1500 total) which are used to re-skein,

2 induction burners( €1000),

1 automatic drum carder (€1500) to create art-batts,

1 new spinning-wheel, with 4 bobbins (€1300),

Yarn and dyes (€1500)

Labels, printer (€500)

THANK YOU! 

Lise Condis

P.S. Shipping and handling is included in each of the perk levels (including 

international shipping).

P.P.S. You can choose to send a perk to another person, if you are not a knitter but 

still want to participate in my cause!

Why insane? Because I am crazy for COLOR, and I love how different fibers take up the dyes differently, and every skein comes out UNIQUE. The Game of Thrones series:
I've focused TréLiz on specializing in very luxurious hand dyed yarn and fibers―not  only because I wanted to give something of the best quality, but also because I wanted to give to the Greek fiber community something it lacked. I am searching for very special wool blends in special hand dyed colorways.TréLiz is currently still based in my kitchen in Athens, Greece. I have finally made an official website for it, www.treliz.eu. It has sold yarns and fibers worldwide and has started to get some small recognition in Greece.
I am trying to make small packages of yarns, clubs, offers so people can afford my yarns. I intend to even work with designers to bigger projects.My inspiration can come from anywhere: nature, books, films. I would love to extend my work: by fulfilling wholesale requests, on wholesale inquiries, working on more design ideas,organizing more eclectic collections, writing blog posts and marketing. . As the family has to relocate to a Cycladic Island in Greece this would be the perfect time to go independent and gain a fresh start. It is time to break free, find more space and more equipment. Here is breakdown of what your contributions will provide:SPACE: TréLiz is at maximum capacity in its current 400 sq. ft. studio and must relocate.  €2500 has been allocated for the deposit in securing a larger space and to help with moving costs.SHOWS: Trade shows are a wonderful way of bringing TréLiz to a larger audience as well as connecting with customers new and old. Shows, however, are also very expensive. In addition to registration which must be paid up front, all show stock must be purchased months in advance (€2500)
EQUIPMENT: Time-saving tools are needed to help with production: 2 automated swifts (€1500 total) which are used to re-skein,2 induction burners( €1000),1 automatic drum carder (€1500) to create art-batts,1 new spinning-wheel, with 4 bobbins (€1300),Yarn and dyes (€1500)Labels, printer (€500)THANK YOU! Lise CondisP.S. Shipping and handling is included in each of the perk levels (including international shipping).P.P.S. You can choose to send a perk to another person, if you are not a knitter but still want to participate in my cause!

story:
Beware! Halloween is coming! That means the Butcher of Thatcher Court is looking for his next victims! For years, the Butcher has been opening his doors, waiting for unsuspecting victims to fall into his trap! This year, the Butcher and his family of vicious maniacs have moved to Honolulu, scarier and HUNGRIER than ever before!

Come if you dare! Escape if you can! It's A NIGHTMARE ON THATCHER COURT!


Who We Are

My name is Anthony.  I am a sailor in the United States Navy, and a Halloween nut!  In 2012, my wife, Natali, and I began home-haunting for trick-or-treaters.  We started with the 'Garage of Evil' in a 12'x20' garage and worked our hardest to scare the wits out of our visitors!  Now, we are expanding throughout our house, and this time we are haunting for a good cause!   In coordination with Operation Homefront, we are making this haunt bigger and better than ever!  

Our partner, Operation Homefront, is a charity that offers support for military members and their families in times of difficulty.  They work ceaselessly to offer financial, food, and repairs assistance; and to help the families of our service members and Wounded Warriors.


What We Need & What You Get

Home haunting is expensive!  Although we have partnered with Operation Homefront, we are paying for all supplies, equipment, props, makeup, costumes, and everything else!  We denied financial support from them in order to receive all proceeds from our event.  That's why we're turning to INDIEGOGO to help crowdfund for the event.

We plan, build, and setup all elements of our haunts, so we'll be using any funds through INDIEGOGO to make the haunt the best it can be!  


    The Impact

    As a military member, I know what it means to fall on hard times while serving our nation.  However, Operation Homefront is there to help out.  They have helped countless military members and their families all over the country.  It's a great feeling.  To get RELIEF during a crisis, a place to RECOVER if you need it and a little bit of RECOGNITION for a life of sacrifice.  That's what they do at Operation Homefront... and it's making a difference.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't contribute financially to us, there are other ways!  We are looking for volunteers to act, help with effects, and build!  E-mail us at FearBeyondHaunts@gmail.com if you're interested!

    Also, please visit OperationHomefront.net to check out the charity and help out through them with local events and fundraising!

story:
Our Story

Stern Design Works started 5 years ago when husband and wife team Cameron and Rebecca Stern just decided to go for it upon Rebecca's graduation from the BFA Jewelry program at Pratt Institute and open up their own jewelry company and start selling in the steadily growing Brooklyn Market Scene. Recently the Stern Family itself had a new addition with now 15 month old Imogene.

We are regular vendors at the Artist and Fleas Market in Williamsburg, Brooklyn, the SoWA Open Market in Boston, MA, and the Columbus Circle Holiday Market. We work a 6-7 day a week schedule 43+ weeks a year, while still making sure to devote  enough time to our family, all for a love of our craft.

Our work, like our family has evolved over time. We've had many experiments that have resulted in numerous and diverse collections over the last 5 years. We have poured molten wax into snow to cast into metal, have cross-stitched rubber, have created miniature dioramas, and covered a lot of other ground in between. 

In looking to the future, adding the ability to create custom findings, parts, molds, tools, miniature hippos, jigs, and so on, for use in our jewelry, studio, and displays can help further us down the creative path we have been following.

The Impact

In the most basic of ways our work makes people happy and fills them with a sense of childlike wonderment. We aim to create small worlds, universes, and different points of view on our surrounding world. By incorporating 3D printing into our production arsenal we not only gain the ability to create previously impossible objects, we can bring that work to a larger audience, while keeping our prices not only accesible in some cases lower than before, even including one of a kind items.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise at least $900 towards the purchase of a MakerBot Thing-O-Matic Rapid Prototyping Kit and Accessories for use both in our studio, and for creating custom work for customers at markets and shows.


The standard MakerBot kit found here goes for $1299.00. On top of that we expect to spent a minimum of $300 on various materials and additions. We plan on using our MakerBot to create at least one additional reprap 3D printer to further aid in production. 


By helping us you can get your pick of a few various perks, starting at $10 for a lovely personalized postcard all the way up to to $350 for a combo pack of hand-fabricated and 3D printed awesomeness. Plus you'll get that warm fuzzy feeling deep inside.


Other Ways You Can Help

Like us on facebook! Tweet this! Help spread the news of what we do and who we are in order to help us reach our goal!

story:
What Americorps is...

Americorps is a federal government funding program given to non-profit organizations to help fund their programs around the country and around the world.  Hope Worldwide has been awarded an Americorps grant to help fund their summer Americorps internships.  This grant is not much money but is enough to award its members an education award and a small living stipend while they are working for the program.   Hope world wide is currently running three Americorps summer programs; one in Anchorage, AK, one in New Orleans, LA, and one in Philadelphia, PA.  These locations all host special programs to serve the biggest needs in those communities.  It is my strong conviction that this program is incredibly rewarding and valuable to all those who participate.  Recently the Americorps program was almost voted out of existence by our nation's representatives, but thanks to those of us who heard about this atrocity and called in to our state representatives the program was saved for another year.  This program as well as HOPE Worldwide has been a large part of my life over the past few years and has thus become my passion and my career ambition.

What I am asking...


This summer I have been given the opportunity to serve on Americorps as a Staff Member, first in Philadelphia and later in Anchorage, AK.  This is an 8 week internship that spans from June 1st to August 1st.  Due to the rising costs of airfare I am soliciting donations to help get me to philly, back home for my sister's college graduation, back to Philly for the rest of my stay there and then my flight home to Los Angeles from Anchorage after the program is over.  The cost for all of this traveling is about $875.  I am hoping to raise $500 to fund this and the rest my parents have agreed to pay for.  Now this amount is a minimum, if I can raise more I will, but just to get to $500 would be great.  And if you think about it, that is only 25 people donating $20 each...or vice versa..But please donate whatever you can to help me attend this life changing experience. I thank all of you.

Kyle Winje
