story:
Short Summary

Hello. I am Shelley L. Houston, author, president, and founder of Just Dust Publishers, an independent Christian* publishing company. In 2011, Just Dust Publishers (JDP) published its first book, my novel, Julia, Coming Home. There are now 500 copies in print.

We also have published books for other authors who want to self publish--books of high quality, beautifully written and designed, that are in line with the company goal, "To Publish Books of Redemption." These books bring to life people's stories-- some fiction, some not.

In March of this year, I decided to expand the company.  JDP will still obtain and publish works of unique merit, but in our new business model, JDP will not only service self-publishing authors, but truly publish (fund, print, and market) books in circles much larger than previously reached.

JDP now has four authors under contract to have books out this fall. To bring their books to print and to promote these books will take more capital. That's where you come in.

*When I say "Christian" I refer to being a follower of Jesus Christ, not a representation of any one denomination nor political party.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $20,000 to supplement company capital. With that, we will take on four very different publishing projects and bring them to full-market exposure. Further, we plan to use profits earned from these books to publish at least eight books of the same caliber in the next calendar year.

These first four books are seed projects. The harvest will be the profit from the sale of those books. 

What do you get as a donor?

Let's start with some great reads!  There are other incentives, but realize, when you support this cause, you improve the face of the Christian publishing world, as "iron sharpens iron." 

In addition, we are offering some great incentives, stickers, T-shirts, books (of course), and trips to McMinnville, Oregon, the home of Just Dust Publishers and the award winning best little downtown in America!

The Impact

We believe in these four new books. We believe they will sell, but more, we believe they will bring to the world something very fine and, for some, life changing.

Specifically, about the first four books: the first is a young adult novel about a misfit youth; the second is a soul-satisfying art book on the theme of hope; the third is a riveting true account of an American woman who, in March of this year, encountered and recorded the personal story of a child abducted and escaped from terrorists in Africa; and the fourth is an unusual 30 day devotional written on a safari in Tanzania.

Four very different authors. Four not so dissimilar stories. They are stories of life. One thing I know. I know a good story, whether it be film, an oratory, or a written word. Stories that the world is dying to hear.


    Risks & Challenges

     I understand the risks for the company. The books may not be finished. The economy may change, and people may stop buying books. The funds from the campaign may not be enough to promote the books to the level in which we make enough profits to continue. All of that is possible.

    But I am a courageous innovator. I see people's natural talents and was born a leader.  These God-given gifts have served me well in my previous careers of teacher, business woman, and college administrator, and were invaluable as a mother!

    I also sound as if I run this company alone, but that is far from true. Although I am president and the visionary, there is also a paid administrator/bookkeeper and several advisers and supporters, Many professional writers, editors, and teachers have donated countless hours of counsel and editorial help in assessing and producing JDP’s books. We will count on God to send additional help in the future.

    Your contribution is vital to JDP’s growth and will move it toward being a fresh name in Christian publishing.

    SOMETHING NEW:

    In addition, we have formed an alliance with Augur Marketing to promote our books in non-traditional venues, again, reaching the world in relevant ways. www.augurmarketing.com

    Your contribution will move us toward providing a fresh face in Christian publishing.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      No gift is too small, however, I know that some people just can't contribute.

      But, if our passion for this project has infected you, and even if you DO contribute, I would ask for your support to reach our goal. How?

      1) Please get the word out! Make some noise about this campaign! Maybe you cannot donate, but others you know might. To do so easily, use the Indiegogo share tools.

      2) Please continue to follow our progress.

      3) Please enjoy the works of our hands. Order the books we publish on our webpage: www.Justdustpublishers.com or your favorite book site.

      3) And PLEASE pray.
story_txt:
Short Summary 
Hello.
I am Shelley L. Houston, author, president, and founder of Just Dust
Publishers, an independent Christian* publishing company. In 2011,
Just Dust Publishers (JDP) published its first book, my novel, Julia,
Coming Home.
There are now 500 copies in print. We also have published books for
other authors who want to self publish--books of high quality,
beautifully written and designed, that are in line with the company
goal, "To
Publish Books of Redemption." These books bring to life people's stories-- some fiction, some not.

In March of this
year, I decided to expand the company.  JDP will still obtain
and publish works of unique merit, but in our new business model, JDP
will not only service self-publishing authors, but truly publish
(fund, print, and market) books in circles much larger than
previously reached. 


JDP now has four
authors under contract to have books out this fall. To bring their
books to print and to promote these books will take more capital.
That's where you come in.

*When I say
"Christian" I refer to being a follower of Jesus Christ,
not a representation of any one denomination nor political party.
   What We Need & What You Get 

We need $20,000 to
supplement company capital. With that, we will take on four very
different publishing projects and bring them to
full-market exposure. Further, we plan to use profits earned from
these books to publish at least eight books of the same caliber in
the next calendar year. 


These first four
books are seed projects. The harvest will be the profit from the sale
of those books.  


What do you get as a
donor? 


Let's start with
some great reads!  There are other incentives, but realize, when
you support this cause, you improve the face of the Christian
publishing world, as "iron sharpens iron." 
In addition, we are offering some great incentives, stickers, T-shirts, books (of course), and trips to McMinnville, Oregon, the home of Just Dust Publishers and the award winning best little downtown in America!


The Impact We believe in these four new books. We 
believe they will sell, but more, we believe they will bring to the world
 something very fine and, for some, life changing. 
Specifically,
about the first four books: the first is a young adult novel about a
misfit youth; the second is a soul-satisfying art book on the theme of
hope; the third is a riveting true account of an American woman who, in
March of this year, encountered and recorded the personal story of a
child abducted and escaped from terrorists in Africa; and the fourth
is an unusual 30 day devotional written on a safari in Tanzania. 



Four very different
authors. Four not so dissimilar stories. They are stories of life.
One thing I know. I know a good story, whether it be film, an
oratory, or a written word. Stories that the world is dying to hear.

  Risks & Challenges  I understand the
risks for the company. The books may not be finished. The economy may
change, and people may stop buying books. The funds from the campaign
may not be enough to promote the books to the level in which we make
enough profits to continue. All of that is possible.


But I am a
courageous innovator. I see people's natural talents and was born a
leader.  These God-given gifts have served me well in my
previous careers of teacher, business woman, and college
administrator, and were invaluable as a mother! 


I also sound as if I
run this company alone, but that is far from true. Although I am
president and the visionary, there is also a paid
administrator/bookkeeper and several advisers and supporters, Many
professional writers, editors, and teachers have donated countless
hours of counsel and editorial help in assessing and producing JDP’s
books. We will count on God to send additional help in the future.
Your
contribution is vital to JDP’s growth and will move it toward being
a fresh name in Christian publishing.SOMETHING NEW:
In addition, we have formed an alliance with Augur Marketing to promote our books in non-traditional venues, again, reaching the world in relevant ways. www.augurmarketing.com
Your contribution will move us toward providing a fresh face in Christian publishing.

  Other Ways You Can Help No gift is too small, however, I know that some people just can't contribute. 
But, if our passion for this project has infected you, and even if you DO contribute, I would ask for your support to reach our goal. How?
1) Please get the word out! Make some noise about this campaign! Maybe you cannot donate, but others you know might. To do so easily, use the Indiegogo share tools.
2) Please continue to follow our progress.
3) Please enjoy the works of our hands. Order the books we publish on our webpage: www.Justdustpublishers.com or your favorite book site. 
3) And PLEASE pray.

story:
Double D's Bartending Services 


 My name is LaToya and I am the founder of Double D's Bartending Services, LLC. My sister and I are both certified mixologist and came up with this crazy idea of starting a mobile bartending service. How exciting is this industry! We want to create a fun yet professional service catering to private parties/events.   

Double D's represents my sister and I middle name, (I wonder why everyone giggles at the name... lol).  Being excited about this newly found opportunity we began networking and meeting people in this line of work and expanding our network of bartenders.  All of the bartenders we work with are certified and trained with over 200 of the most popular drinks! We began to service small parties and have received great feedback, especially for our personalities and alcohol monitoring.

This campaign is important to us and what we are building because it allows us to utilize our skills in this specialized industry. It allows us to employ new and seasoned bartenders even flair bartenders, We want customers to enjoy their parties without worrying about alcohol consumption or overly intoxicated guests. Lastly, the rate of deaths from drunk driving is increasing and we want to help reduce those numbers. 

YOU will help Double D's  achieve our goals of getting the business up and running smoothly with your support. By extent, You will help us achieve our goals by attracting new customer and/or become a customer and helping us reduce drunk driving deaths..thus growing our business. 

What We Need & What You Get

In order for our business to be successful, the following is very important:

Working Capital/Payroll

Small businesses provides new jobs! We are looking to employed part-time or per diem bartenders in the Atlanta Ga area as well as Jacksonville FL and surrounding areas. 

Estimated cost $20,000

Retainer Fee for Business Attorney  

Every business owner that I have met have stressed to me the importance of having a business attorney. One business owner and a mentor of mine advised me that It's cheaper to hire a business attorney in the beginning stages of your business; to ensure all legalities of starting a business are done properly vs hiring a business attorney when damages has been done and you are being sued. Most business fail within the first year due to lack of experience, improper planning and legal issues. We clearly see the need for a business attorney and the benefits of investing in one especially in a business where alcohol consumption is involved. The retainer fee $5,000 will cover costs of any contract drafted for clientele/vendors/subcontractors, as well as any other legal documents.

Customized Portable Bars

What better way to distinguish Double D's Bartending Services from the rest than to have a customized portable bar.  Not only is it great for marketing but the professional appearance and customized LED light of the portable bar will make any event pop and the bartender easier to locate (for larger crowds), Each of our employed bartenders will have 24 hour access to the bars. This will ensure that our bartenders will be ready and on time all the time. Having a portable bar allows our bartenders to set up/clean up quickly which would allow more time to serve guests. Estimated cost $4,200 and 5 are needed.

Virtual Office 

Owning and operating a mobile bartending business is considered a home-based business in Ga. In order for me to get a permit (Dekalb county requirement) I need a business address. Renting a building that I would NEVER need would be very costly and unnecessary. I came across virtual offices that would allow me to use the physical address as my business address for registration of my business and for meeting/conferences. Estimated cost $3000 

Marketing

I believe we can all agree that aside from 'word of mouth', websites are by far the most important tool for marketing. We live in an age that if a business doesn't have a website we question it authenticity. AND if the website looks cheaply/poorly done we will avoid clicking on any links right? 

Double D's Bartending Services will have a website that will showcase our services, core values, preferred client list, sponsors and professionalism. The website would give customers the opportunity to view available dates for booking with the ability to pay at booking. The website would allow you to view upcoming charity events in which Double D's Bartending Services would be apart of and much much more.

Aside from online marketing, this is still a need for the standard marketing; to reach those who do not have access to internet.  Estimated cost $8,000

Insurance 

Every business needs to be insured.  Double D's believe that every event should be enjoyable yet in a responsible manner. Our bartenders are highly trained in cutting off drinkers professional. We want our customers to party hard but party responsible. Also, being certified and insured gives clients/customers a peace of mind and coverage for the unexpected. Estimated cost $2000

The Impact

How much of an impact can a mobile bartending business have on the community?

Small businesses brings new employment opportunities. We have several independent contracted bartenders that are certified and trained, however, they do not qualify for benefits. We would like to employ more bartenders permanently and as stated above, a portion of your contribution will be used towards payroll. This will allow more bartenders to receive benefits.

Double D's Bartending Services promote the consumption of alcohol regardless of what time of the day. However, we believe that you should party hard party responsibly. That simply means; we want you to enjoy what you are celebrating without the worries of friends/family..etc becoming overly intoxicated.  According to MADD.ORG, every 53 mins someone is killed by a drunk driver. We are skilled at recognizing individuals who have reached their limit and know how to cut them off politely and discretely.  In turn, we can possibly reduce the rate of death from drunk drivers! 

The use of a certified mixologist is greatly encouraged for all events that will serve alcohol. Lastly, we are always looking for ways to help out in the community. Double D's Bartending Services will also be available for charity events booking.

Other Ways You Can Help

Are you as fired up for this campaign as I am, but can't contribute financially? No worries!  Word of mouth is the best marketing tool out! Here's how you can still help without opening your wallet:

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools. (Share my campaign on social sites such as facebook, twitter, Instagram, etc...Let the WORLD know about Double D's Bartending Services)
  • Tell friends, family, co-workers, neighbors,etc...(Anyone you know planning a family reunion, get together, wedding, birthday , engagement/divorce party, passion parties,,etc?)
  • Temporary Staffing (Bartender called out today and need someone quick? Atlanta Only)
  • Subcontract/Preferred Client (Promoters/Hosts, Event/Party Planners looking for professional bartenders to subcontract?)
  • BOOK Double D's Bartending Services for your upcoming event. 
We truly appreciate your time,consideration and contribution to our campaign. Thank you all in advance and remember to Party Hard, Party Responsibly!

story:
The West End Market & Bakery Multi-Farm CSA

We are Augusta's first and only all local, all organically grown grocery store. Everything in our store comes from local farmers and artisans from within 100 miles of our front door. All of our now 30+ participating farmers/artisans are committed to organic growing principles and raising livestock in a humane, natural environment. 

We chose to open our shop in the historic Harrisburg-West End Neighborhood, near downtown Augusta to bring fresh, local produce to an under-served, inner-city neighborhood rich in history and a strong sense of community identity. The Harrisburg community was once a place to fear, but with the help of involved residents, community leaders, non-profits, and local food supporters, it is beginning to reclaim its charm and beauty. Our family believes so strongly in the revitalization of Harrisburg that one of our own even moved into the neighborhood to be our eyes and ears on the ground, as it were.

We opened our doors in November, 2013, through a combined effort of over a dozen farmers (and a whole lot of prayers.) You can read more about us here:

  • http://chronicle.augusta.com/news/business/local-business/2014-03-04/west-end-market-bakery-harrisburg-gives-residents-all-local 
  • http://grubellringer.com/2014/01/28/harrisburg-gets-organic/
  • http://georgiaorganics.org/2014/07/tuesdays-harrisburg/
What are we doing?
  • In June, 2014, we launched our multi-farm CSA program, offering full and half share baskets of fresh, local, organically grown produce to members all over the CSRA (Central Savannah River Area.)
  • Starting with the November-December season, we are offering a scholarship program so that families in the neighborhood can enjoy all our farmers have to offer, no matter their income.

From the first day our store opened, our mission has been to bring the beauty, wonder, and great food from local farms to every nook and cranny of the CSRA. Organic food should not be an elitist niche market. Good, clean food should be accessible and affordable for everyone. Our scholarship program aims to further our mission by including those who would otherwise never consider organic food as an affordable option in their good health. 

What We Need

Our growers are committed to leaving this world a better place - with good soil, clean water, and better quality of life for everyone. That commitment doesn't end with the food they harvest. When we first proposed a scholarship program for our CSA, several of our farmers jumped at the opportunity to bring the fruits (and veggies) of their labor to a worthwhile endeavor - offering to donate a portion of the produce needed to supply our scholarship baskets. 

This seriously lowered the cost involved, making it possible to think we could raise the remaining funds from our community. 

  • Thanks to our farmers (and other local food supporters) we can provide a half share basket each week to a family in need for just $50 a month - that's 5-7lbs (roughly 2 grocery bags, stuffed full) of fresh, organically grown, local produce each week. 
  • Raising $1,000 means we can provide scholarships to 5 families for FOUR months!!
  • Even if we don't reach our goal of $1,000, every $50 we raise provides a half share basket to a local family in need for 4 weeks. Imagine what that could mean for the single mom trying to feed 2 or 3 kids on a minimum wage job, or the elderly couple struggling to get by on a limited income, or the young military family barely making it on an E4's salary.

The Impact

We have been so incredibly blessed since we opened our doors last year. The local food community has rallied around our little shop with their whole hearts. We are continually amazed by the love and support we have received, and the genuine difference our shop has made in the lives of our farmers, our supporters, and our surrounding neighborhood. 

Ours is by no means the only effort in the Harrisburg community. Several local non-profits (including Augusta Locally Grown, Good Neighbor Ministries, St. Luke United Methodist Church, and others) have stepped up to the plate in an effort to improve the lives of those living in Harrisburg. Words simply cannot express the changes in our little neighborhood over the last 3 years, since local foods became a part of the Harrisburg scene. 

There isn't enough room on this page to tell you all of the wonderful things going on - from Augusta Locally Grown's 100 Raised Beds project, to The Veggie Truck, to our store and our partnership with The Kroc Center across the street, to the Harrisburg-West End Neighborhood Association's plans to buy and renovate homes. To watch a community transform from drugs, bugs, and run-down houses to a vibrant, thriving community focused on healthy living is nothing short of miraculous. 

But even with all of that, there are members of our community who are struggling. There are families still barely getting by, in spite of working hard and making the right choices. We have children in the neighborhood growing up on sugary box cereals and processed foods that offer little to no nutritional value. Prettying up the streets and improving the housing doesn't mean much if our residents aren't healthy enough to enjoy a vibrant life. 

To clean up our neighborhood and make lasting changes, we have to start with the most basic of necessities -the food we eat. Cost, the hectic pace of life, lack of healthier options, and lack of knowledge - all of these things affect the choices our neighbors make. We firmly believe that to fix any community you have to start with the family dinner table. Imagine if our world still placed a high importance on eating dinner as a family, using real food, made from scratch, with love and appreciation. Imagine if the family dinner table were once again an American staple. We could fix so much more than just our broken food system. 

    Risks & Challenges

    Our first challenge, when we conceived the idea of scholarship baskets, was finding families for whom our efforts could really make a difference. We didn't want to just hang a shingle and turn our store into a soup kitchen. But, at the same time, we don't have the man-power to screen families to find the ones we could truly help...the ones who can DO something, if someone just offered a little bit of a hand up. 

    Our second challenge was trying to ensure we weren't just making token efforts. Handing someone a little free food and walking away, in our eyes, isn't going to do much to change anything. BUT, if we could develop a program that allows us a more long-term relationship with just a few people/families...well, now. THAT could make a difference. 

    Enter one of our favorite Harrisburg advocates, Marsha Jones of St. Luke United Methodist Church. Marsha has worked tirelessly over the last few years to connect with residents in Harrisburg, to help where she can, support where she is needed, and help connect the dots between all of the groups and organizations working to better the Harrisburg community. Marsha graciously offered to identify families she knows in the community and help us develop our scholarship program so that it can be as sustainable as the crops our farmers tend. 

      What's In It for You?

      This wouldn't be an IndieGoGo campaign if we didn't offer perks, right? We would love to think that just the satisfaction of a good deed would be enough for everyone, but we know that's not really how most of us think (even if we'd like to think we do.)

      Besides, we want you to be a genuine part of what we're trying to do here. We want you to be a member of this wondrous, beautiful, heart-warming community. We WANT you to get something out of it, too. So, here are the perks:

      $25-49  -  T-shirt! We're printing some awesome t-shirts so folks can show off their support of our efforts to rebuild Harrisburg

      $50-74  -  1 half share CSA basket (for our local supporters) or a shippable basket of local goodies (for our out-of-area supporters) A half share basket is 5-7lbs of local, organically grown fruits & veggies. A shippable basket includes shelf-stable items like locally milled grains, preserves/canned goods from one of our local farms, local honey, and other items suitable for mailing.

      $75-149  -  A 4-week half share CSA membership. (That's a half share basket every week for 4 weeks - for our local supporters.) Or, for our out-of-area folks, a larger shippable basket including shelf stable edibles AND items from our farmer/artisans, like goat milk soaps, candles and other cool stuff.

      $150-200  -  A 4 week half share CSA membership, plus your choice of a meat or egg/dairy bundle add-on for our local supporters. For our out-of-area folks, you'll be seriously moving up in the world on this one...you'll get a hand-crafted cutting board from our reclaimed wood magician, in addition to your larger shippable basket. 

      $250-499  -  Our undying love and devotion forEVER! Okay, plus a full share basket, meat bundle and dairy bundle (for our local folks.) For our out-of-area folks, you'll get a $150 online shopping spree in our store via Skype or ScreenLeap. You get a personal tour of the store, in real time, to pick out the items YOU want us to ship to you or a loved one. 

      $500 or more - Sorry guys, this one's a local-only option. For the person who loves their local food folks and really wants to support Harrisburg and our CSA scholarship...we'll send one of our awesome farm-to-table chefs to your house for a personal farm-to-table dinner for up to 10 guests on us (we'll even supply the food.) Washing dishes is on you...but we'll make sure dinner is absolutely wonderful!

      Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

      • Can't contribute? That's okay. We need mouth-pieces to make some noise about our campaign. Share us on Facebook. Email or Tweet us to your friends. Spin a sign out on Washington Road. Every effort to bring awareness to our CSA scholarship program helps!
      • To make it easier, use the Indiegogo share tools!

      And that's all there is to it.

  The Impact We have been so incredibly blessed since we opened our doors last year. The local food community has rallied around our little shop with their whole hearts. We are continually amazed by the love and support we have received, and the genuine difference our shop has made in the lives of our farmers, our supporters, and our surrounding neighborhood. 
Ours is by no means the only effort in the Harrisburg community. Several local non-profits (including Augusta Locally Grown, Good Neighbor Ministries, St. Luke United Methodist Church, and others) have stepped up to the plate in an effort to improve the lives of those living in Harrisburg. Words simply cannot express the changes in our little neighborhood over the last 3 years, since local foods became a part of the Harrisburg scene. 
There isn't enough room on this page to tell you all of the wonderful things going on - from Augusta Locally Grown's 100 Raised Beds project, to The Veggie Truck, to our store and our partnership with The Kroc Center across the street, to the Harrisburg-West End Neighborhood Association's plans to buy and renovate homes. To watch a community transform from drugs, bugs, and run-down houses to a vibrant, thriving community focused on healthy living is nothing short of miraculous. 
But even with all of that, there are members of our community who are struggling. There are families still barely getting by, in spite of working hard and making the right choices. We have children in the neighborhood growing up on sugary box cereals and processed foods that offer little to no nutritional value. Prettying up the streets and improving the housing doesn't mean much if our residents aren't healthy enough to enjoy a vibrant life. 
To clean up our neighborhood and make lasting changes, we have to start with the most basic of necessities -the food we eat. Cost, the hectic pace of life, lack of healthier options, and lack of knowledge - all of these things affect the choices our neighbors make. We firmly believe that to fix any community you have to start with the family dinner table. Imagine if our world still placed a high importance on eating dinner as a family, using real food, made from scratch, with love and appreciation. Imagine if the family dinner table were once again an American staple. We could fix so much more than just our broken food system. 

  Risks & Challenges Our first challenge, when we conceived the idea of scholarship baskets, was finding families for whom our efforts could really make a difference. We didn't want to just hang a shingle and turn our store into a soup kitchen. But, at the same time, we don't have the man-power to screen families to find the ones we could truly help...the ones who can DO something, if someone just offered a little bit of a hand up. 
Our second challenge was trying to ensure we weren't just making token efforts. Handing someone a little free food and walking away, in our eyes, isn't going to do much to change anything. BUT, if we could develop a program that allows us a more long-term relationship with just a few people/families...well, now. THAT could make a difference. 
Enter one of our favorite Harrisburg advocates, Marsha Jones of St. Luke United Methodist Church. Marsha has worked tirelessly over the last few years to connect with residents in Harrisburg, to help where she can, support where she is needed, and help connect the dots between all of the groups and organizations working to better the Harrisburg community. Marsha graciously offered to identify families she knows in the community and help us develop our scholarship program so that it can be as sustainable as the crops our farmers tend. 

  What's In It for You? This wouldn't be an IndieGoGo campaign if we didn't offer perks, right? We would love to think that just the satisfaction of a good deed would be enough for everyone, but we know that's not really how most of us think (even if we'd like to think we do.)
Besides, we want you to be a genuine part of what we're trying to do here. We want you to be a member of this wondrous, beautiful, heart-warming community. We WANT you to get something out of it, too. So, here are the perks:
$25-49  -  T-shirt! We're printing some awesome t-shirts so folks can show off their support of our efforts to rebuild Harrisburg
$50-74  -  1 half share CSA basket (for our local supporters) or a shippable basket of local goodies (for our out-of-area supporters) A half share basket is 5-7lbs of local, organically grown fruits & veggies. A shippable basket includes shelf-stable items like locally milled grains, preserves/canned goods from one of our local farms, local honey, and other items suitable for mailing.
$75-149  -  A 4-week half share CSA membership. (That's a half share basket every week for 4 weeks - for our local supporters.) Or, for our out-of-area folks, a larger shippable basket including shelf stable edibles AND items from our farmer/artisans, like goat milk soaps, candles and other cool stuff.
$150-200  -  A 4 week half share CSA membership, plus your choice of a meat or egg/dairy bundle add-on for our local supporters. For our out-of-area folks, you'll be seriously moving up in the world on this one...you'll get a hand-crafted cutting board from our reclaimed wood magician, in addition to your larger shippable basket. 
$250-499  -  Our undying love and devotion forEVER! Okay, plus a full share basket, meat bundle and dairy bundle (for our local folks.) For our out-of-area folks, you'll get a $150 online shopping spree in our store via Skype or ScreenLeap. You get a personal tour of the store, in real time, to pick out the items YOU want us to ship to you or a loved one. 
$500 or more - Sorry guys, this one's a local-only option. For the person who loves their local food folks and really wants to support Harrisburg and our CSA scholarship...we'll send one of our awesome farm-to-table chefs to your house for a personal farm-to-table dinner for up to 10 guests on us (we'll even supply the food.) Washing dishes is on you...but we'll make sure dinner is absolutely wonderful!
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help: 
Can't contribute? That's okay. We need mouth-pieces to make some noise about our campaign. Share us on Facebook. Email or Tweet us to your friends. Spin a sign out on Washington Road. Every effort to bring awareness to our CSA scholarship program helps! To make it easier, use the Indiegogo share tools! 
 And that's all there is to it.

story_txt: Not Applicable

story:
This is one of those times when need trumps the doubts that keep a whim in the "what if" place. So instead of saying, "What if I went online and hoped people would accept my offer to make things for them in exchange for money...." My life has had way too many "what if" whims that became "coulda,woulda, shoulda" pangs, this idea is going into the "trying it out" column.

I have some things in ample supply, like yarn for instance. And time, I have a lot of free time. I don’t have a steady income right now, savings are depleted, and the job search is taking longer than expected. I bide my time tweaking my resume, looking for jobs to apply to, cat sitting and babysitting for a little cash, doing volunteer work and working on creative projects. It's so lonely though! I can sit home alone while my credit card debt compounds or you can ask me to make something for you. I'd much rather crochet someone a hat she wants or a write a silly haiku you'll smile at than add another page to my personal sketchbook of doodles right now. I really need to connect with people who aren't cats right now! 

I've always loved making things and I'm good at it. I've even co-authored books on crochet. I'm happiest when I feel creative and useful. I need to make some nice things for people who want them. I also really need some money right now. 

This is also a great challenge because I've always had this enormous block when it comes to placing a monetary value on what I do. This is a big part of why I'm in this uncomfortable predicament where I don't have what I need to cover my bills this month. So I guess this is a sort of exposure therapy. I am allowing myself to admit I am vulnerable and need help. I'm also placing a value on some simple things I enjoy doing. By claiming this value I'm stating my time and work are worth that value. 

I just want to connect with you, make some nice things, and pay some bills.

I have a few different options for your perks. Each option represents an area for which I have enthusiasm and better than average skills. Cost of materials won't be high since I've chosen projects that will help me use up some supplies. I really like this idea, to finally use stuff I've kept safe and ready for that perfect project! 

I honestly need as much money as I can keep up with earning! I've set the bar low because my mind boggles at setting the bar at all. 

I will document my making and doing and share this with everyone who decides to participate. I will make each item in the order that I receive the request. I'm asking you to trust that if you pay me now, you will get your handmade thing as soon as I can get it made and sent to you. I will be upfront and honest about my progress.

If you are like me, and can't afford to give money right now please share this campaign with others. If you are interested in seeing if anything interesting happens with this, I will be sharing at suchsweet.blogspot.com . This has the potential to be a daring adventure for me as I battle my perfectionism, fears of rejection, and that enormous money block I mentioned earlier.

story:
Hello,

I was born with a blockage in my urinary track and doctors did not find it until I was Four years old. Throughout my life I have been in and out of hospitals and have had numerous surgeries. Through all this I have managed to work since I was twelve and had a fairly active life. 1993 brought the end of my native kidneys and I went on hemodialysis. In 1999 I recieved a transplant and by 2004 I found out my transplant medication gave me diabetes. After attempting to adjust the medications my kidney failed and I have been on dialysis ever since. Working a 9-5 job is no longer an option for me. A business oportunity presented itself and my wonderful girlfriend is going to help me run it. Unfortunately we do not have the funds to purchase and the banks denied our loan requests. Please see the video. Thank you for visiting and considering helping me out.

Andy Swanson

story:
Short Summary

   

Lisa-Renee Dumas is a certified Kundalini Yoga and SuperHealth teacher.  She has devoted her life to spiritual growth, wellness and nutrition and has a special affinity to supporting and helping people with anxiety, depression and unhealthy addictions.  She has over seven years of experience of helping and supporting this community.

She is the Founder and Director of centerONEself and the President of Dumas Consulting, LLC, a communications, organization and leadership development consulting firm.

She is living a Happy, Healthy and Holy (as in Wholesome) life and is happily married with two children.  Lisa-Renee and her family are active members of The Life Christian Church in West Orange, NJ.

When the call comes to save humanity, those who believe in compassion and service will be the people who understand that they have time for others, and they will live for each other.  This is the greatest service - Yogi Bhajan.


 

Campaign Description

We have a sincere desire and are excited to help people struggling with Anxiety, Depression and Addiction challenges. Through Kundalini Yoga as taught by Yogi Bhajan & Addiction Recovery and SuperHealth Workshops, our On-line Community and Store, we believe centerONEself can help our clients turn within to center themselves with the source that will carry them through difficult times. 

Our mission is to inspire awareness toward a Happy, Healthy and Holy (as in Wholeness) lifestyle for people affected by stress, anxiety, depression and addictions.

We want to build both a local and thriving on-line presence.  In order to reach this goal, we will need a robust website.  Contributors will help with both the building of the website as well as providing the resources to launch a sound marketing

story:
WOW GUYS! 

We reached our initial funding goal of $12,000 with 4 days to spare. We are so incredibly thankful and excited! Now that we've reached the "all or nothing" threshold, we are working towards our stretch goal of $15,000. So if you're landed on this page and are thinking you missed your chance to join the Source family, think again! If we can reach our goal of $15,000 that will cover the fees taken by Indiegogo and PayPal, along with the expense of our Perks, and leave us with a full $12,000 for building a strong, sustainable business. It's not over 'til it's over: 11:59PM (PST) on Sunday, December 15th. 

Source Coffeehouse

The vision for Source Coffeehouse was sparked four years ago at CoffeeFest New York when Matt and Courtney Hartl (that's us!) started scheming up a way to combine our knowledge of the coffee industry and passion for community development into a viable career. For the next four years, we slowly but surely developed the concept for a coffee shop that would center around great relationships all the way from farm to cup. 

Then one day in late September, we were given an opportunity to open that coffee shop we'd been dreaming of. We knew it was the right time, we said yes, and things started moving- fast! 

So, here we are. We’re going all in to make our dream a reality, but we need your help. We need to raise $12,000 by December 15th. If we don't reach our goal, we won't get a single dime, so please consider making a contribution! We're offering a plethora of great "perks" for our supporters, whether you give $1 or $1,000. Perks start at just $1 because every dollar brings us one step closer to serving you a great cup of coffee. 

What We're About

Relationships.

Everyday experiences are elevated by great relationships- and that’s what we’re going to bring to Source Coffeehouse. We want the few minutes (or hours) you spend at Source to be a high point in your day. We’ll start to make that happen from the minute you walk in the door. You’ll be welcomed into Source like you're part of the family, and we'll serve you the highest quality coffee, tea and baked goods prepared expertly and efficiently. If you have a train to catch at 7:00, we’ll make sure you’re in and out the door as quickly as possible. If you want to stay and chat about the farmers who grow our newest drip coffee offering, that’s great too.  

Ethical Sourcing. 

You can feel good knowing that each time you buy a cup of coffee at Source Coffeehouse you're taking a stand against exploitation in the coffee industry. You’ll know exactly where your cup of joe comes from because we are working with Crop to Cup Coffee, a company that has taken transparency and ethical trade to new heights through their relationship-driven business model. 

As they explain on their website, “Crop to Cup is an importer, broker and wholesaler of green and roasted relationship coffees from unique sources. We provide the supply chain tools for our customers to connect with their coffee and its origins, and build successful and sustainable coffee programs. We work closely with each community from whom we source coffee, and we choose expert partners in the fields of agronomy, logistics and roasting. To us and our customers, coffee is so much more than a commodity.”

We are thrilled to be working with this company. You will love both their coffee and the great feeling you’ll get knowing that your money is going to real people being paid real, respectable wages for their work, all the way across the supply chain. We're also committed to providing fair trade/organic whole leaf tea, and we will constantly seek to align our business practices and product line with our values. 

Community Engagement. 

Our vision is for Source to be actively involved in the community around us- from donating our used coffee grounds to local gardeners to hosting fundraising events for area nonprofits- we hope to become a part of the fabric of this community in a meaningful way. We want to do more than just serve you coffee; this is something we'll be intentional about this from day one. 

Sustainability.

We take environmental stewardship seriously, and are working to do our part. From purchasing fully compostable paper products to encouraging reuse with our customized "KeepCups" and Green Card discount, we'll seek to minimize waste and make decisions that reflect our commitment to caring for the earth and the limited resources we've been entrusted with. 

This is our soon-to-be storefront! We'll be on the right, under the "dish" awning. We're sharing space with Toni's Tuscan Table- we'll serve you coffee in the morning and afternoon, Toni will serve you a delicious Italian dinner at night. Black Rock Physical Therapy is moving into the storefront on the left, the former home of Port. 

What Needs to Happen

So, what now? We’ve got the vision. We’ve got the space. We’ve got most of the equipment. But we need a few more things to get this show on the road. Because this opportunity presented itself rather suddenly, we've had to fast track everything and we need to bring in some additional funds to supplement our own investment. 

We need to raise at least $12,000 in three weeks to help us cover a portion of our start-up expenses. While this is the minimum we need to move forward, our ultimate goal is to raise $15,000. This would offset the cost of our "perks" and fees from PayPal and Indiegogo and allow us to use the full $12,000 towards our expenses. 

Here's where the money will go: 

  • Food licensing fees 
  • Build-out: installation of cabinets and countertop, plumbing, electrical work 
  • Equipment: new under-counter fridge
  • Start-Up Inventory: coffee, tea, pastries, cups, sugar, milk etc.

Here's how you can help: 

  1. Can you spare $1 and a just couple minutes of your time? We hope you’ll support this project financially and become a part of the Source family. We’ve got all sorts of fun perks for our supporters, from a shout-out on our website ($1+) to a lifetime supply of coffee ($2,000+). We're creating Source for you and we'd love for you to be involved from the ground up! You can learn more about our perks below and to the right. Your donation of any amount will help us bring our dream to life and bring you great coffee. 
  2. Next, be sure to follow us on Facebook and Twitter. One of the biggest things you can do to help us reach our goal is simply to share this campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, Blog, etc. and get the word out. And how about this: we'll give you one free cup of coffee if you share our campaign with your network online. Just take a screen shot of the post and either email it to us or bring it in to the shop after we've opened and we'll give you a medium cup of coffee or tea.
  3. TELL EVERYONE YOU KNOW! Help us get the word out in "the real world". We've got posters and business cards promoting the campaign, and we can get those to you if you have a place to share them. Have any other ideas for how to get the word our? We're all ears- just send an email to courtneyhartl@me.com.

**To learn more about our financial situation and why we're confident we can get this business off the ground with a limited budget, please head to our Updates section (a tab near the top of the page) and check out the update titled "How are we going to stay in business on a shoestring budget?"**

How to Contribute

Donating to our campaign is easy as can be- you don't need an account with Indiegogo or even PayPal (unless you're giving an amount over $1,000- in which case you'll need to sign up for a PayPal account). You just need a couple minutes, an email address and a credit card! 

To contribute to our campaign, look for the big Contribute Now button on the right hand side of the page. Clicking on this button will bring you to the Contribution Check Out page. Once there, enter the amount of money you'd like to contribute and select your Perk! You'll then be led through a couple of quick steps to complete the transaction. 

Please note that your credit card or PayPal account will be charged immediately, as soon as you complete your contribution check out process, not at the end of the campaign. PayPal will hold that money, and at the end of the funding period it will be sent to us, or returned to you if we don't meet our goal. 

Not comfortable donating online? Contact us directly and we can talk about alternate payment methods. 

Perks!

Each perk we've selected has been carefully thought out to reflect what we value as a company. Our target date for getting you these Perks is February 1, 2014. In reality, many will be available sooner- particularly for those of you who are local and can pick up in store. 

You may notice that many of the Perks include a 5 or 10 cup coffee card. If you live out of town and would prefer we send you a bag of freshly roasted Crop to Cup coffee instead, just let us know! 

First up we have these stickers. They're high quality vinyl with UV laminate- making them super durable and weather-safe! We added the "Drink Local" sticker for Small Business Saturday, and will be giving that to everyone who makes a donation of $5 or more! 

Next up we have the KeepCup and our fabulous coffee. This is not the actual color scheme of OUR KeepCup (we're still working on that), but it shows you what a KeepCup is. It's a super fun alternative to paper cups. KeepCup is leading a movement in the coffee industry away from waste and towards reuse- and we are all about that! Every minute, over 1 million disposable cups are discarded in a landfill. YIKES! Let's do our part to stem the tide. You can choose your KeepCup to correspond with our small (8oz), medium (12oz) or large (16oz) drink sizes, and each time you use it, you'll get 10% off your drink! 

And of course, there's the coffee. It's a 10oz bag of freshly roasted coffee. It comes with a postcard you can send to the farmers who helped grow it. It's delicious. 


And finally, we have our fair trade/organic cotton tote bag and t-shirt! At 13.8" x 13.8" this tote is the perfect size to carry your books, iPad, KeepCup and whatever else you need when you make a trip to Source. Our t-shirt is a black unisex shirt with a slightly distressed orange logo. Both of these items come from Freeset - an incredible organization that provides an employment opportunities for women trapped in the sex trade in Calcutta. 

Who We Are

Wow, kudos to you if you made it this far! Since you're choosing to invest in us, we want to give you a little more insight into who we are and why you can trust us with your money, and more importantly your coffee. 

Matt worked as a barista at Starbucks throughout high school and college. He now works in public accounting, and will be a licensed CPA as of January. His accounting and business knowledge help us keep our feet on the ground and make sound decisions. He knows how to make the numbers work, and how to adhere to tax and other legal regulations- which is pretty important. He also knows how to make a great latte, and roasts his own coffee for fun. He possesses a wealth of coffee-related knowledge that he can't wait to share with you. 

Courtney worked as a barista and manager in several independent coffee shops for six years. She took her interest in the coffee industry deeper while completing her masters in Nonprofit Management at Eastern University. This culminated in a capstone project titled “Creating a Theoretical Framework for the Fair Trade Coffee Shop”, which included field research from coffee farms in Costa Rica. She looks forward to bringing her community development experience into the business and using Source as a jumping off point for deeper community involvement in Black Rock. 

So that's us :) We're so excited to be joining this community, and we can't wait to get to know you. Come in, say hi, tell us your story, drink good coffee. 

Thanks to all who have helped us get this far; we have been so blessed by our incredibly supportive family and friends and these talented folks:

Chris Beesley, our graphic designer extraordinaire who created the Source logo and is designing the merchandise for our perks, and our website, and our everything. 

Hannah Gunnell, our fabulous photographer who took all the pictures you see here.

To us and our customers, coffee is so much more than a commodity.”We are thrilled to be working with this company. You will love both their coffee and the great feeling you’ll get knowing that your money is going to real people being paid real, respectable wages for their work, all the way across the supply chain. We're also committed to providing fair trade/organic whole leaf tea, and we will constantly seek to align our business practices and product line with our values. Community Engagement. Our vision is for Source to be actively involved in the community around us- from donating our used coffee grounds to local gardeners to hosting fundraising events for area nonprofits- we hope to become a part of the fabric of this community in a meaningful way. We want to do more than just serve you coffee; this is something we'll be intentional about this from day one. Sustainability.We take environmental stewardship seriously, and are working to do our part. From purchasing fully compostable paper products to encouraging reuse with our customized "KeepCups" and Green Card discount, we'll seek to minimize waste and make decisions that reflect our commitment to caring for the earth and the limited resources we've been entrusted with. This is our soon-to-be storefront! We'll be on the right, under the "dish" awning. We're sharing space with Toni's Tuscan Table- we'll serve you coffee in the morning and afternoon, Toni will serve you a delicious Italian dinner at night. Black Rock Physical Therapy is moving into the storefront on the left, the former home of Port. What Needs to HappenSo, what now? We’ve got the vision. We’ve got the space. We’ve got most of the equipment. But we need a few more things to get this show on the road. Because this opportunity presented itself rather suddenly, we've had to fast track everything and we need to bring in some additional funds to supplement our own investment. We need to raise at least $12,000 in three weeks to help us cover a portion of our start-up expenses. While this is the minimum we need to move forward, our ultimate goal is to raise $15,000. This would offset the cost of our "perks" and fees from PayPal and Indiegogo and allow us to use the full $12,000 towards our expenses. Here's where the money will go: 
Food licensing fees 
Build-out: installation of cabinets and countertop, plumbing, electrical work 
Equipment: new under-counter fridge
Start-Up Inventory: coffee, tea, pastries, cups, sugar, milk etc.
Here's how you can help: 
Can you spare $1 and a just couple minutes of your time? We hope you’ll support this project financially and become a part of the Source family. We’ve got all sorts of fun perks for our supporters, from a shout-out on our website ($1+) to a lifetime supply of coffee ($2,000+). We're creating Source for you and we'd love for you to be involved from the ground up! You can learn more about our perks below and to the right. Your donation of any amount will help us bring our dream to life and bring you great coffee. 
Next, be sure to follow us on Facebook and Twitter. One of the biggest things you can do to help us reach our goal is simply to share this campaign on your Facebook, Twitter, Blog, etc. and get the word out. And how about this: we'll give you one free cup of coffee if you share our campaign with your network online. Just take a screen shot of the post and either email it to us or bring it in to the shop after we've opened and we'll give you a medium cup of coffee or tea.
TELL EVERYONE YOU KNOW! Help us get the word out in "the real world". We've got posters and business cards promoting the campaign, and we can get those to you if you have a place to share them. Have any other ideas for how to get the word our? We're all ears- just send an email to courtneyhartl@me.com.
**To learn more about our financial situation and why we're confident we can get this business off the ground with a limited budget, please head to our Updates section (a tab near the top of the page) and check out the update titled "How are we going to stay in business on a shoestring budget?"**How to ContributeDonating to our campaign is easy as can be- you don't need an account with Indiegogo or even PayPal (unless you're giving an amount over $1,000- in which case you'll need to sign up for a PayPal account). You just need a couple minutes, an email address and a credit card! To contribute to our campaign, look for the big Contribute Now button on the right hand side of the page. Clicking on this button will bring you to the Contribution Check Out page. Once there, enter the amount of money you'd like to contribute and select your Perk! You'll then be led through a couple of quick steps to complete the transaction. Please note that your credit card or PayPal account will be charged immediately, as soon as you complete your contribution check out process, not at the end of the campaign. PayPal will hold that money, and at the end of the funding period it will be sent to us, or returned to you if we don't meet our goal. Not comfortable donating online? Contact us directly and we can talk about alternate payment methods. Perks!Each perk we've selected has been carefully thought out to reflect what we value as a company. Our target date for getting you these Perks is February 1, 2014. In reality, many will be available sooner- particularly for those of you who are local and can pick up in store. You may notice that many of the Perks include a 5 or 10 cup coffee card. If you live out of town and would prefer we send you a bag of freshly roasted Crop to Cup coffee instead, just let us know! First up we have these stickers. They're high quality vinyl with UV laminate- making them super durable and weather-safe! We added the "Drink Local" sticker for Small Business Saturday, and will be giving that to everyone who makes a donation of $5 or more! Next up we have the KeepCup and our fabulous coffee. This is not the actual color scheme of OUR KeepCup (we're still working on that), but it shows you what a KeepCup is. It's a super fun alternative to paper cups. KeepCup is leading a movement in the coffee industry away from waste and towards reuse- and we are all about that! Every minute, over 1 million disposable cups are discarded in a landfill. YIKES! Let's do our part to stem the tide. You can choose your KeepCup to correspond with our small (8oz), medium (12oz) or large (16oz) drink sizes, and each time you use it, you'll get 10% off your drink! And of course, there's the coffee. It's a 10oz bag of freshly roasted coffee. It comes with a postcard you can send to the farmers who helped grow it. It's delicious. And finally, we have our fair trade/organic cotton tote bag and t-shirt! At 13.8" x 13.8" this tote is the perfect size to carry your books, iPad, KeepCup and whatever else you need when you make a trip to Source. Our t-shirt is a black unisex shirt with a slightly distressed orange logo. Both of these items come from Freeset - an incredible organization that provides an employment opportunities for women trapped in the sex trade in Calcutta. 
Who We Are
Wow, kudos to you if you made it this far! Since you're choosing to invest in us, we want to give you a little more insight into who we are and why you can trust us with your money, and more importantly your coffee. Matt worked as a barista at Starbucks throughout high school and college. He now works in public accounting, and will be a licensed CPA as of January. His accounting and business knowledge help us keep our feet on the ground and make sound decisions. He knows how to make the numbers work, and how to adhere to tax and other legal regulations- which is pretty important. He also knows how to make a great latte, and roasts his own coffee for fun. He possesses a wealth of coffee-related knowledge that he can't wait to share with you. Courtney worked as a barista and manager in several independent coffee shops for six years. She took her interest in the coffee industry deeper while completing her masters in Nonprofit Management at Eastern University. This culminated in a capstone project titled “Creating a Theoretical Framework for the Fair Trade Coffee Shop”, which included field research from coffee farms in Costa Rica. She looks forward to bringing her community development experience into the business and using Source as a jumping off point for deeper community involvement in Black Rock. So that's us :) We're so excited to be joining this community, and we can't wait to get to know you. Come in, say hi, tell us your story, drink good coffee. Thanks to all who have helped us get this far; we have been so blessed by our incredibly supportive family and friends and these talented folks:Chris Beesley, our graphic designer extraordinaire who created the Source logo and is designing the merchandise for our perks, and our website, and our everything. Hannah Gunnell, our fabulous photographer who took all the pictures you see here.

story:
Short Summary

"Munched It" is an innovative new social network that brings people with similar interests together.  Our aim is to make the internet a more tightly knit community where people can go to talk and explore interests.  


What We Need

We need just under $1000 but our aim is to get the full $1000 so we can pay for the merch/rewards and also have enough to fund the entire project.  This is what the money is going toward: 

What You Get

$1 - Thank you email from us.  Guaranteed spot in “Munched It” beta.

$5-  On your ”munched it” profile page you will receive a special donator badge on your profile page showing how much you mean to us and showing others that you donated to help build the site.  You will also get everything in the $1 reward category.

$10- (4) Munched It logo stickers. You will also get everything in the $1 and $5 reward categories.

$50- Your choice between a “Munched It” logo t-shirt OR “Munched It” phone case— iPhone 4, iPhone 4S, iPhone 5, Galaxy S4, Blackberry Z10, iPhone 5C, AND MORE!  You will also get everything in the $1, $5 and $10 reward categories.

$100- You will get everything in the $1, $5, $10 and $50 reward categories AND a grey Micro Plush Blanket embroidered with the "Munched It" logo.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute please send our Indiegogo project to your friends and help us get this project finished.  We have been in production for about 5 months now and can't wait to get it out to the public.  Thanks for all your support :D

-The Munched It Team

story:
Hey friends, family, and everyone else. 
This December I am going on a mission trip with a group of students from my university to Guatemala to work with an organization called Engadi Missions International. I wanted to let you know because I would love and appreciate your partnership with me in this ... with your support through prayer as I prepare for the trip & while I am there with my team, and also with possible financial support to be able to go. I know this may not be possible for everybody, and I understand that, but nothing is too small. If you are interested in supporting me financially, then please contact me and I will let you know what you can do. Or, if you just want to know more about the trip, then I would also love to tell you about it. But first & foremost, I would love your prayers!

Thank you again for your help and support, and what each of you has done in my life!

Here is a link to Engadi Ministries Intl.’s website if you want to learn more about them: http://www.engadiministries.org

story:
Story- Watch the Video! (click picture above)

La Mujer Obrera Community Farm has been working to build a local food system that nourishes families and honors Mesoamerican land-based traditions . We created our community farm as an educational hub where community members can come to reconnect with the land, share in collective labor and build food autonomy. 

This year we are working to boost production, develop educational programming and build stronger ties with our surrounding neighborhoods. Produce from the farm will be shared with volunteers and sold at Mercado Mayapan Farmers Market during the Summer. We welcome all to come and share this land with us.

La Mujer Obrera is a women-led organization committed to grassroots, sustainable economic development in South Central El Paso. 

Support

We need a tractor. We'd like to pay our Tierra es Vida Youth Program Coordinator. 

We are the Seeds! 

Building Healthy Community. Empowering through Education.                                  

We provide nutrition classes and cooking workshops to community members, both youth and adults, in English and Spanish. We designed a mobile cooking cart, which we use to conduct cooking demonstrations and provide community members with samples and recipes at various neighborhood events.

Sustain

Invest in the roots of community building. 

Becoming a Sustaining Member and donate an affordable amount each month. 

Struggles

Located in a rapidly gentrifying community, our neighborhood is one of the last areas with fertile land and farming water rights. The farm is the classroom for our Tierra es Vida Youth Program. 

Share

Spread the Word. Share on social media. Send to your Friends. Volunteer.

story:
ABOUT US

Welcome to our Flibook Crowdfunding Campaign!  We’re a team of flying enthusiasts who came together around the idea of making it easier for you to fly on your own terms. Marie is our visionary and instigator. She imagined and started Flibook after observing the tremendous and friendly potential the general aviation community has to offer. Whether you are a pilot looking to expand your circle of pilot friends, an aviation student who could use some peer support, a pet owner willing to  learn to fly with your pooch, a small drone operator interested in safe flying, someone longing for green flying, or an aviation volunteer looking to find your next mission or increase your impact, Flibook exists to help you!

OUR VISION

Our vision is to bring "amazing" back to flying and responsible wanderlust to our skies!  Our mission is to strengthen and expand the general aviation community. In other words, we are bringing more people to general aviation. 

WHAT IS GENERAL AVIATION?

In short, it’s privately owned or rented small aircraft.

THE PROBLEM

On the one hand, there is a lack of connectivity in the general aviation community, impeding its growth despite tremendous potential. On the other hand, because of pressures in airline travel, we are experiencing the demise of “amazing” in flying. Additionally, general aviation isn’t being utilized at its full potential in rescue and wildlife conservation operations. Connectivity, amazing flying, and rescue operations are causes the Flibook team champions and wants to build on.

THE OPPORTUNITY

We underuse and undervalue general aviation; there is an opportunity for huge growth, expansion, and impact in this industry and with this community.

OUR SOLUTION

Bringing connectivity, strength and growth to general aviation through our on- and off-line Flibook platform. Our dedicated team has solid (even Olympic!) experience in aviation and with the FAA, building social networks, business, entrepreneurship, and communications.

OUR GOAL

People flying on their own terms through Flibook.

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

$4,000 for an interactive prototype

$3,000 for startups.co services that will make us investor ready

$2,000 for legal fees

  = $9,000 (Phase One)

Anything we raise above $9,000 will go towards Phase Two:

Minimal Viable Product/Flibook 1.0 ($40,000)

Now to the fun part—our perks! 

Just for you, our loyal fans, we’ve designed an awesome Flibook T-shirt in a cool color called Prairie Dust. 

We have a beautiful, handmade necklace. 

We have an author-signed children’s book, a true story about a great dog stuck at the pound who overcomes a fear of flying to find his forever home. 

We have gorgeous, original wildlife photography.

We have stunning and colorful wild animal sculptures made from recycled flip-flops, brought to you from Kenya.

For the adventurers out there, we have two one-of-a-kind experiences: An off-the-beaten-path safari 

AND a private flying lesson with our advisor and mentor, Patty Wagstaff, an American aerobatic national champion pilot. This is the chance to meet an aviation icon who is also a great leader and a wonderful person! 

Finally, if your thing is to have Marie and Atlas entertain you, we have got you covered, too!

Flibook is more than a digital platform—it’s a community. We invite all of you to join us, our vision, and our impact. Support us today and choose from one of our great perks. By the same token, you will help our social and environmental impact partners! (Spoiler Alert: wild baby elephant pen pals await you!) 

Spread the word, tell your friends and networks about Flibook. We can’t wait to have you all aboard!

Marie, Ariel, Lori, John, and Atlas

story:
The Ability Experience

The Ability Experience, formerly Push America, is a nonprofit organization that serves people with disabilities. The Ability Experience was founded in 1977 as the national philanthropy organization of Pi Kappa Phi Fraternity with the purpose of instilling lifelong service in its members and enhancing the quality of life for people with disabilities. 

Through programs of all kinds, participants display The Ability Experience’s four core values (abilities, teamwork, empathy and integrity) while serving others to advance the vision of “Creating a community, one relationship at a time, where the abilities of all people are recognized and valued.”

The Event

Pi Kappa Phi's Mu Chapter at Duke University is hosting a 24-Hour Stationary Bike Marathon from Friday, November 6 at 10:00AM to Saturday, November 7 at 10:00am. Located on the Main Chapel Quad on Duke's West Campus, pairs of PiKapp brothers will be rotating through two stationary bikes for 24 continuous hours. There will be food, drinks, and games throughout both days—Stop by and learn more about what this is all about! 

100% of the proceeds will go directly to the 501(c)(3) nonprofit and are tax deductible. Join us in our effort to raise money for The Ability Experience and advocate for disability awareness!
