story:
vekoop?!

Du bist Lebensmittelallergiker, Vegetarier, Veganer oder ernährst dich gerne bewusst und gesund? Dann haben wir das Richtige für dich! Wir bieten dir Shopping "auf Rezept" und machen mit unserer prämierten Idee aus dem eCommerce den SocialCommerce: vekoop schafft ein nachhaltiges und soziales Einkaufserlebnis, bei dem ihr als Kunde zum Partner werdet!

Was es bei vekoop gibt? Rein pflanzliche Lebensmittel und Produkte für Allergiker, Vegetarier, Veganer und natürlich für alle, die sich mit bewusster Ernährung auseinandersetzen! Wir helfen euch dabei, endlich die richtigen Produkte zu bekommen und bieten zusätzlich einfach zu bestellende Rezeptebundles für jeden Ernährungstypen.

Nutzt eure Chance, Partner zu werden und unser Projekt zu unterstützen. Mit eurer Hilfe können wir im Rahmen des Wettbewerbs Gründer-Garage bei Erreichen der Fundingschwelle auf indiegogo noch zusätzlich 10.000 Euro zu gewinnen!

Was macht vekoop so besonders?

Onlineshops gibt es viele. Wir aber bieten neue und innovative Elemente in der Shopsoftware. Dazu gehören:

  • Ein innovativer Warenkorb, der mitdenkt und Produkte nach den Bedürfnissen und Wünschen der Kunden automatisch austauscht
  • Eine einzigartige Kundenmaske, um persönliche Präferenzen (Allergene, bestimmte Inhaltsstoffe) zu hinterlegen, damit diese in Zukunft im Shop automatisch ausgeschlossen werden können
  • Shopping „auf Rezept“: Alle Zutaten eines Rezeptes lassen sich auf Wunsch auf einmal in den Warenkorb legen
  • Beim Einkaufen weitere Rezepte, die auf den Produkten im Warenkorb basieren, vorgeschlagen bekommen
  • SocialCommerce-Funktionen im Shop - Kunden können live kommunizieren, Rezepte und Produkte für den Shop vorschlagen und darüber in Echtzeit abstimmen, ein öffentliches Profil anlegen und Experten-Ränge erreichen.

Wir sind also mehr als nur ein Onlineshop: Bei uns ist eine ganze Community angeschlossen. Über die innovativen Shopfunktionen hinaus bieten wir:

  • die Erstellung von Ratgebern in Buchform in Zusammenarbeit mit der Community und externen Partnern wie Restaurants und Cafés
  • persönliche Erfahrungen und große Nähe zu unseren Kunden
  • ein großes Partner-Netzwerk

Unsere Seite, vekoop.de, wird dazu Schritt für Schritt um Funktionen erweitert. Ein Besuch lohnt sich natürlich bereits jetzt!

Das Team und unser Know-How

Wer steckt hinter vekoop? Timo Schliep, 34, und Sebastian Brandstetter, 27. Wir haben uns im Masterstudium im Rahmen eines Gründerseminars zusammengetan und seitdem an dem Konzept für vekoop gearbeitet. Wir bringen jahrelange Erfahrung in den Bereichen Vertrieb, Marketing, Mediengestaltung und Journalismus/PR in das Projekt mit ein. Darüber hinaus sind wir beide von Lebensmittelallergien und -intoleranzen betroffen. Nicht nur deswegen ist uns bewusste Ernährung wichtig!

Für unsere Idee wurden wir bereits mit dem Gründercampus-Preis vom Land Niedersachsen ausgezeichnet, zudem haben wir einen eCommerce-Wettbewerb von TLC communications gewonnen. Unser Businessplan ist also von Experten überprüft. Außerdem können wir weiterhin jederzeit auf unseren Coach am Gründungszentrum der Uni Oldenburg und viel Expertise im Bekanntenkreis zurückgreifen.

Im Bild seht ihr Timo (links) und Sebastian (rechts) in Hannover nach unserer erfolgreichen Konzeptpräsentation beim Gründercampus Niedersachsen.

Wie könnt ihr helfen?

Wir sind mit der Umsetzung unserer Idee bereits auf einem guten Weg, doch wie jedes Unternehmen brauchen wir finanziellen Spielraum, um als Start-Up einen weiteren Schritt zu machen und möglichst gesund wachsen zu können.

Daher möchten wir durch das Crowdfunding unsere Finanzen erweitern, um so die Fertigstellung unserer Shopsoftware durch zusätzliche Arbeitskraft zu beschleunigen. Wir merken, wie die heiße Phase beginnt und könnten so schneller in die Produktivität starten! 

Zudem wollen wir unserer ersten Ratgeber in die Druckerei schicken. Die Mehrzahl der Restaurants und Cafés für die Inhalte sind bereits gewonnen, die Erstellung der Druckvorlage nähert sich dem Ende und so wird es bald Zeit für den Druck. Das Buch als Produkt der Community für die Community eignet sich perfekt fürs Crowdfunding!

Für eure Unterstützung haben wir verschiedene Supporter-Packs geschnürt. Holt euch unseren Ratgeber in gedruckter Form; ein tolles T-Shirt, von unserem Partner Neverhill ökologisch nachhaltig und fair produziert; das Privileg, mit dem eigenen Rezeptebundle auf unserer Seite vertreten zu sein oder Rabatte für unseren Shop! Jeder Unterstützer wird natürlich namentlich als Unterstützer auf unserer Seite genannt. Als Mitglied der Community könnt ihr auch unabhängig davon mitentscheiden, Produktwünsche äußern und Vorschläge einreichen. 

Großartig für uns ist natürlich die Chance, den benötigten Betrag fast noch einmal verdoppeln zu können. Möglich wird dies durch den bereits genannten Wettbewerb der Gründer-Garage: Bei Erreichen unserer Funding-Stelle haben wir die riesige Möglichkeit, mit 10.000 Euro extra gefördert zu werden! Eure Unterstützung bringt uns diesem Ziel einen großen Schritt näher!

Und warum sind wir unterstützenswert?

Ganz einfach: Weil wir die Dinge anders angehen und in vekoop mehr als nur ein Unternehmen sehen. Wir wollen ein Miteinander von Kunde und Verkäufer, ein Geben und Nehmen. Als persönlich Betroffene haben wir uns einen Markt ausgesucht, der uns sehr wichtig ist. Wir wissen, wie schwer es ist, die richtigen Produkte online und offline zu finden. Bei uns könnt Ihr nicht nur eine große Auswahl rein pflanzlicher Produkte finden, sondern auch Wünsche äußern und darüber abstimmen, wie das Sortiment erweitert werden soll - in Form von Produkten und in Form von Rezeptebundles! Ihr seid nicht nur Kunden, sondern Partner des Shops, der sich gezielt an euch und eure Bedürfnisse anpassen soll. In der zugehörigen Community könnt ihr euch austauschen, Rezepte einstellen, Restaurantempfehlen aussprechen, Bewertungen hinterlegen. Im Shop könnt ihr Allergien angeben und bekommt fortan nur noch passende Produkte angezeigt. Ihr habt die Möglichkeit, ganze Bundles zu kaufen und hier zu sparen. Außerdem bieten wir durch Ratgeber und Social-Media-Elemente ein „Mehr“ an Informationen auch für unerfahrenere Käufer, um so ein einfaches, unbeschwertes Einkaufen zu ermöglichen.

Uns ist bei all unseren Aktivitäten aber auch die Nachhaltigkeit des Unternehmens selbst wichtig: Unser Strom ist Ökostrom, Pakete werden CO2-neutral verschickt, wir haben klimafreundliches Webhosting und eine Bank, die Nachhaltigkeit und soziale Projekte fördert. Weiterhin werden wir alle Überschüsse, die aus dem Verkauf des ersten Buches "veguide" generiert werden, spenden - ebenso wie einen Teil des späteren Gewinns unseres Shops. Die Spenden werden humanitären, nachhaltigen und im Bereich des Tierschutz tätigen Organisationen zukommen. Welche Organisationen das im Detail sein werden, werdet natürlich auch ihr als Teil der Community sowie alle weiteren Besucher und Kunden unserer Seite mit entscheiden können!

Alles klar? Dann seid Ihr gefragt!

Ihr seid überzeugt? Dann brauchen wir eure Unterstützung! Sichert euch eins der tollen Supporter-Packs. Knapp bei Kasse? Erzählt euren Freunden von der Kampagne, teilt sie in den sozialen Netzwerken, steuert Ideen bei! Wir sind auf euch gespannt und danken schon im Vorfeld!

Euer Team von vekoop,

Timo & Sebastian

 

PS. Verlinkt uns doch bitte! 

 Facebook

 Twitter

 Google+
story_txt:
vekoop?!
Du bist Lebensmittelallergiker, Vegetarier, Veganer oder ernährst dich gerne bewusst und gesund? Dann haben wir das Richtige für dich! Wir bieten dir Shopping "auf Rezept" und machen mit unserer prämierten Idee aus dem eCommerce den SocialCommerce: vekoop schafft ein nachhaltiges und soziales Einkaufserlebnis, bei dem ihr als Kunde zum Partner werdet!
Was es bei vekoop gibt? Rein pflanzliche Lebensmittel und Produkte für Allergiker, Vegetarier, Veganer und natürlich für alle, die sich mit bewusster Ernährung auseinandersetzen! Wir helfen euch dabei, endlich die richtigen Produkte zu bekommen und bieten zusätzlich einfach zu bestellende Rezeptebundles für jeden Ernährungstypen.
Nutzt eure Chance, Partner zu werden und unser Projekt zu unterstützen. Mit eurer Hilfe können wir im Rahmen des Wettbewerbs Gründer-Garage bei Erreichen der Fundingschwelle auf indiegogo noch zusätzlich 10.000 Euro zu gewinnen!
Was macht vekoop so besonders?
Onlineshops gibt es viele. Wir aber bieten neue und innovative Elemente in der Shopsoftware. Dazu gehören:

Ein innovativer Warenkorb, der mitdenkt und Produkte nach den Bedürfnissen und Wünschen der Kunden automatisch austauscht
Eine einzigartige Kundenmaske, um persönliche Präferenzen (Allergene, bestimmte Inhaltsstoffe) zu hinterlegen, damit diese in Zukunft im Shop automatisch ausgeschlossen werden können
Shopping „auf Rezept“: Alle Zutaten eines Rezeptes lassen sich auf Wunsch auf einmal in den Warenkorb legen
Beim Einkaufen weitere Rezepte, die auf den Produkten im Warenkorb basieren, vorgeschlagen bekommen
SocialCommerce-Funktionen im Shop - Kunden können live kommunizieren, Rezepte und Produkte für den Shop vorschlagen und darüber in Echtzeit abstimmen, ein öffentliches Profil anlegen und Experten-Ränge erreichen.

Wir sind also mehr als nur ein Onlineshop: Bei uns ist eine ganze Community angeschlossen. Über die innovativen Shopfunktionen hinaus bieten wir:

die Erstellung von Ratgebern in Buchform in Zusammenarbeit mit der Community und externen Partnern wie Restaurants und Cafés
persönliche Erfahrungen und große Nähe zu unseren Kunden
ein großes Partner-Netzwerk

Unsere Seite, vekoop.de, wird dazu Schritt für Schritt um Funktionen erweitert. Ein Besuch lohnt sich natürlich bereits jetzt!
Das Team und unser Know-How
Wer steckt hinter vekoop? Timo Schliep, 34, und Sebastian Brandstetter, 27. Wir haben uns im Masterstudium im Rahmen eines Gründerseminars zusammengetan und seitdem an dem Konzept für vekoop gearbeitet. Wir bringen jahrelange Erfahrung in den Bereichen Vertrieb, Marketing, Mediengestaltung und Journalismus/PR in das Projekt mit ein. Darüber hinaus sind wir beide von Lebensmittelallergien und -intoleranzen betroffen. Nicht nur deswegen ist uns bewusste Ernährung wichtig!
Für unsere Idee wurden wir bereits mit dem Gründercampus-Preis vom Land Niedersachsen ausgezeichnet, zudem haben wir einen eCommerce-Wettbewerb von TLC communications gewonnen. Unser Businessplan ist also von Experten überprüft. Außerdem können wir weiterhin jederzeit auf unseren Coach am Gründungszentrum der Uni Oldenburg und viel Expertise im Bekanntenkreis zurückgreifen.
Im Bild seht ihr Timo (links) und Sebastian (rechts) in Hannover nach unserer erfolgreichen Konzeptpräsentation beim Gründercampus Niedersachsen.

Wie könnt ihr helfen?


Wir sind mit der Umsetzung unserer Idee bereits auf einem guten Weg, doch wie jedes Unternehmen brauchen wir finanziellen Spielraum, um als Start-Up einen weiteren Schritt zu machen und möglichst gesund wachsen zu können.
Daher möchten wir durch das Crowdfunding unsere Finanzen erweitern, um so die Fertigstellung unserer Shopsoftware durch zusätzliche Arbeitskraft zu beschleunigen. Wir merken, wie die heiße Phase beginnt und könnten so schneller in die Produktivität starten! 
Zudem wollen wir unserer ersten Ratgeber in die Druckerei schicken. Die Mehrzahl der Restaurants und Cafés für die Inhalte sind bereits gewonnen, die Erstellung der Druckvorlage nähert sich dem Ende und so wird es bald Zeit für den Druck. Möglich wird dies durch den bereits genannten Wettbewerb der Gründer-Garage: Bei Erreichen unserer Funding-Stelle haben wir die riesige Möglichkeit, mit 10.000 Euro extra gefördert zu werden! Eure Unterstützung bringt uns diesem Ziel einen großen Schritt näher!


Und warum sind wir unterstützenswert?

story:
Our Story

After sharing my highly sought after social media course with hundreds of entrepreneurs, teams, authors and just regular Jane's & Joe's, I have decided to "take the show on the road" so to speak! My #1 goal is to provide a clear solid impact and understanding around social media and the top 3 opportunities on the most popular - and least optimized - social networks. I've had the privilege of being a very useful strategist to a LOT of people, and plan to continue that impact in as many venues as possible.  


The Impact

The impact of this event will be to give EVERY person who attends two solid strategic ideas for their business and the tools to carry that out. I'm also going to continue to work with every attendee, at no further cost, for 8 weeks. The knowledge AND the coach to help you utilize it. THAT is the impact! 


What We Need & What You Get

I need a handful of investors (or an army of small ones)! What you get... well, by all means, come to the event! Anyone who donates $97 can come to the event (and bring a friend for free!). Anyone who donates $200 gets a 15-minute strategy session with me.  For more, see the perks section!  


Other Ways You Can Help

You can post this to your Facebook Wall, Tweet it, Share it, and eMail it to your friends & colleagues.  :)

story:
Our Vision & Purpose...


The North Valley Food Co-op is currently re-organizing to become a trusted source of natural foods and local products, and a reliable resource for consumer information and education in Shasta County, CA. We represent a dedicated group of core volunteers and 65 members who have come together to work with this purpose in mind. We are actively cooperating with other regional consumer food co-ops and organizations like Growing Local Coalition http://growinglocal.blogspot.com/ and the California Center for Cooperative Development http://www.cccd.coop/ who can encourage our development by providing training, technical resources and grant writing assistance for co-op development. This site has been set up as one way to help raise funds so that we can turn our vision for the North Valley Food Co-op into a reality. Please help us reach our goal!


Our Values...


COOPERATION

  1. We work together.
  2. We strive to reach mutually beneficial outcomes.
  3. We make decisions based on the common interest of owners.


SUSTAINABLE PRACTICES

  1. We operate as a sustainable business.
  2. We respect the natural environment and act accordingly.
  3. We work toward a sustainable community and a just society.


SUPPORT FOR HEALTHY CHOICES

  1. We provide healthful products.
  2. We provide information about healthy choices.
  3. We respect diverse opinions about what is healthy.


BELIEF IN COOPERATIVE ECONOMICS

  1. We have voluntary and open ownership.
  2. We encourage owner involvement.
  3. Each owner has one vote.
  4. Owner financial return is proportionate to patronage.


OPEN, HONEST AND TRUSTWORTHY BUSINESS PRACTICES

  1. We are ethical in our business practices.
  2. We encourage healthy debate.
  3. We respect and invest in the professionalism of our staff.


Our Potential Impact...

Most food co-ops, whether they are 40 years old, or 5, started the same way: With people coming together in places where they live and work to collectively do something for the common good. Those area residents from decades past who decided to start food co-ops here might not have had any idea that their stores would one day become multimillion-dollar businesses, part of a network of national food cooperation. 


Food co-ops have been a model for businesses responsive to community needs, as well as a stimulant for local economic growth. In recent years, their impact on local sustainable agriculture and the neighborhoods they serve has been remarkable. Co-ops partner with many area producers and organizations to bring fresh local food to communities while providing sustainable family farms with a larger market to reach out to consumers. They’re also among the first to lend a hand when crisis strikes. One of the main differences between co-ops and other ownership structures is that owners get a share of the profit based on how much they use the co-op. 


Authentically Local...

Another thing co-ops have historically done well is raise awareness among consumers for the importance of local, sustainably produced food. Not only does this strengthen the food co-ops’ links to farmers, it also widens the economic impact. Studies show that for $100 spent at a locally owned business, $45 is recycled into the local economy, versus only $14 when the $100 is spent in a national chain.


Community Ownership – Community ownership means member-owners have a say in how the business is run. Community ownership preserves and celebrates what is unique and local. Community ownership fights corporate hegemony!


Board Representation – A Board of elected co-op members represents The Food Co-op’s members. The Board sets policy and supervises the operations of the co-op. Each member gets one vote.


Teaching the Basics...

Another way food co-ops serve communities is through education. Although a lot of education happens every day in store aisles, classrooms are where the co-op principle of education is delivered more formally. “Education is a huge part of our store,” said Liz McMann, education and special projects manager at the St. Paul co-op. “We offer practical cooking classes and shopping tips. We gear classes toward the average person getting dinner on the table, as well as teach those with special dietary needs or preferences how to deal with them. We also have fun classes for do-it-yourself activities, such as how to make your own vinegar or dog food.”


And Reaching Out...

According to Charli Mills, marketing communications manager at Valley Natural Foods, another way co-ops serve communities is through donations and outreach programs. In the past nine years, Valley’s donations have increased from $500 per year to $51, 000—an increase of 255 percent. “Our board developed a vision for donations and set specific goals for increasing our outreach to the community,” Mills noted. “The whole idea is to create community,” Mills said. The more economically healthy our co-op is, the more we can give back to the community organizations that serve us.”


Other Ways You Can Help...


Please email us at ourfoodcoop@gmail.com or growinglocalshasta@gmail.com to find out more about membership and how you can get involved helping to build the North Valley Food Co-op.

story:
Please find it in your heart to help fulfill 2 dreams of a special 10yr old. Sierra has made it to the AAU National Junior Olympics 2012, down in Houston, Tx! Sierra will try for a national title in the open 400M, 200M and the Long Jump.

3 weeks later, Sierra is expected to be in Los Angeles, Ca to meet with Wilhelmina Models for a huge casting.

Sierra is a very talented 10yr old who loves Track & Field and Modeling. Sierra has excelled in Track at a very early age and has an appreciation for it. Her specialties are the open 400M, 200M, and Long Jump. Sierra idolizes my former trackmate LoLo Jones. When Sierra is off the track, she loves playing with her older brother Jaylen who has Cerebral Palsy, playing with her puppy and she rips the runway modeling all the latest trends. For only being 10yrs old, Sierra stands at a whooping 5'3! Sierra has been compared to a young Tyra Banks : )

Sierra was crowned:

Most Beautiful Baby Iowa State Pageant 2004

Runner up Miss Cinderella Pageant Omaha,Ne 2004

Most Beautiful Eyes Iowa Pageant 2004

Miss Personality Iowa Pageant 2005

Top 10 Finalist for Regis and Kelly Coolpix Beautiful Kid Contest 2006

The Goal of $7,000 will help with:

Flights for Sierra and one adult(Mom) to Houston,Tx and Los Angeles, Ca.

Lodging in both states.

Registration to AAU Junior Olympics and new running suit.

Meals and ground transportaion in both states.

Any extra cost business related.

Any money donated over the asking amount will be donated to providing Christmas gifts to children with disabilities, services at the Ronald McDonald House who serves children going through medical situations and helps the families through those tough times, and services to babies in neonatal intensive care wards.

story:
StillFighting.org is an online support system for military personnel who need help successfully transitioning back to civilian life.

We will provide an online forum where soldiers can comfortably share their experiences with one another, as well as seek help from registered mental health professionals.


I read a story awhile back that covered the difficulties that many soldiers were having upon return to the states, many with understandable inability to pick back up where they left off. My fiancee and I thought that perhaps a virtual community, based around a simple forum, could be useful to some veterans. Ideally, we want to either hire or entice to volunteer health care professionals who would be willing to help.

This can also be used in the future to connect veterans with each other, perhaps as a way to plan meetups and/or support groups.

A recent TIME magazine cover story declared that one U.S. soldier commits suicide per day. We want to help now, however we can.

(Note: the above article is subscribers-only, but more information can also be found here.)


Make a contribution to support the purchase of fliers, t-shirts, bumper stickers and rich media ads. Backers will be honored in their own special section of the StillFighting.org website, along with additional perks.

All funds will be used to support this project and expenses listed on the StillFighting.org blog.


An online community is only as sucessful as its participants, so we want to get the word out quickly to those who will use this forum. Here are some of the ideas that I've had which will require funding, though I am also open to suggestions from contributors:

  • Fliers: I have about 5,000 of these. We've already flown to DC once to distribute these at the Marine Corp Marathon and the Washington DC VA Medical Center, but it will be more cost-effective to ship them to centers and businesses which have agreed to display them. We'd love to send these out specifically to non-profits with similiar missions. Most of the funds that I hope to raise will go towards the printing and shipping of these fliers.
  • T-shirts with the StillFighting.org logo and domain name will be sold through an online store, with any profit either going towards the maintenance of the site or a specified charity. This will also help to spread the word. I also plan to give them out at local amateur fights and to local gyms, but it would be great to be able to ship these and other free items such as bumper stickers to outside locations, including veterans' hospitals or even military bases.
  • Rich Media Banners will be purchased for placement on relevant websites and blogs. These will be intelligently targeted to those who are searching for a place where they can talk openly with their peers of similar experience.


I'm still working on the vbulletin skin and will be detailing my progress on the StillFighting.org blog. But while I've got that covered, there's always room for more help:

  • Volunteer as a Moderator... Do you know a registered health care professional who would be willing to help? Please encourage that person to volunteer their attention as a moderator of the boards.

  • Participate... Get on the forums and talk to these veterans, ask questions and give back by being there when they need someone to connect with. Check out the existing blogs or create and share one yourself.

  • Link Up... Link to StillFighting.org or this campaign in order to raise awareness not only of the issue, but of this potential tool for dealing with symptoms. If you've got a similar project, let me know and I'll add a link to your site.

  • Spread the word... If you know anyone who might find this project of interest, either as a funder or community member, then let them know. That old cliche about "...if it helps one person" actually applies here. I appreciate your help.
story_txt:
StillFighting.org is an online support system for military personnel who need help successfully transitioning back to civilian life.
We will provide an online forum where soldiers can comfortably share their experiences with one another, as well as seek help from registered mental health professionals.

I read a story awhile back that covered the difficulties that many soldiers were having upon return to the states, many with understandable inability to pick back up where they left off. My fiancee and I thought that perhaps a virtual community, based around a simple forum, could be useful to some veterans. Ideally, we want to either hire or entice to volunteer health care professionals who would be willing to help.

This can also be used in the future to connect veterans with each other, perhaps as a way to plan meetups and/or support groups.
A recent TIME magazine cover story declared that one U.S. soldier commits suicide per day. We want to help now, however we can.
(Note: the above article is subscribers-only, but more information can also be found here.)

Make a contribution to support the purchase of fliers, t-shirts, bumper stickers and rich media ads. Backers will be honored in their own special section of the StillFighting.org website, along with additional perks.


All funds will be used to support this project and expenses listed on the StillFighting.org blog.



An online community is only as sucessful as its participants, so we want to get the word out quickly to those who will use this forum. Here are some of the ideas that I've had which will require funding, though I am also open to suggestions from contributors:


Fliers: I have about 5,000 of these. We've already flown to DC once to distribute these at the Marine Corp Marathon and the Washington DC VA Medical Center, but it will be more cost-effective to ship them to centers and businesses which have agreed to display them. We'd love to send these out specifically to non-profits with similiar missions. Most of the funds that I hope to raise will go towards the printing and shipping of these fliers.



T-shirts with the StillFighting.org logo and domain name will be sold through an online store, with any profit either going towards the maintenance of the site or a specified charity. This will also help to spread the word. I also plan to give them out at local amateur fights and to local gyms, but it would be great to be able to ship these and other free items such as bumper stickers to outside locations, including veterans' hospitals or even military bases.



Rich Media Banners will be purchased for placement on relevant websites and blogs. These will be intelligently targeted to those who are searching for a place where they can talk openly with their peers of similar experience.





I'm still working on the vbulletin skin and will be detailing my progress on the StillFighting.org blog. But while I've got that covered, there's always room for more help:


Volunteer as a Moderator... Do you know a registered health care professional who would be willing to help? Please encourage that person to volunteer their attention as a moderator of the boards.


Participate... Get on the forums and talk to these veterans, ask questions and give back by being there when they need someone to connect with. Check out the existing blogs or create and share one yourself.


Link Up... Link to StillFighting.org or this campaign in order to raise awareness not only of the issue, but of this potential tool for dealing with symptoms. If you've got a similar project, let me know and I'll add a link to your site.


Spread the word... If you know anyone who might find this project of interest, either as a funder or community member, then let them know. That old cliche about "...if it helps one person" actually applies here. I appreciate your help.

story:
Hi! I'm Ernest.

I, with a group of like-minded individuals, put up a local fitness/MMA gym in Iloilo City, Philippines.


VIEW MAP


The idea is simple... create a self-sustaining business that will promote sports and wellness, and keep youngsters off the streets.

Soon, the number of interested youngsters, MMA enthusiasts, and fighters increased. Demand for better facilities and equipment has also increased. To make money, some of the more experienced fighters instruct and help younger kids develop their skills and promote positive attitude.

We'd love to support these young, talented, and respectful people but we can only do so much with our current resources.

What We Need

Primarily, what we need are improvement of our facility and additional training gear. We also need funds to support the athletes for their upcoming fights.
 
This is how our gym looks. It's crude, yet warm and welcoming.
 
As you can see, our floor is hard, unfinished concrete. We lack headgear, pads, and mitts. Our grappling mat is just made of improvised foam and tarp. It crumples and rough on fighters' bodies.

Thankfully, some equipment were donated by generous trainees.
 
We already had a team of trainers and specialists (Jiujitsu, Wrestling, Muay Thai, and Boxing). They are a wonderful bunch of people that are willing to train interested youngsters and they ask for better equipment and fight gear.
 
At the top of my mind, these are the things we need:
 
  • Rubber Mat Flooring (to prevent blisters and soften falls)
  • MMA and Boxing Gloves
  • Punching and Kicking Mitts
  • More Heavy Bags
  • Head Gear
  • Body Gear
  • Grappling Mat
  • Groin Guards

 

The Impact of Your Donation

I was a troubled teen myself and realized sports can be a great source of motivation and direction. Dedication to any sport, particularly "fighting" sports, encourages an individual to have self-discipline, better fitness, and harbor a stable mind. Consequently, it keeps youngsters off drugs, street violence, and other bad stuff.
 
We (The Gym) are gradually gaining respect from our community as a organization that molds young minds and characters in a positive way.
 
We have young capable men. And they have ambitions to fight internationally for honor and to improve financial standing. All they need is a good place to train. Your donations will definitely be appreciated!

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us get the word out! Thank you very much!

story:
CONTINUED EFFORTS:

When this campaign is over, you can still support our efforts and help save the Universe at

www.episodezero.org

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

THE CAMPAIGN

krewedelusion is a New Orleans satirical Mardi Gras Krewe, and we’d like to invite you to participate in saving the Universe with us.

We’ve got a plan, and it’s called episode Ø.

On this upcoming Winter Solstice, December 21, 2012, the Mesoamerican Long Count calendar will end its 5,125 year cycle and there is a widespread belief that the world will end in a catastrophic global apocalyptic doomsday. 

Rather than join in the panic over the end the world, we are embrace the belief of the Mayans and Olmec that this day would be a time of great transformation and a cause for grandiose celebration.  

If, for just one day, we can stop the global rage and violence that pervade our communities and instead, unify in public outrageousness and joy, we can then parade harmoniously into our future.     

episode Ø shall be "the parade to begin all parades,” and we want you there.  We want your input. We want your support.

THINK LOCALLY ACT GLOBALLY!

New Orleans has a secret – a unique kind of freedom and joy, and those who live here excel in celebrating. We want you to embrace the spirit of this secret!  No matter where you are, get New Orleanized.

PARADE LOGISTICS

Our project has many practical challenges, and we hope to raise far and above the set goal for this IndieGoGo project.

The project goal is set at the projected costs for the permit, police protection and insurance -- the bare bone necessities for this happening.  If we meet this goal, we will be able to roll, however, we’d like to make episode Ø as grandiose as possible, so we need your help!  We’d like to extend the invitation to all the individuals and groups whose actions against violence inspire us.  We’d like to invite you! 

Finally, the parade will end at the New Orleans Cosmic Convergence Festival, a 14 hour party extravaganza hosted by Giorgio A. Tsoukalos, the star of History Channel’s Ancient Aliens.  There will be music, costumes and benevolent space creatures with extremely good dancing skills.  It’s party of Cosmic proportions, the likes of which has never been seen before! Check it out at www.cosmicfestnola.com

OUR BIGGEST CHALLENGE  

Practical and pragmatic logistics aside, our biggest challenge is to actually convince everyone on Earth to simply decide to end the rage and have just one day without murder.

Join us in an outrageous New Orleans style celebration of life. We want to reach everyone.

Before we planted the Seeds of Revolution, immersed in the Deepwater Delusion and grew the Roots of the Future… There was episode Ø.

Make the Vow. Save the Universe. Let the world know that you believe it can happen!

We’re off!

story:
The Mill Creek Farm

In 2005, two young women who were passionate about farming and food education saw an opportunity to start an educational urban farm on vacant land in West Philadelphia. The Mill Creek Farm grew out of this vision. The project reclaimed the blighted lot at 49th and Brown Streets, adjacent to an active community garden, and transformed it into a productive, dynamic space for environmental education and food access for the community.

The Mill Creek Farm has been a leader in the urban farming movement in Philadelphia, serving as an educational resource, demonstrating green building methods as well as sustainable agriculture, providing access to fresh produce in the neighborhood, and allowing visitors to connect with nature, inspiring creative solutions to environmental challenges.

Now, as we approach our 8th growing season in 2013, the staff and board of the Mill Creek Farm need your support to seize this opportunity to transition to a new phase and build a  stronger and more sustainable staff structure for our farm and education programs. Mill Creek Farm’s staff wear many hats. They are farmers. They are educators. They are administrators. They are fund-raisers. We want our farm staff to be able to focus on what’s most important: growing fresh food and running what is a staple farm education program in Philadelphia. The Mill Creek Farm aims to hire an Executive Director to manage the organization’s development, outreach, and planning, and enable the farm staff to do what they do best, and we need initial seed funding to make that happen.

With your contribution, Mill Creek Farm will be able to hire an experienced Executive Director who can focus on the administrative, planning, and fundraising needs, giving us the support to grow more food, work with more urban youth, and strengthen the  community.

We need your help to plant the seed.

We need additional funding to hire an Executive Director. If we do not reach our $20,000 goal and are unable to hire an Executive Director at this time, all contributions will still go to support the farm’s operations and educational programs.
 
All donations are tax-deductible and will be rewarded by perks that mirror our mission, but most importantly, you will get the satisfaction of knowing that you have stepped up in support of an educational urban farm that will continue to serve the Mill Creek neighborhood and the West Philadelphia community for years to come.

Your Impact

Your support will help the farm maintain improved fresh food access, environmental benefits (storm water management, reduction of noise and the urban ‘heat island’ effect, removal of litter, site beautification), and education programs, which attract people from the immediate neighborhood, all over the city, and the world. The farm inspires visitors, enabling them to see solutions in action and envision how they can creatively address environmental challenges. Involvement with the farm fosters environmental stewardship and civic engagement, giving youth more information to make choices for a healthy life and affect positive change in their communities.

Kids like Joe and Ray (who you can see in the video above) come by the farm to learn and explore,  gaining skills such as planting and caring for a garden. Experiences like harvesting and tasting food fresh from the field help to nurture and reinforce healthy habits.  After volunteering as a young kid, our neighbor Mark came back several years later for a summer job, developing communication skills and confidence, and gaining experience with marketing and customer service.

Over the course of 7 years, we have built relationships with people of all backgrounds: dedicated customers who have come to rely on our fresh vegetables, many seniors who grew up on farms in the South and love our fresh okra; teachers who bring their students back again and again; volunteers who help maintain the farm; and supporters who help to spread the word and contribute to our work.

With your support, the Mill Creek Farm will continue to build  on these successes.  

Other Ways You Can Help

We know some people can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Please help us spread the word about this campaign!

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to share with your friends and family!

 

www.millcreekurbanfarm.org

story:
Esel Aue - Donkey Aue - Eşek Aue

 

Ein Projekt Menschen für Menschen im Einklang mit der Natur

 

 

Ein Bauernhof soll in den nächsten Wochen erworben und zum LebensLernOrt (im Aufbau) Esel Aue ausgebaut werden.

Hier wird Menschen die Möglichkeit zum Leben, Wohnen und Arbeiten geboten sowie soziale Verantwortung zu übernehmen.

Das Angebot richtet sich sowohl an junge Menschen, die Orientierung und Unterstützung suchen, sowie an Menschen jeden Alters, die in dieser hektischen Welt Entschleunigung benötigen.

 

AUSZEIT. Es soll ein Raum für Ruhe und Besinnung geschaffen werden, der die Verbindung mit der Natur erlebbar macht. Reflektion der bisherigen Lebensstruktur und Regeneration oder Neubeginn nach oder während einer Krise sollen ermöglicht werden.

Zwei eigenständige, sich ergänzende Projekte sollen hier verwirklicht werden.

Die Eselschule bietet Eselgestützte Bildungs-Programme an und Camp Josef wird der außerschulische ökologisch ausgerichtete Lern- und Arbeitsort auf dem Land.

Im Zeichen des demografischen Wandels soll Wissen generationsübergreifend transferiert werden.

 

Die Eselschule wird Ihr bereits bestehendes Programm auf dem Hof ansiedeln und bietet Fortbildungen in systemischem Lernen mit Eseln an. Der Hof bietet die Möglichkeit das Programm um Langzeitplätze und fortlaufende Tagestruktur zu erweitern. (Praktika, Hospitationen, Mitarbeit, protected buisness) Begleitete Auszeiten und Naturerlebnis-Zeiten mit Eseln in Form verschiedener Projekte sind geplant. Info unter www.dieEselschule.de

 

 

Camp Josef bietet die Möglichkeit durch praktisches Tun, landwirtschaftliches, gartenbauliches sowie handwerkliches Wissen und Können in den eigenen Möglichkeiten zu erlernen.

Die sozialen Kompetenzen der Hofbewohner sollen gefördert und gefestigt werden. Teilnehmer sollen motiviert werden Lebensmodelle zu entwickeln, die Ihren Fähigkeiten und Vorstellungen entsprechen.

Die Umgebung soll die Nähe zur Natur fördern und der Rhythmus des Hoflebens lässt ein neues Verhältnis zum eigenen Rhythmus entstehen.

Fortbildungsseminare verschiedener Fachrichtungen und begleitetes Arbeiten mit Tieren werden neben der landwirtschaftlichen Eigenversorgung des Hofs und der Gemeinschaft in Zukunft die Säulen des Zusammenlebens sein.

Der Hof soll verschiedenen einheimischen Tierarten einen artgerechten Lebensraum bieten.  Die Tiere sind Bestandteile des Hoflebens und tragen durch Ihre Anwesenheit zum Wohlbefinden der Bewohner und Besucher bei und Ihre Produkte zur Versorgung des Hofes.

Schlachtungen sind aus ethischen Gründen ausgeschlossen.

 

Workshops, Seminare und professionell begleitete handwerkliche Projekte zur Instandsetzung und Unterhaltung der Hofanlage und deren Arbeitsmitteln ergänzen das Angebot.

Der Hof wird als Genossenschaft Esel Aue e.G. geführt.

Zur Durchführung des Projekts sind wie auf aktive Unterstützung angewiesen.

Die Eselaue möchte sich nicht in finanzielle Abhängigkeiten von Banken und Sparkassen begeben. Ihr Geld kommt direkt dem Projekt zugute und wirkt somit der Gewinnmaximierung von Banken und Geldinstituten entgegen.

 

Die Projektüberwachung wird von fachlich qualifizierten Mitgliedern des Fördervereins Klüttekötter eV. ehrenamtlich ausgeführt.

 

Für weitere Informationen stehe ich gerne als Ansprechpartner zur Verfügung.

Danke für Ihre Aufmerksamkeit

Team Eselaue

 

Friedhelm Willems

f-willems@kluettekoetter.de

f-willems@kluettekoetter.de

story:
This is the Leave a Life Legacy Indiegogo campaign.

HISTORY

I’m Laura Scearce. I was raised in Mount Vernon Iowa. I graduated from University of Northern Iowa in May 2012. I founded Leave a Life Legacy and am now operating it full-time.

My Grandpa Jerry was the inspiration. Unfortunately he died of cancer in 2008. He always had interesting stories, but he died before I could record them.  I hope to help other people and their loved ones record their stories and make a book or DVD.

WHY IT’S IMPORTANT

Everyone has a story that deserves to be told and remembered for future generations. As the baby boomers are reaching retirement age, it is becoming increasingly important to get those stories preserved.

HOW WE CAN HELP

Clients come to me for interviews (audio or video), transcription, editing, consultation, book and DVD creation, and we are developing a one-of-a-kind website that will help people tell their stories.

LEAVE A LIFE LEGACY TEAM

There are more people who are on the Leave a Life Legacy team. Pete Schares graduated from University of Northern Iowa with a degree in English, and is the main editor for Leave a Life Legacy. Jacob Levinson graduated from Iowa State University with a degree in Computer Science, and will be developing the website for Leave a Life Legacy.

OUR GOAL

Our goal is to raise $5000 by Jan 31st. With this we will buy video recording equipment, video editing software, printer and printing supplies, marketing, and develop the website.

PERKS

We have many perks that we know you will love. Keep updated with our campaign. Support Leave a Life Legacy with a magnet and pens. Try a life story interview for yourself or a loved one, by phone toll-free. You can get a transcript and a book of your story.  Check out all the perks on this website.

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

There are many ways you can help. Tell everyone you know about Leave a Life Legacy and this campaign. Like us on Facebook. Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Our email is leavealifelegacy@gmail.com

Thank you for checking out the Leave a Life Legacy Indiegogo campaign. By helping us you will help others preserve their story. Let’s get those stories told!
story_txt:
This is the Leave a Life Legacy Indiegogo campaign.
HISTORY
I’m Laura Scearce. I was raised in Mount Vernon Iowa. I graduated from University of Northern Iowa in May 2012. I founded Leave a Life Legacy and am now operating it full-time.
My Grandpa Jerry was the inspiration. Unfortunately he died of cancer in 2008. He always had interesting stories, but he died before I could record them.  I hope to help other people and their loved ones record their stories and make a book or DVD.
WHY IT’S IMPORTANT
Everyone has a story that deserves to be told and remembered for future generations. As the baby boomers are reaching retirement age, it is becoming increasingly important to get those stories preserved.
HOW WE CAN HELP
Clients come to me for interviews (audio or video), transcription, editing, consultation, book and DVD creation, and we are developing a one-of-a-kind website that will help people tell their stories.

story:
TOUGH COOKIE SHOP KESAKO?

Fondé en septembre 2012, “TOUGH COOKIE SHOP” est un lieu atypique où l’on peut faire du shopping, déguster de délicieux cookies, se faire tatouer et le tout dans un cadre sublimé par des artistes urbains qui le réinventent chaque mois.

1 an déjà que les Vikings ont pris place dans cette charmante bourgade qu’est Boulogne-Billancourt. A mi-chemin entre le village et la ville, elle nous rappelle des quartiers de Brooklyn !!!

A nos débuts on nous prenait pour des « Originaux » qui faisaient fausse  route en nous implantant dans un quartier isolé de tous commerces.

Aujourd’hui votre fidélité, vos sourires et vos soutiens au quotidien nous confortent dans l’idée que nous avons fait le bon choix et qu’il ne faut surtout pas s’arrêter en si bon chemin.

Un local plus important et mieux situé se libère à quelques centaines de mètres de là où nous sommes ; Des occasions comme celle-là sont rares dans la vie d’entrepreneurs et nous avons décidé de la saisir !!!

Toutefois si nous voulons ouvrir dans un délai raisonnable (début octobre pour la fin du 1er niveau pour  ouverture au public) et réaliser les travaux titanesques qui nous attendent, votre aide nous est indispensable.

QUELS SERONT LES CHANGEMENTS?

Nous allons enfin pouvoir vous accueillir dans un vrai salon de thé, où vous pourrez déguster « assis » confortablement nos cookies divins ( Les Cookies de Monttessuy) et de délicieux Cheese Cake.

Création d’une carte « Tea Time », avec un large choix de thés, café, smoothies (boissons à base de fruits frais).

Un salon de Piercing et Tattoo plus spacieux afin de répondre à votre demande grandissante.

Un espace également  plus important dédié aux artistes.

DE COMBIEN AVONS NOUS BESOIN ET A QUOI LES FONDS SERONT UTILISES?

Les travaux de remise aux normes ainsi que la façade ont été estimés à 150000$ (soit environ 110000€).

détails :

*Electricité

*Maçonnerie

*Sols

*Assainissements des murs

*Plomberie

*Ventilation

*Création d’une vitrine

*Rideau  métallique 

 

UNE AUTRE FAÇON DE NOUS AIDER

Si vous ne pouvez pas donner et même si vous pouvez d’ailleurs, partagez notre projet avec vos familles, vos amis, vos collègues, vos voisins, vos amants, vos animaux enfin avec tout le monde entier.

Dites leurs via Facebook, Tweeter, mail, texto et même par la poste que nous sommes géniaux, sympas et que l’on mérite ce Méga coup de main.

Par avance merci de votre soutien, on vous envoi pleins de bisous qui piquent.

 

QUI SOMMES-NOUS?

Jadis 2 restaurateurs aguerris avec 13 ans d’expériences chacun, Delphine avant l’aventure était Chef Barmaid au restaurant la « Maison Blanche » (Paris 8eme) et Olivier Directeur du Restaurant "Bon" (Paris 16eme).

Aujourd’hui ces 2 Vikings sont devenus des commerçants bien dans leurs sabots et prêts à relever de nouveaux défis !!!

 

 

Illustrations by Atomike : www.atomike-studio.com

Motion by Sick : www.sick-mg.fr

story:
Short Summary

Six years ago, I had this idea to promote small businesses across Africa but somehow the idea just wasn’t kicking off. So, I kept my dreams locked up and kept on with life.

Fast forward to 2013 – I decided to pick it up again and run with it, all my life I was told to keep my dreams within my means; I never thought anyone would care to read what I had to say on Whoot Africa ( www.whootafrica.com )

Somehow, 1 click became 20,000 and more with every passing day, notes of commendations came in on days when It all felt crazy, over 32 interviews on paper in 32 weeks barely 8 months into the journey.

I love Whoot Africa

I am passionate about Whoot Africa

I love exploring new businesses, start-ups and experiences

I love the networking opportunities

Above all, here is my chance to show the world the African innovation and creativity in my own little way. It is also a chance to give small, growing African businesses a chance at survival and a chance to make it into the big league and be an avenue for reducing unemployment and poverty on the continent.

I would love to travel around Africa, with my mobile studio and capture emerging businesses, and the real stories behind them..

I am asking your help to make a dream of mine a reality

My finances cannot pay for my dreams, but I can with your help….

This is I storming the gates of my dreams.

Olushola Pacheco - Just a girl with a dream!!!


  What We Need & What You Get

A MOBILE STUDIO

v  2 Sony HXR-NXSP NXCAM PAL 

v  1 TV MONITORS

v  A MIXER

v  2 TRIPODS

v  NECESSARY OUTPUT & INPUT DEVICES (LIGHTING, MICROPHONES et.al.

v  A PRODUCTION TEAM


WHAT YOU GET?

  • WE CONTINUE TO COVER SMALL BUSINESSES, THEIR GROWTH AND MARKETING NEEDS FOR FREE.
  • WE WILL CONTINUE TO USE OUR PLATFORM TO SUPPORT SOCIAL GOOD AND GIVE BACK TO BETTER AS MANY COMMUNITIES AS WE CAN
  • AN OPPORTUNITY TO SUPPORT GROWING AFRICAN BUSINESSES TO CREATE MORE EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES AND THROUGH THEIR SUCCESS REDUCE POVERTY ON THE CONTINENT.
  • IF YOU EVER HAVE THE NEED TO SHOWCASE YOUR START UP, WE WILL ALWAYS BE THERE TO OFFER YOU A VOICE ON OUR PLATFORM


The Impact


  • We have been showcasing businesses from behind a desk for 8 months now, the response to us only means one thing - We can do more with a camera in hand.
  • Three businesses showcased on Whoot Africa have gone on to secure further funding to expand their businesses - Well!!! Glad we could help..
  • We have built trust and continue to build relationships with business owners, supporting us will mean more networking for us, which will be beneficial to other businesses.



Other Ways You Can Help

We understands that some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Tell your friends to tell a friend, and help get the word out and make some noise about Whoot Africa's on the road campaign to showcase even more African brands on camera
  • Kindly explore and  use the Indiegogo share tools to help promote this campaign


And that’s all there is to it.... We hope you support us!!!

Whoot Africa business show, coming soon to a TV network close to you.... 

Whoot Africa!!! Promoting African Businesses.

story:
What is Steve Buresh's Cheesecake Store all about?

After losing my job in 2011 I felt I was going to lose everything. I started the Cheesecake Store to help to support my family while I looked for a new job. Jobs were hard to obtain with such a high unemployment rate, at the time. So, I strapped on my boots and walked and talked The Cheesecake Store to anyone that would listen. With help from my friends I kept going. On my own, I built a website to sell my products.  In order for me to sell to the public, I used a community commercial-rental kitchen.  I transformed my family vehicle into the the Cheesecake mobile, which then became a certified mobile vendor vehicle!  The rental kitchen I use is far away from home, so I really need a closer kitchen with a retail shop so everyone in the southwest suburbs of Chicago can stop and have a cheesecake jar ,a cup of coffee and a place to sit and chat. Since I have exhausted every loan option with the banks to no avail, I need your help.  You will forever be a part of my cheesecake family.

What We Need & What You Get

The $10,000 that I am seeking will help me open a small retail shop with a commercial kitchen.

  • My plan for this funding is to purchase commercial baking equipment,  obtain health permits, vender  permits, local and state permits, building permits, construction costs, and supplies.
  • Even if I don't reach my funding goal, every little bit helps to get a step closer to making my dream a reality.
  • If you or someone you know is an investor, please contact me so we can talk more in detail.
  • I've made some awesome perks for you helping me, and those are just the starting points. You will always be remembered as a part of my cheesecake family. with many more perks after these.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t financially contribute, there are other ways to help:

  • Please help me get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools and Facebook share!
  • You can also message me if you would like to discuss helping out at fairs and events.

story:
*Update*

We have reached 10% of our target - contributors include Toast the dog...big bark out to him! One third of contributors at this early stage are worldwide strangers who just 'love the concept'...with less than 2 days left please join in and help us reach our target and make the improvements for our users. Stephen x

Introduction

I’m Stephen King an entrepreneur, cross media creative, genealogist, and fit diabetic of 29 years born and raised in Scotland. Throughout my life I have worked across creative industries both as a self-inspired artist and as a professional. While doing this I have also worked for charitable organisations and created and lead a unique Scottish young people’s theatre, and was a key team member in the design and creation of Scotland’s only Refuge for Young Runaways.

I am always creating! In Scotland that can mean being very ‘attention seeking’…and as a child I think I did my fair share of that! This is my sketch from a photo of me probably just about to let it all out!

Reunitems.com

Reunitems.com is a new website with its interest across a timeline yesterday to yesteryear, reuniting people with recently lost property, selling and auctioning retro, antique and collectable items, and repatriating users with family heirlooms and providing genealogists with tactile items to add to 1 dimensional family trees, and giving them a new search resource and archive.

 Is this the ‘next big thing’? Combining 2 of the highest earning markets while introducing a 3rd huge new market and marrying them altogether…it’s set to be just that!

We list recently lost & found items – we auction and sell desired retro, antiques and collectable items – we repatriate families with their forefathers’ heirlooms and provide a searchable archive of genealogical name tagged items. Having surveyed our current pioneering members and others we concluded that we should develop the design and functionality of the site and add an app at this time in order to satisfy and attract the numerous members of our broad user group. It is important to launch this with the simultaneous first phase broadcast of our 10 second advertisement ( http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=flLPAltEX9Y )

We need £15,000 to make our campaign successful

£5000.00 will be spent on the redesign & development of the website, and £1000.00 on development of a phone app. £3500.00 on the first phase broadcast of our 10sec advertisement. The remainder will cover our business costs for the next year, including Office Space rental, utilities, telephone and internet connection, and printing costs and postage for our perks.

Perks

On offer for your pledges:

  1. For a £300.00 pledge, you will receive a Genealogical consultation resulting in a 4 to 6 generation family tree & report by Stephen King. Limited to 10 pledges. At consultation stage you can decide how thorough your search will be and any future and additional costs will be forecast.

  2. For a £200.00 pledge, you will receive 1 month advertising for your business in a horizontal banner the width of the page on reunitems.com. Lost & Found users come from across the world and include all the family. Sales in the Retro, Antiques & Collectables area have been  made in New Zealand, Australia, the USA and the UK. Our Genealogical section draws worldwide interest too and we have contact with international family history societies.

  3. For a £100.00 pledge, you will receive 1 month advertising for your business in a vertical banner sized 160x600 pixels on reunitems.com.  Lost & Found users come from across the world and include all the family. Sales in the Retro, Antiques & Collectables area have been  made in New Zealand, Australia, the USA and the UK. Our Genealogical section draws worldwide interest too and we have contact with international family history societies.

  4. For a £25.00 pledge, you will receive a 8 x 10 inch Giclee print of the art work signed and authenticated by the artist Stewart Swan titled ‘ Grand Old Duke ‘ The painting is based on a character from the east end of Glasgow - a tough area of the city where historically many of the young men were members of many of the local boxing clubs and where gang fighting was popular. More on Stewart and his work can be found at http://stewartswan.wordpress.com/

  5. For a £25.00 pledge, you will receive an 8 x 10inch Giclee print of the art work signed and authenticated by the artist Louis Lau titled ‘Untitled ‘ .You may be gifted a 16 x 20 inches limited edition photographic print numbered 3/10 by the artist framed in white washed museum quality and acid free Tulip Wood valued at £800.00. http://www.louis-lau.com

  6. For a £10.00 pledge, you will receive a A3 poster print ( in a poster tube ) of the Sampler dated 1903 and made by Victorian schoolgirl Maggie Grant. You will see Maggie's Sampler announced on our Successful Repatriations page at the time of this Campaign going live. The old St Joseph's school which Maggie acknowledges at the foot of the Sampler is now the Smuggler's Hostel in Tomintoul, Morayshire, Scotland. Details of how we found the origins of the Sampler and images of records researched, can be seen on the website at the 'Succesful Repatriations' page.

  7. For a £5.00 pledge, you will receive 1 month shop subscription worth £10.00


 

Stuart Swan 'Grand Old Duke'

Louis Lau 'Untitled'

Both the Painting and the photoraphic print we appreciate as collectables of tomorrow. Maggies' Sampler remains a collectable today from yesteryear. We are attempting to provide in our pledges, a mix of desirable items spanning out timeline yesterday to yesteryear.

Art can be such a good investment and you can have a valuable signed print of these talented and sought after artists which can grow in value. On the reverse it will be acknowledged that you have participated with pioneering spirit in Reunitems.com and this may increase its value too when it becomes a collectable in its own right or in landmarking this era in web activity. You could be gifted the original too! Maggie Grant’s Sampler – the poster print of this 111 year old sampler will, on the reverse, acknowledge that that you have participated with pioneering spirit in Reunitems.com and this may increase its value too when it becomes a collectable in its own right or in landmarking this era in web activity. You could be gifted the original too!

The Adverts are offered on a first come first served basis across the first 6 months of the restyled site – where possible we will schedule your ad at your chosen time.

We believe most of our possessions will outlive us and we are therefor temporary custodians of everything. To this end, the Sampler could be loved and looked after by a non family member until one turns up. At this time the owner can decide if they are ready to part with it or may be able to forecast to the family when they would. Alternatively they could offer a copy or arrange to let them visit and see the item etc.

As you see the site encourages good karma and charitable giving and direct gifting, alongside opportunities for users to make some extra money. It is important to understand that every user listing a Genealogical item can have a different motivation and each is valid. We have created a system which allows for every such item to be sold on to anyone and have safeguarded that the rightful owner or qualifying family member or organisation perhaps, will still be able to trace the current owner/custodian through our archive, in order to claim the item or offer a payment.

The Impact

This is a world first providing the opportunity to have our things returned to us – forever things…all items we and our families have been separated from across time! Finding your recently lost item listed on Reunitems.com will reduce your panic and may save you having to go through the pain of cancelling credit cards etc.

Finding a sought after Retro, Antique or Collectable item on our site which only allows genuine originals and is used by historical enthusiasts will mean you can be sure you don't have to search around other sites where such items are not given prime attention.

Finding a well designed or classic item from the past...perhaps with your initials on it, or being repatriated with an item which had belonged to or was handled by a previous family member may reconnect you and complete a cirle for you, and bring you close to them and gain a sense of how they lived.

Individual Good Samaritans AND Commercial Businesses and Public Buildings, including nightclubs and public buildings and galleries list ‘yesterday’ lost and left behind property.

Retro, antique and collector traders and shops, and charity and cash convertor shops list these desired items and some genealogical items.

While worldwide typical users, and family history society members and individual amateur and professional genealogists list and search for items from ‘yesteryear’ family members.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you have skills to share or may be interested in investment I would be delighted to meet you and discuss your offer. Bookmark us, Sign up as a member, and add us on facebook or help to share this project with people that you know via the Indiegogo Share page.

Reunitems.com 

 Reunitems.com is a new website with its interest across a timeline yesterday to yesteryear, reuniting people with recently lost property, selling and auctioning retro, antique and collectable items, and repatriating users with family heirlooms and providing genealogists with tactile items to add to 1 dimensional family trees, and giving them a new search resource and archive. Is this the ‘next big thing’? Combining 2 of the highest earning markets while introducing a 3rd huge new market and marrying them altogether…it’s set to be just that!

We list recently lost & found items – we auction and sell desired retro, antiques and collectable items – we repatriate families with their forefathers’ heirlooms and provide a searchable archive of genealogical name tagged items.

Having surveyed our current pioneering members and others we concluded that we should develop the design and functionality of the site and add an app at this time in order to satisfy and attract the numerous members of our broad user group. It is important to launch this with the simultaneous first phase broadcast of our 10 second advertisement ( http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=flLPAltEX9Y )



We need £15,000 to make our campaign successful


£5000.00 will be spent on the redesign & development of the website, and £1000.00 on development of a phone app.

£3500.00 on the first phase broadcast of our 10sec advertisement. 

The remainder will cover our business costs for the next year, including Office Space rental, utilities, telephone and internet connection, and printing costs and postage for our perks.

The Adverts are offered on a first come first served basis across the first 6 months of the restyled site – where possible we will schedule your ad at your chosen time.

We believe most of our possessions will outlive us and we are therefor temporary custodians of everything. To this end, the Sampler could be loved and looked after by a non family member until one turns up. At this time the owner can decide if they are ready to part with it or may be able to forecast to the family when they would. Alternatively they could offer a copy or arrange to let them visit and see the item etc.

As you see the site encourages good karma and charitable giving and direct gifting, alongside opportunities for users to make some extra money. It is important to understand that every user listing a Genealogical item can have a different  motivation and each is valid. We have created a system which allows for every such item to be sold on to anyone and have safeguarded that the rightful owner or qualifying family member or organisation perhaps, will still be able to trace the current owner/custodian through our archive, in order to claim the item or offer a payment.

The Impact

This is a world first providing the opportunity to have our things returned to us – forever things…all items we and our families have been separated from across time!
Finding your recently lost item listed on Reunitems.com will reduce your panic and may save you having to go through the pain of cancelling credit cards etc.Finding a sought after Retro, Antique or Collectable item on our site which only allows genuine originals and is used by historical enthusiasts will mean you can be sure you don't have to search around other sites where such items are not given prime attention.Finding a well designed or classic item from the past...perhaps with your initials on it, or being repatriated with an item which had belonged to or was handled by a previous family member may reconnect you and complete a cirle for you, and bring you close to them and gain a sense of how they lived.

Individual Good Samaritans AND Commercial Businesses and Public Buildings, including nightclubs and public buildings and galleries list ‘yesterday’ lost and left behind property. 

Retro, antique and collector traders and shops, and charity and cash convertor shops list these desired items and some genealogical items.

While worldwide typical users, and family history society members and individual amateur and professional genealogists list and search for items from ‘yesteryear’ family members.
